Dataset | March Current Population Survey | …collects data from a different sample of households each year and thus cannot be used to track progress of individual households over time. Instead view how families of a similar financial status compare with each other over time. | [('…collects', 'NNS'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('different', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('each', 'DT'), ('year', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('thus', 'RB'), ('can', 'MD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('be', 'VB'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('track', 'VB'), ('progress', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('individual', 'JJ'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('over', 'IN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Instead', 'RB'), ('view', 'VB'), ('how', 'WRB'), ('families', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('similar', 'JJ'), ('financial', 'JJ'), ('status', 'NN'), ('compare', 'NN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('over', 'IN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | March Current Population Survey | …offers detailed individual level information on each person's veteran status and lists their service era if relavant, while also providing detailed self-reported information on numerous components of unearned income, including benefits from the Veterans Administration, Social Security and all other retirement and disability income. | [('…offers', 'NNS'), ('detailed', 'VBD'), ('individual', 'JJ'), ('level', 'NN'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('person', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('veteran', 'NN'), ('status', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('lists', 'VBZ'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('service', 'NN'), ('era', 'NN'), ('if', 'IN'), ('relavant', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('also', 'RB'), ('providing', 'VBG'), ('detailed', 'JJ'), ('self-reported', 'JJ'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('numerous', 'JJ'), ('components', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('unearned', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('including', 'VBG'), ('benefits', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Veterans', 'NNPS'), ('Administration', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('Social', 'NNP'), ('Security', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('all', 'DT'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('retirement', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('disability', 'NN'), ('income', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | General Social Survey | …relying on pooled cross-sectional data from the 1972 to 2010 General Social Survey (GSS), researchers use regional variation in macroeconomic conditions in the United States to identify the impact of economic shocks on the formation of preferences for redistribution. | [('…relying', 'VBG'), ('on', 'IN'), ('pooled', 'JJ'), ('cross-sectional', 'JJ'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1972', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2010', 'CD'), ('General', 'NNP'), ('Social', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('GSS', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('regional', 'JJ'), ('variation', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('macroeconomic', 'JJ'), ('conditions', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('identify', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('impact', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('economic', 'JJ'), ('shocks', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('formation', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('preferences', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('redistribution', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | General Social Survey | …using the information on respondent's location during adolescence, researchers rely on time- and location-specific shocks. This specification allows researchers to control for nonlinear time-period, and life-cycle and cohort effects, as well as a host of background variables and other time-varying regional characteristics, including level of wealth, differences in educational policies, overall level of inequality and crime. | [('…using', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('respondent', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('location', 'NN'), ('during', 'IN'), ('adolescence', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('rely', 'VBP'), ('on', 'IN'), ('time-', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('location-specific', 'JJ'), ('shocks', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('specification', 'NN'), ('allows', 'VBZ'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('control', 'VB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('nonlinear', 'JJ'), ('time-period', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('life-cycle', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('cohort', 'NN'), ('effects', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('as', 'RB'), ('well', 'RB'), ('as', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('host', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('background', 'NN'), ('variables', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('time-varying', 'JJ'), ('regional', 'JJ'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('including', 'VBG'), ('level', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('wealth', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('differences', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('educational', 'JJ'), ('policies', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('overall', 'JJ'), ('level', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('inequality', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('crime', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | World Value Survey | …the findings from the U.S.-based GSS data are confirmed by extending the analysis to a large set of countries. Researchers do so by linking preferences for redistribution to experiences of economic disasters during youth in a sample of 37 countries, using evidence from the World Value Survey. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('findings', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('U.S.-based', 'JJ'), ('GSS', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('confirmed', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('extending', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('analysis', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('a', 'DT'), ('large', 'JJ'), ('set', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('countries', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchers', 'NNS'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('so', 'RB'), ('by', 'IN'), ('linking', 'VBG'), ('preferences', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('redistribution', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('experiences', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('economic', 'JJ'), ('disasters', 'NNS'), ('during', 'IN'), ('youth', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('37', 'CD'), ('countries', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('using', 'VBG'), ('evidence', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('World', 'NNP'), ('Value', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 | …data from the National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 (NLS72) is utilized to corroborate the age-period-cohort specificationa and shed light on the mechanisms driving the results. | [('…data', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('National', 'NNP'), ('Longitudinal', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('High', 'NNP'), ('School', 'NNP'), ('Class', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1972', 'CD'), ('(', '('), ('NLS72', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('utilized', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('corroborate', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('age-period-cohort', 'JJ'), ('specificationa', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('shed', 'VBD'), ('light', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('mechanisms', 'NNS'), ('driving', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('results', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | General Social Survey | …to gauge the economic significance of the findings, researchers construct a exercise, using evidence from the GSS, of what would have happened to the percentage of people voting for the Democratic Party in the most recent election in the nine U.S. regions, if individuals living in that region had not experienced a recession when young. | [('…to', 'JJ'), ('gauge', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('economic', 'JJ'), ('significance', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('findings', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('construct', 'VBP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('exercise', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('using', 'VBG'), ('evidence', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('GSS', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('of', 'IN'), ('what', 'WP'), ('would', 'MD'), ('have', 'VB'), ('happened', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('percentage', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('people', 'NNS'), ('voting', 'VBG'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Democratic', 'JJ'), ('Party', 'NNP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('most', 'RBS'), ('recent', 'JJ'), ('election', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('nine', 'CD'), ('U.S.', 'NNP'), ('regions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('if', 'IN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('living', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('that', 'DT'), ('region', 'NN'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('experienced', 'VBN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('recession', 'NN'), ('when', 'WRB'), ('young', 'JJ'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | General Social Survey | …the GSS, conducted by the National Opinion Research Center at the University of Chicago, is a nationally representative sample for the United States of about 1,500 respondents each year from 1972 through 1993 (except for 1979, 1981, and 1992). It continues biennially, with 3,000 observations from 1994 to 2004, 4,500 observations in 2006, and 2,000 observations in 2008 and 2010. Researchers use all the data available from 1972 to 2010. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('GSS', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('conducted', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('National', 'NNP'), ('Opinion', 'NNP'), ('Research', 'NNP'), ('Center', 'NNP'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('University', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Chicago', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('nationally', 'RB'), ('representative', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('about', 'RB'), ('1,500', 'CD'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('each', 'DT'), ('year', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1972', 'CD'), ('through', 'IN'), ('1993', 'CD'), ('(', '('), ('except', 'IN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('1979', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1981', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('1992', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.'), ('It', 'PRP'), ('continues', 'VBZ'), ('biennially', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('with', 'IN'), ('3,000', 'CD'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1994', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2004', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('4,500', 'CD'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('2006', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('2,000', 'CD'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('2008', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('2010', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('all', 'PDT'), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('available', 'JJ'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1972', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2010', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | General Social Survey | …as measures for preferences for redistribution, researchers use the answers to three questions from the GSS referred to as "help poor", "assistance poor", and "work-luck". | [('…as', 'JJ'), ('measures', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('preferences', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('redistribution', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('answers', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('three', 'CD'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('GSS', 'NNP'), ('referred', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('as', 'IN'), ('``', '``'), ('help', 'NN'), ('poor', 'JJ'), ("''", "''"), (',', ','), ('``', '``'), ('assistance', 'NN'), ('poor', 'JJ'), ("''", "''"), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('``', '``'), ('work-luck', 'JJ'), ("''", "''"), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | General Social Survey | …the survey is conduced face-to-face with an in-person interview by the National Opinion Research Center at the University of Chicago of a randomly selected sample of adults (18 and older) who are not institutionalized. The survey takes about 90 minutes to administer. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('conduced', 'VBN'), ('face-to-face', 'NN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('in-person', 'JJ'), ('interview', 'NN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('National', 'NNP'), ('Opinion', 'NNP'), ('Research', 'NNP'), ('Center', 'NNP'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('University', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Chicago', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('randomly', 'RB'), ('selected', 'VBN'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('adults', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('18', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('older', 'JJR'), (')', ')'), ('who', 'WP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('institutionalized', 'VBN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('takes', 'VBZ'), ('about', 'IN'), ('90', 'CD'), ('minutes', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('administer', 'VB'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | General Social Survey | …the GSS contains information on census regions (but not on single states) in which the person was living when he or she was 16. Researchers use this information to match individuals with the macroeconomic shock in the region where the person was living during his or her youth. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('GSS', 'NNP'), ('contains', 'VBZ'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('census', 'NN'), ('regions', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('but', 'CC'), ('not', 'RB'), ('on', 'IN'), ('single', 'JJ'), ('states', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), ('in', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('the', 'DT'), ('person', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('living', 'VBG'), ('when', 'WRB'), ('he', 'PRP'), ('or', 'CC'), ('she', 'PRP'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('16', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('this', 'DT'), ('information', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('match', 'VB'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('macroeconomic', 'JJ'), ('shock', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('region', 'NN'), ('where', 'WRB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('person', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('living', 'VBG'), ('during', 'IN'), ('his', 'PRP$'), ('or', 'CC'), ('her', 'PRP$'), ('youth', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Bureau of Economic Analysis | …to have the longest possible time series, researchers contruct a measure of regional recessions using the data on region personal income from the Bureau of Economic Analysis. | [('…to', 'NNS'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('longest', 'JJS'), ('possible', 'JJ'), ('time', 'NN'), ('series', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('contruct', 'VBP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('measure', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('regional', 'JJ'), ('recessions', 'NNS'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('region', 'NN'), ('personal', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Economic', 'NNP'), ('Analysis', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Bureau of Economic Analysis | …the Bureau of Economic Analysis has been providing annual estimates of per capita personal income at the state level since 1929. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Economic', 'NNP'), ('Analysis', 'NNP'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('been', 'VBN'), ('providing', 'VBG'), ('annual', 'JJ'), ('estimates', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('per', 'IN'), ('capita', 'NN'), ('personal', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('state', 'NN'), ('level', 'NN'), ('since', 'IN'), ('1929', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Bureau of Economic Analysis | …the BEA also compiles data on gross state product, i.e., GDP at the regional level, but dating back only to 1963. Th correlation between real per capita personal income and real per capita GDP is 0.92. Researchers could have used regional unemployment rates as a measure of macroeconomic recessions; however, this variable is available only since 1968, from the BLS. As a result, they would lose too many observations. In the longitudinal analysis (which covers 1972 to 1986), researchers can use measures of the state unemployment rates. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('BEA', 'NNP'), ('also', 'RB'), ('compiles', 'VBZ'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('gross', 'JJ'), ('state', 'NN'), ('product', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('i.e.', 'FW'), (',', ','), ('GDP', 'NNP'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('regional', 'JJ'), ('level', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('but', 'CC'), ('dating', 'VBG'), ('back', 'RB'), ('only', 'RB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1963', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Th', 'VB'), ('correlation', 'NN'), ('between', 'IN'), ('real', 'JJ'), ('per', 'IN'), ('capita', 'JJ'), ('personal', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('real', 'JJ'), ('per', 'IN'), ('capita', 'NN'), ('GDP', 'NNP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('0.92', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchers', 'NNS'), ('could', 'MD'), ('have', 'VB'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('regional', 'JJ'), ('unemployment', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('as', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('measure', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('macroeconomic', 'JJ'), ('recessions', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('however', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('this', 'DT'), ('variable', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('available', 'JJ'), ('only', 'RB'), ('since', 'IN'), ('1968', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('BLS', 'NNP'), ('.', '.'), ('As', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('result', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('they', 'PRP'), ('would', 'MD'), ('lose', 'VB'), ('too', 'RB'), ('many', 'JJ'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('In', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('longitudinal', 'JJ'), ('analysis', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('which', 'WDT'), ('covers', 'VBZ'), ('1972', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1986', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('can', 'MD'), ('use', 'VB'), ('measures', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('state', 'NN'), ('unemployment', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 | …when using the panel analysis, researchers are able to control directly for the endowment effect as the NLS72 follows individuals during their formative age, therefore allowing them to control directly for the respondent's level of education, income, and labor market experience. | [('…when', 'NN'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('panel', 'NN'), ('analysis', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('able', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('control', 'VB'), ('directly', 'RB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('endowment', 'JJ'), ('effect', 'NN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('NLS72', 'NNP'), ('follows', 'VBZ'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('during', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('formative', 'JJ'), ('age', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('therefore', 'RB'), ('allowing', 'VBG'), ('them', 'PRP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('control', 'VB'), ('directly', 'RB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('respondent', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('level', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('education', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('income', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('labor', 'NN'), ('market', 'NN'), ('experience', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | General Social Survey | …given the nature of the dataset, it is difficult to compare the importance of the impressionable years versus other periods of live. Dataset | World Value Survey | …the WVS has been carried out five times (1981 to 1984, 1990 to 1993, 1995 to 1997, 1999 to 2004, and 2005 to 2007). Dataset | National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 | …the third dataset is the National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 (NLS72). This dataset provides a nationally representative sample of the high school population for the class fo 1972. Dataset | National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 | …data was collected during six years: 1972, 1973, 1974, 1976, 1979, and 1986. Data collected in the base year (1972) contains information on students' personal and family background. Follow-ups, conducted in 1973, 1974, 1976, 1979, and 1986, offer information on work, family, educational experience, and opinions since high school. The panel dimension of the survey is exploited from 1973 to 1986 and merged with sutdent's personal and family background obtained from the base year. | [('…data', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('collected', 'VBN'), ('during', 'IN'), ('six', 'CD'), ('years', 'NNS'), (':', ':'), ('1972', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1973', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1974', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1976', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1979', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('1986', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Data', 'NNP'), ('collected', 'VBD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('base', 'NN'), ('year', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('1972', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('contains', 'VBZ'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('students', 'NNS'), ("'", 'POS'), ('personal', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('family', 'NN'), ('background', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Follow-ups', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('conducted', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1973', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1974', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1976', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1979', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('1986', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('offer', 'VBP'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('work', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('family', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('educational', 'JJ'), ('experience', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('opinions', 'NNS'), ('since', 'IN'), ('high', 'JJ'), ('school', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('panel', 'NN'), ('dimension', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('exploited', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1986', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('merged', 'VBD'), ('with', 'IN'), ('sutdent', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('personal', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('family', 'NN'), ('background', 'NN'), ('obtained', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('base', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 | …despite the limitation of not having the cohort variation, this dataset has the advanatge of following respondents over time, including information on locations at the state level. Dataset | Bureau of Labor Statistics | …the data on state unemployment come from the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Dataset | National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 | …sample attrition in the survey is not systematic. One potential problem could be that more entrepreneurial subjects are more likely to leave their state of residence during a recession. This could increase the probability that they will drop out from the sample. Researchers do not believe this type of attrition is a concern, since the number of movers is similar to people with similar characteristics in datasets such as the Current Population Survey. | [('…sample', 'JJ'), ('attrition', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('not', 'RB'), ('systematic', 'JJ'), ('.', '.'), ('One', 'CD'), ('potential', 'JJ'), ('problem', 'NN'), ('could', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('that', 'IN'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('entrepreneurial', 'JJ'), ('subjects', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('likely', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('leave', 'VB'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('state', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('residence', 'NN'), ('during', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('recession', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('could', 'MD'), ('increase', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('probability', 'NN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('will', 'MD'), ('drop', 'VB'), ('out', 'RP'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchers', 'NNS'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('believe', 'VB'), ('this', 'DT'), ('type', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('attrition', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('concern', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('since', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('movers', 'NNS'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('similar', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('people', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('similar', 'JJ'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('datasets', 'NNS'), ('such', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 | …another way of using the NLS72 would be to look at the cross-section of individuals interviewed in 1986 and assign to each of them the average local unemployment rate fo the states where they lived. Dataset | National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 | …as was done with the General Social Survey, researchers split the sample between people who moved between states during the impressionable years and people who did not. Roughly 30% of the sample moved to a different state at least once between 18 and 25. The average is slightly higher than in the GSS. This is partly due to the fact that the NLS72 uses states and not regions as geographical units; therefore, people moving between states but within the same region are considered movers in the NLS72 but stayers in the GSS. Also the sample of the NLS72 is selected in the sense that includes people who finished high school who are typically more mobile than people who drop out of high school. | [('…as', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('done', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('General', 'NNP'), ('Social', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('split', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), Dataset | National Longitudinal Survey of the High School Class of 1972 | …the NLS72 is an important complement to the current study because individuals can be observed during their impressionable years and then eight years later. In addition, a wealth of information exists on personal background and personal experiences during the impressionable years. Dataset | General Social Survey | …there is more measurement error in the GSS than the NLS72 since individuals cannot be followed over time; in the GSS, the shock is identified at the regional level, not at the state level; the recession of 1979 could have had particularly strong effects on young adults. | [('…there', 'EX'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('measurement', 'JJ'), ('error', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('GSS', 'NNP'), ('than', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('NLS72', 'NNP'), ('since', 'IN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('can', 'MD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('be', 'VB'), ('followed', 'VBN'), ('over', 'IN'), ('time', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('GSS', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('shock', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('identified', 'VBN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('regional', 'JJ'), ('level', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('not', 'RB'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('state', 'NN'), ('level', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('the', 'DT'), ('recession', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('could', 'MD'), ('have', 'VB'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('particularly', 'RB'), ('strong', 'JJ'), ('effects', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('young', 'JJ'), ('adults', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Computer and Internet Use Supplements | …representative of the entire United States population and interviews approximately 50,000 households containing information on computer and Internet use, including detailed data on types and location of use. | [('…representative', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('entire', 'JJ'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('population', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('interviews', 'NNS'), ('approximately', 'RB'), ('50,000', 'CD'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('containing', 'VBG'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('computer', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Internet', 'NNP'), ('use', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('including', 'VBG'), ('detailed', 'VBN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('types', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('location', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Basic Monthly Files | …households in the Current Population Survey are interviewed each month over a 4-month period, and eight months later they are re-interviewed in each month of a second 4-month period; this rotation pattern makes it possible to match information on individuals in a CIUS who are in their first 4 month rotation period to information from the same month in their second 4 month rotation period. | [('…households', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('interviewed', 'VBN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('month', 'NN'), ('over', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('4-month', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('eight', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('later', 'RB'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('re-interviewed', 'JJ'), ('in', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('month', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('second', 'JJ'), ('4-month', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('this', 'DT'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('pattern', 'NN'), ('makes', 'VBZ'), ('it', 'PRP'), ('possible', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('match', 'VB'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('CIUS', 'NNP'), ('who', 'WP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('first', 'JJ'), ('4', 'CD'), ('month', 'NN'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('period', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('information', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('same', 'JJ'), ('month', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('second', 'JJ'), ('4', 'CD'), ('month', 'NN'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('period', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | FRBNY Consumer Credit Panel | …the panel comprises a nationally representative 5% random sample of United States individuals with credit files, and all of the household members of those 5%, in all including files on more than 15% of the adult population (aged 18 or older), or approximately 37 million individuals in each quarter from 1999 to present. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('panel', 'NN'), ('comprises', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('nationally', 'RB'), ('representative', 'JJ'), ('5', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('random', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('credit', 'NN'), ('files', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('all', 'DT'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('household', 'NN'), ('members', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('5', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('including', 'VBG'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('15', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('adult', 'NN'), ('population', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('aged', 'VBN'), ('18', 'CD'), ('or', 'CC'), ('older', 'JJR'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('or', 'CC'), ('approximately', 'RB'), ('37', 'CD'), ('million', 'CD'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('quarter', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1999', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('present', 'VB'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Consumer Finances | …the 2007 component of the 2007 to 2009 Survey of Consumer Finances panel was conducted as part of the seuence of triennial cross-sectional Survey of Consumer Finances surveys. After the 2007 Survey of Consumer Finances was largely completed, the Federal Reserve Board designed and implemented the 2009 follow-up survey to provide a fuller picture of the effects of the intervening recession on households' finances than was available from aggregate data. The 2009 survey's structure largely mirrored that of the 2007 survey so that it is possible to construct parallel estimates of wealth and its component for each household in both years. | [('…the', Dataset | Survey of Consumer Finances | …the 2009 survey collected a variety of data on changes in households' situations between 2007 and 2009, including whether the household had moved. For households that owned a home in 2007 and had moved by 2009, this information includes whether the household retained ownership of their 2007 residence and, if so, whether the property was still the household's primary residence. Based on these questions, researchers classify families that owned their home in 2007 as having moved if, in 2009, the family either no longer owned the 2007 home or if they still owned the 2007 home but were living in a new residence. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('2009', 'CD'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('collected', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('variety', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('changes', ('the', 'DT'), ('household', 'NN'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('moved', 'VBN'), ('.', '.'), ('For', 'IN'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('owned', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('home', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('moved', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('2009', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('this', 'DT'), ('information', 'NN'), ('includes', 'VBZ'), ('whether', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('household', 'NN'), ('retained', 'VBD'), ('ownership', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('residence', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), (',', ','), ('if', 'IN'), ('so', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('whether', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('property', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('still', 'RB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('household', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('primary', 'JJ'), ('residence', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Based', ('home', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('as', 'IN'), ('having', 'VBG'), ('moved', 'VBN'), ('if', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('2009', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('family', 'NN'), ('either', 'CC'), ('no', 'RB'), ('longer', 'RB'), ('owned', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('home', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('if', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('still', 'RB'), ('owned', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('home', 'NN'), ('but', 'CC'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('living', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('new', 'JJ'), ('residence', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Consumer Finances | …the information on households' moves in the 2007 to 2009 Survey of Consumer Finances panel includes data on aspects of mobility that are often not available in other data sources: first, the data indicate the reason for the move, so researchers can distinguish involuntary moves due to eviction or foreclosure from moves for other reasons such as a desire to be closer to relatives; second the data distinguishes moves, loosely speaking, within a local labor market from moves to a new labor market, specifically asking whether the family moved to a different metropolitan area (if the family resided in an metropolitan statistical area in 2007) or county than the one where the family lived in 2007. The question asked if the family had moved to a different city but the interviewer was instructed to record "no" for moves to a city in the same metropolitan area; for households that did not reside in a metropolitan area, the interviewer was instructed to record "no" for moves within the same county. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('households', 'NNS'), ("'", 'POS'), Dataset | Survey of Consumer Finances | …the choice to collect panel data came after the 2007 survey had largely concluded, so the survey did not take other steps to facilitate re-contacting respondents as a part of the 2007 interview. Given this, one potential concern is that results from the 2007 to 2009 Survey of Consumer Finances may be biased if families that moved between 2007 and 2009 were more difficult to locate; however, fewer than 3% of 2007 Survey of Consumer Finances participants could not be located. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('choice', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('collect', 'VB'), ('panel', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('came', 'VBD'), ('after', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('largely', 'RB'), ('concluded', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('so', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('take', 'VB'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('steps', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('facilitate', 'VB'), ('re-contacting', 'JJ'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('as', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('part', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('interview', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Given', 'VBN'), ('this', 'DT'), (',', ','), ('one', 'CD'), ('potential', 'JJ'), ('concern', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('results', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2009', 'CD'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Consumer', 'NNP'), ('Finances', 'NNP'), ('may', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('biased', 'VBN'), ('if', 'IN'), ('families', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('moved', 'VBD'), ('between', 'IN'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('2009', 'CD'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('difficult', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('locate', 'VB'), (';', ':'), ('however', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('fewer', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('3', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Consumer', 'NNP'), ('Finances', 'NNP'), ('participants', 'NNS'), ('could', 'MD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('be', 'VB'), ('located', 'VBN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Consumer Finances | …one concern with this data source is that results may be biased if household which moved were less likely to be re-interviewed after being located. For example, settling in after a move may impose additional demands on a family's time and, consequently, a household that moved recently may be less likely to participated in the 2009 survey; however, although almost 90% of the eligible 2007 Survey of Consumer Finances households were re-interviewed, geographic mobility was one of the few statistically significant correlates of non-response. | [('…one', 'NN'), ('concern', 'NN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('source', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('results', 'NNS'), ('may', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), Dataset | Survey of Consumer Finances | …if the 2007 respondent was alive and living in the United States, the target household in 2009 was the one that contained that person; otherwise, if the 2007 respondent had a spouse or partner who was a part of the primary economic unit as defined in the 2007 survey and who lived permanently in the United States, the target household in 2009 was the one that contained the 2007 spouse or partner of the 2007 respondent. If neither of these criteria were met, the case was considered out of scope. | [('…if', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('respondent', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('alive', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('living', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('target', 'NN'), ('household', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('2009', 'CD'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('one', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('contained', 'VBD'), ('that', 'IN'), ('person', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('otherwise', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('if', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('respondent', 'NN'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('spouse', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('partner', 'NN'), ('who', 'WP'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('part', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('primary', 'JJ'), ('economic', 'JJ'), ('unit', 'NN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('defined', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('who', 'WP'), ('lived', 'VBD'), ('permanently', 'RB'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('target', 'NN'), ('household', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('2009', 'CD'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('one', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('contained', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('spouse', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('partner', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2007', 'CD'), ('respondent', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('If', 'IN'), ('neither', 'DT'), ('of', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('criteria', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('met', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('case', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('considered', 'VBN'), ('out', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('scope', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …this data source did not directly identify moves due to foreclosure and eviction in the 2007, 2008, or 2009 surveys, but only if nearly all moves due to an other housing reason or other reasons were due to involuntary reasons would the share be comparable to that in the Survey of Consumer Finances. Dataset | Hendricks (2002) | Table 6 provides summary statistics on the data analyzed by Hendricks. The population of U.S. immigrants is divided into 4 groups according to the income-percentile of the country of origin relative to the United States. The country groups considered are the 20th, 30th, 40th and 50th to 65th percentiles of the U.S. per-capita income. The average years of schooling among immigrnts in these country groups are, respectively, 12.5, 12.8, 12.4, 14.3, and the average earnings of these immigrants are 97%, 92%, 94%, and 107% of the earnings of similarly educated workers in the United States. While Mexico and Portugal have a per-capita income of roughly 45% of the US level, researchers did not include these two countries in the 40th income percentile group because immigrants born in Mexico and Portugal have on average 7.4 years of schooling - a schooling level well below that of all other immigrants in Hendricks' sample. Nevertheless, researchers examine the data for Mexico and Portugal separately in a fifth country group. | [('Table', 'JJ'), ('6', 'CD'), ('provides', 'VBZ'), ('summary', 'JJ'), ('statistics', 'NNS'), Dataset | ICP | As discussed in the Handbook of the ICP, there is very little basis for comparing education prices across countries using tuition or fees because they usually do not cover full cost and are not market-prices due to heavy government subsidies. It is thus not possible to use (5.19) to determine an international schooling price that can be used to value schooling output across countries. As a result, the ICP uses an "indirect approach" which involves using data on the PPP prices of inputs to aggregate at international prices expenditures on education inputs. | [('As', 'IN'), ('discussed', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Handbook', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('ICP', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('there', 'EX'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('very', 'RB'), ('little', 'JJ'), ('basis', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('comparing', 'VBG'), ('education', 'NN'), ('prices', 'NNS'), ('across', 'IN'), ('countries', 'NNS'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('tuition', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('fees', 'NNS'), ('because', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('usually', 'RB'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('cover', 'VB'), ('full', 'JJ'), ('cost', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('market-prices', 'NNS'), ('due', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('heavy', 'JJ'), ('government', 'NN'), ('subsidies', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('It', 'PRP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('thus', 'RB'), ('not', 'RB'), ('possible', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('use', 'VB'), ('(', '('), ('5.19', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('to', 'TO'), ('determine', 'VB'), ('an', 'DT'), ('international', 'JJ'), ('schooling', 'NN'), ('price', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('can', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('value', 'NN'), ('schooling', 'VBG'), ('output', 'NN'), ('across', 'IN'), ('countries', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('As', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('result', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('ICP', 'NNP'), ('uses', 'VBZ'), ('an', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('indirect', 'JJ'), ('approach', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('which', 'WDT'), ('involves', 'VBZ'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('PPP', 'NNP'), ('prices', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('inputs', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('aggregate', 'VB'), ('at', 'IN'), ('international', 'JJ'), ('prices', 'NNS'), ('expenditures', 'VBZ'), ('on', 'IN'), ('education', 'NN'), ('inputs', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Penn World Tables | To measure GDP at PPP prices, a set of 'international prices' needs to be chosen in a manner consistent with the methodology in the Penn World Tables (hereafter, PWT). The set of 'international prices' in the PWT is constructed by averaging among all countries, according to the procedures established by the International Comparison Program (ICP) of the United Nations. | [('To', 'TO'), ('measure', 'VB'), ('GDP', 'NNP'), ('at', 'IN'), ('PPP', 'NNP'), ('prices', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('a', 'DT'), ('set', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ("'international", 'JJ'), ('prices', 'NNS'), ("'", 'POS'), ('needs', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('be', 'VB'), ('chosen', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('manner', 'NN'), ('consistent', 'JJ'), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('methodology', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Penn', 'NNP'), ('World', 'NNP'), ('Tables', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('hereafter', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('PWT', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('set', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ("'international", 'JJ'), ('prices', 'NNS'), ("'", 'POS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('PWT', 'NNP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('constructed', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('averaging', 'VBG'), ('among', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('countries', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('according', 'VBG'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('procedures', 'NNS'), ('established', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('International', 'NNP'), ('Comparison', 'NNP'), ('Program', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('ICP', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('Nations', 'NNPS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | PWT | The PWT define PPP exchange rates for education as education expenditures in national currency divided by their real value in international dollars. The education PPP exchange rates are computed with data on expenditures by educational institutions, for there are no cross-country data on educational expenditures at the level of the household. Figure 2b plots the PWT data on the price of education, normalized by the PPP price of GDP, and the PPP output per capita. The model counterpart is the wage rate, normalized accordingly. | [('The', 'DT'), ('PWT', 'NNP'), ('define', 'NNP'), ('PPP', 'NNP'), ('exchange', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('education', 'NN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('education', 'NN'), ('expenditures', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('national', 'JJ'), ('currency', 'NN'), ('divided', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('real', 'JJ'), ('value', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('international', 'JJ'), ('dollars', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('education', 'NN'), ('PPP', 'NNP'), ('exchange', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('computed', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('expenditures', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('educational', 'JJ'), ('institutions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('for', 'IN'), ('there', 'EX'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('no', 'DT'), ('cross-country', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('educational', 'JJ'), ('expenditures', 'NNS'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('level', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('household', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Figure', 'NN'), ('2b', 'CD'), ('plots', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('PWT', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('price', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('education', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('normalized', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('PPP', 'NNP'), ('price', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('GDP', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('PPP', 'NNP'), ('output', 'NN'), ('per', 'IN'), ('capita', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('model', 'NN'), ('counterpart', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('normalized', 'VBN'), ('accordingly', 'RB'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …exercises using the Current Population Survey data illustrate the severity of the problem in a commonly used dataset, however one might be concerned that these researchers have by chance detected actual laws or other relatively discreete change, or that there might be other features of the Current Population Survey wage data, such as state-specific time trends, that may also give rise to overrejection. | [('…exercises', 'NNS'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('data', 'VBZ'), ('illustrate', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('severity', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('problem', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('commonly', 'RB'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('dataset', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('however', 'RB'), ('one', 'CD'), ('might', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('concerned', 'VBN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('by', 'IN'), ('chance', 'NN'), ('detected', 'VBN'), ('actual', 'JJ'), ('laws', 'NNS'), ('or', 'CC'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('relatively', 'RB'), ('discreete', 'JJ'), ('change', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('or', 'CC'), ('that', 'IN'), ('there', 'EX'), ('might', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('features', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('such', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('state-specific', 'JJ'), ('time', 'NN'), ('trends', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('that', 'WDT'), ('may', 'MD'), ('also', 'RB'), ('give', 'VB'), ('rise', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('overrejection', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the CPS has four rotation groups every month. Each group is in the survey for four months, out for eight months, and in again for another four months. Hence, roughly there are three-quarters of the households are surveyed in the two consecutive months. Researchers use these observations to construct the monthly transition rates between employment and unemployment. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('four', 'CD'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('groups', 'NNS'), ('every', 'DT'), ('month', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Each', 'DT'), ('group', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('four', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('out', 'IN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('eight', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('in', 'IN'), ('again', 'RB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('another', 'DT'), ('four', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Hence', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('roughly', 'RB'), ('there', 'EX'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('three-quarters', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('surveyed', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('two', 'CD'), ('consecutive', 'JJ'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('these', 'DT'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('construct', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('monthly', 'JJ'), ('transition', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('between', 'IN'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('unemployment', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …this data sample is restricted to include individuals aged between 25 and 60. The lower bound is chosen because most people have completed their education by age 25. The upper bound is chosen to exclude individuals who are close to the retirement age since these individual's labor market behavior may be different from the younger groups. | [('…this', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('restricted', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('include', 'VB'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('aged', 'VBN'), ('between', 'IN'), ('25', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('60', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('lower', 'JJR'), ('bound', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('chosen', 'VBN'), ('because', 'IN'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('people', 'NNS'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('completed', 'VBN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('education', 'NN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('age', 'NN'), ('25', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('upper', 'JJ'), ('bound', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('chosen', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('exclude', 'VB'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('who', 'WP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('close', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('retirement', 'NN'), ('age', 'NN'), ('since', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('individual', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('labor', 'NN'), ('market', 'NN'), ('behavior', 'NN'), ('may', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('different', 'JJ'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('younger', 'JJR'), ('groups', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …researchers apply the continuous time correction for time aggregation bias developed by Shimer (2012) to each education group. This correction takes into account that some workers who become unemployed managed to find a new job before the next CPS survey arrived. | [('…researchers', 'NNS'), ('apply', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('continuous', 'JJ'), ('time', 'NN'), ('correction', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('aggregation', 'NN'), ('bias', 'NN'), ('developed', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('Shimer', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('2012', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('to', 'TO'), ('each', 'DT'), ('education', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('correction', 'NN'), ('takes', 'VBZ'), ('into', 'IN'), ('account', 'NN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('some', 'DT'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('who', 'WP'), ('become', 'VBP'), ('unemployed', 'JJ'), ('managed', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('find', 'VB'), ('a', 'DT'), ('new', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('before', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('next', 'JJ'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('arrived', 'VBD'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …for the relevant analysis, researchers use the most recent 6 panels before the Great Recession. The authors choose to exclude the panel that starts in 2008 because they will eventually parameterize the wage loss and wage growth in the steady state of the model using estimates obtained from SIPP before the Great Recession. More than one panel is included to increase the number of observations. Panels start at 1991, 1992, 1993, 1996, 2001, and 2004. | [('…for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('relevant', 'JJ'), ('analysis', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('most', 'RBS'), ('recent', 'JJ'), ('6', 'CD'), ('panels', 'NNS'), ('before', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Great', 'NNP'), ('Recession', 'NNP'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('authors', 'NNS'), ('choose', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('exclude', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('panel', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('starts', 'VBZ'), ('in', 'IN'), ('2008', 'CD'), ('because', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('will', 'MD'), ('eventually', 'RB'), ('parameterize', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('loss', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('growth', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('steady', 'JJ'), ('state', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('model', 'NN'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('estimates', 'NNS'), ('obtained', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('before', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Great', 'NNP'), ('Recession', 'NNP'), ('.', '.'), ('More', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('one', 'CD'), ('panel', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('included', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('increase', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Panels', 'NNP'), ('start', 'NN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('1991', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1992', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1993', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1996', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('2001', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('2004', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …individuals aged between 25 and 60 are selected for the same reason as the selections made from the CPS data. | [('…individuals', 'NNS'), ('aged', 'VBD'), ('between', 'IN'), ('25', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('60', 'CD'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('selected', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('same', 'JJ'), ('reason', 'NN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('selections', 'NNS'), ('made', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …measurement errors in hours and unrecorded overtime work that plague total earnings responses in the SIPP often contaminate wages computed for salaried workers. Hence researchers focus on hourly paid workers only. The hourly paid workers consist roughly half of all workers. The authors use the real wage data by deflating the nominal wage by monthly CPI. | [('…measurement', 'JJ'), ('errors', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('unrecorded', 'JJ'), ('overtime', 'NN'), ('work', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('plague', 'JJ'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('responses', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('often', 'RB'), ('contaminate', 'VBP'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('computed', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('salaried', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Hence', 'NNP'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('focus', 'VBP'), ('on', 'IN'), ('hourly', 'NN'), ('paid', 'VBN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('only', 'RB'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('hourly', 'JJ'), ('paid', 'VBD'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('consist', 'VBP'), ('roughly', 'RB'), ('half', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('authors', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('real', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('deflating', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('nominal', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('monthly', 'JJ'), ('CPI', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …to calculate the number of short-term unemployed, the authors follow Shimer (2012) to eliminate the discontinuity associated with the redesign of the CPS in 21994. Specifically, the authors measure the short-term unemployed from the full sample before 1994. Researchers use only the incoming rotation groups from 1994 onwards. For the later period, researchers use the CPS data to construct the fraction of short-term unemployed among all unemployed workers for the incoming rotation groups in each month since 1976. Researchers seasonally adjust this series using the Census's X-12-ARIMA algorithm, and then use the product of the number of unemployed workers in the full CPS and the short-term unemployment share as their measurement for the short term unemployed from 1994 onwards. | [('…to', 'JJ'), ('calculate', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('short-term', 'JJ'), ('unemployed', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('authors', 'NNS'), ('follow', 'VBP'), ('Shimer', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('2012', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('to', 'TO'), ('eliminate', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('discontinuity', 'NN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('authors', 'NNS'), ('measure', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('short-term', 'JJ'), ('unemployed', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('full', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('before', 'IN'), ('1994', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('only', 'RB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('incoming', 'JJ'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('groups', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1994', 'CD'), ('onwards', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('For', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('later', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NNS'), Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the U.S. Bureau of the Census states that in the March 1990 CPS, which provides data on incomes during 1989, approximately 4.5% of the 60,000 households in the sampling frame were not interviewed and that incomplete income data were obtained from approximately 8% of the persons in interviewed households. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …one issue that has received considerable attention concerns the importance of the exclusion of the institutionalized population from the Current Population Survey files. However, this is most likely to be a far less serious issue among immigrants as, among male prison inmates between the ages of 18 and 54, in 1991, 5.4% were noncitizens. In contrast, noncitizens make up about 7% of the population of this age group. | [('…one', 'CD'), ('issue', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('received', 'VBN'), ('considerable', 'JJ'), ('attention', 'NN'), ('concerns', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('importance', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('exclusion', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('institutionalized', 'JJ'), ('population', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('However', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('this', 'DT'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('most', 'RBS'), ('likely', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('be', 'VB'), ('a', 'DT'), ('far', 'RB'), ('less', 'RBR'), ('serious', 'JJ'), ('issue', 'NN'), ('among', 'IN'), ('immigrants', 'NNS'), ('as', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('among', 'IN'), ('male', 'JJ'), ('prison', 'NN'), ('inmates', 'NNS'), ('between', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('ages', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('18', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('54', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('1991', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('5.4', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('noncitizens', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('In', 'IN'), ('contrast', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('noncitizens', 'NNS'), ('make', 'VBP'), ('up', 'RP'), ('about', 'RB'), ('7', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('population', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('age', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …starting in 1994, March Current Population Survey incorporated a number of changes that made these surveys more useful for immigrant research. In particular, questions were added concerning immigrant status (and that of the parent), the number of years since immigration, and ethnicity. While containing much smaller sample sizes than the decennial census files, these recent Current Population Survey innovations make that data useful for the more recent periods. | [('…starting', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1994', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('March', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('incorporated', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('made', 'VBD'), ('these', 'DT'), ('surveys', 'NNS'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('useful', 'JJ'), ('for', 'IN'), ('immigrant', 'JJ'), ('research', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('In', 'IN'), ('particular', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('added', 'JJ'), ('concerning', 'VBG'), ('immigrant', 'JJ'), ('status', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('and', 'CC'), ('that', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('parent', 'NN'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('since', 'IN'), ('immigration', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('ethnicity', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('While', 'IN'), ('containing', 'VBG'), ('much', 'JJ'), ('smaller', 'JJR'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('sizes', 'NNS'), ('than', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('decennial', 'JJ'), ('census', 'NN'), ('files', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('these', 'DT'), ('recent', 'JJ'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('innovations', 'NNS'), ('make', 'VBP'), ('that', 'IN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('useful', 'JJ'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('recent', 'JJ'), ('periods', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in the 1990 census and beginning in 1992, the Current Population Survey changed its education question from years of schooling to educational attainment categories. Taking advantage of the Current Population Survey practice of rotating households into and out of the survey, the author matches people who responded to the 1991 survey with the same people in the 1992 survey by household I.D., person line number, race, ethnicity, and age. The author then calculated the mean of the years of schooling reported in 1991 by the educational attainment categories used in 1992 for this matched sample. These means were used to assign the values within the 1990 census and post-1992 CPS education categories. | [('…in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1990', 'CD'), ('census', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('categories', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Census | …in the 1990 census and beginning in 1992, the Current Population Survey changed its education question from years of schooling to educational attainment categories. Taking advantage of the Current Population Survey practice of rotating households into and out of the survey, the author matches people who responded to the 1991 survey with the same people in the 1992 survey by household I.D., person line number, race, ethnicity, and age. The author then calculated the mean of the years of schooling reported in 1991 by the educational attainment categories used in 1992 for this matched sample. These means were used to assign the values within the 1990 census and post-1992 CPS education categories. | [('…in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1990', 'CD'), ('census', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('beginning', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1992', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('changed', 'VBD'), ('its', 'PRP$'), ('education', 'NN'), Dataset | Census | …the census contains all open-ended upper income intervals. The means of these top codes were calculated assuming that the upper part of the income distribution followed an exponential distribution, and the following values were assigned: 1940($5,000) = $8,900; 1950 ($10,000) = $22,500; 1960 ($25,000) = $42,500; 1970 ($50,000) = $80,000; 1980 ($75,000) = $115,000; 1990 ($140,000) = $195,000. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('census', 'NN'), ('contains', 'VBZ'), ('all', 'DT'), ('open-ended', 'JJ'), ('upper', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), ('intervals', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('means', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('top', 'JJ'), ('codes', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('calculated', 'VBN'), ('assuming', 'VBG'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('upper', 'JJ'), ('part', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('income', 'NN'), ('distribution', 'NN'), ('followed', 'VBD'), ('an', 'DT'), ('exponential', 'JJ'), ('distribution', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('following', 'JJ'), ('values', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('assigned', 'VBN'), (':', ':'), ('1940', 'CD'), ('(', '('), ('$', '$'), ('5,000', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('=', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('8,900', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('1950', 'CD'), ('(', '('), ('$', '$'), ('10,000', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('=', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('22,500', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('1960', 'CD'), ('(', '('), ('$', '$'), ('25,000', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('=', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('42,500', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('1970', 'CD'), ('(', '('), ('$', '$'), ('50,000', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('=', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('80,000', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('1980', 'CD'), ('(', '('), ('$', '$'), ('75,000', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('=', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('115,000', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('1990', 'CD'), ('(', '('), ('$', '$'), ('140,000', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('=', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('195,000', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Census | …weeks worked were coded into broad intervals in the 1960 and 1970 censuses. The following within-interval means, derived from the 1980 census, were assigned: 1 to 13 = 6.5; 14 to 26 = 21.73; 27 to 29 = 33.08; 40 to 47 = 42.67; 48 to 49 = 48.29; and 50 to 52 = 51.82. in other census years, the author used these intervals or the continuous value of weeks worked, and the results were basically identical. In light of this, the author chooses to use the continuous weeks measure in the CPS files. | [('…weeks', 'NNS'), ('worked', 'VBN'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('coded', 'VBN'), ('into', 'IN'), ('broad', 'JJ'), ('intervals', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1960', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1970', 'CD'), ('censuses', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('following', 'JJ'), ('within-interval', 'JJ'), ('means', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('derived', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1980', 'CD'), ('census', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('were', 'VBD'), ('assigned', 'VBN'), (':', ':'), ('1', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('13', 'CD'), ('=', 'NNS'), ('6.5', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('14', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('26', 'CD'), ('=', 'NNS'), ('21.73', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('27', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('29', 'CD'), ('=', 'NNS'), ('33.08', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('40', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('47', 'CD'), ('=', 'NNS'), ('42.67', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('48', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('49', 'CD'), ('=', 'NNS'), ('48.29', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('and', 'CC'), ('50', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('52', 'CD'), ('=', 'NNS'), ('51.82.', 'CD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('census', 'NN'), ('years', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('author', 'NN'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('intervals', 'NNS'), ('or', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('continuous', 'JJ'), ('value', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('weeks', 'NNS'), ('worked', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('results', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('basically', 'RB'), ('identical', 'JJ'), ('.', '.'), ('In', 'IN'), ('light', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('author', 'NN'), ('chooses', 'VBZ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('use', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('continuous', 'JJ'), ('weeks', 'NNS'), ('measure', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …all data used here are from the monthly Current Population Survey (CPS) data. When examining the entire labor force, researchers include all individuals age 16 and older. When examining specific education groups, researchers include only individuals age 25 and older in order to capture completed education levels. Observations are weighted using the composite weights. | [('…all', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('here', 'RB'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('monthly', 'JJ'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('CPS', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('When', 'WRB'), ('examining', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('entire', 'JJ'), ('labor', 'NN'), ('force', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('include', 'VBP'), ('all', 'DT'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('age', 'NN'), ('16', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('older', 'JJR'), ('.', '.'), ('When', 'WRB'), ('examining', 'VBG'), ('specific', 'JJ'), ('education', 'NN'), ('groups', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('include', 'VBP'), ('only', 'JJ'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('age', 'NN'), ('25', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('older', 'JJR'), ('in', 'IN'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('capture', 'NN'), ('completed', 'VBN'), ('education', 'NN'), ('levels', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Observations', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('weighted', 'VBN'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('composite', 'JJ'), ('weights', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the data is decomposed into trend and cyclical components using the Hodrick-Prescott (HP) filter with a smoothing parameter of 1600. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the data series are annualized, expressed in natural logs, and de-trended using a band-pass filter that removes fluctuations accruing in periods shorter than 4 and longer than 25. The model predictions receive a similar treatment. This approach is appropriate not only for the skill premium but also for border apprehensions, which present sizable short-term swings due to the random nature of border arrests. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('series', 'NN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('annualized', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('expressed', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('natural', 'JJ'), ('logs', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('de-trended', 'JJ'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('band-pass', 'NN'), ('filter', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('removes', 'VBZ'), ('fluctuations', 'NNS'), ('accruing', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('periods', 'NNS'), ('shorter', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('4', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('longer', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('25', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('model', 'NN'), ('predictions', 'NNS'), ('receive', 'VBP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('similar', 'JJ'), ('treatment', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('approach', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('appropriate', 'JJ'), ('not', 'RB'), ('only', 'RB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('skill', 'NN'), ('premium', 'NN'), ('but', 'CC'), ('also', 'RB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('border', 'NN'), ('apprehensions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('present', 'JJ'), ('sizable', 'JJ'), ('short-term', 'JJ'), ('swings', 'NNS'), ('due', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('random', 'JJ'), ('nature', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('border', 'NN'), ('arrests', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Census | …the data is seasonally adjusted with the X-12 ARIMA method of the U.S. Census Bureau. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('seasonally', 'RB'), ('adjusted', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('X-12', 'JJ'), ('ARIMA', 'NNP'), ('method', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('U.S.', 'NNP'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …since the sample group in this survey rotates every month, the skill premium is noisy at the quarterly frequency. To address this problem, the Current Population Survey data used to analyze the cyclical dynamics of the skill premium is annualized, like in Polgreen and Silos (2009). | [('…since', 'NN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('rotates', 'VBZ'), ('every', 'DT'), ('month', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('skill', 'NN'), ('premium', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('noisy', 'VBN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('quarterly', 'JJ'), ('frequency', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('To', 'TO'), ('address', 'VB'), ('this', 'DT'), ('problem', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('analyze', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('cyclical', 'JJ'), ('dynamics', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('skill', 'NN'), ('premium', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('annualized', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('like', 'IN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('Polgreen', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Silos', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('2009', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …researchers used monthly data for total hours worked in the last week of every month, weekly earnings before deductions, and earnings weights by educational attainment. | [('…researchers', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('monthly', 'RB'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('worked', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('last', 'JJ'), ('week', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('every', 'DT'), ('month', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('before', 'IN'), ('deductions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('weights', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('educational', 'JJ'), ('attainment', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Bank of Mexico | …researchers choose to use data on apprehensions (arrests) at the U.S.-Mexico border and remittances from the United States to Mexico in real pesos to evaluate the model, but do not include these series in the structural estimation, for several reasons: first, the apprehensions series is noisy due to the random nature of border arrests; second, is an identification problem regarding the effect of border enforcement on apprehensions; third, remittances are not included in the structural estimation, given the short length of this series (available only since 1995:Q1. | [('…researchers', 'NNS'), ('choose', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('use', 'VB'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('apprehensions', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('arrests', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('U.S.-Mexico', 'NNP'), ('border', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('remittances', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('Mexico', 'NNP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('real', 'JJ'), ('pesos', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('evaluate', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('model', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('but', 'CC'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('include', 'VB'), ('these', 'DT'), ('series', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('structural', 'JJ'), ('estimation', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('for', 'IN'), ('several', 'JJ'), ('reasons', 'NNS'), (':', ':'), ('first', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('apprehensions', 'NNS'), ('series', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('noisy', 'JJ'), ('due', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('random', 'JJ'), ('nature', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('border', 'NN'), ('arrests', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('second', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('an', 'DT'), ('identification', 'NN'), ('problem', 'NN'), ('regarding', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('effect', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('border', 'NN'), ('enforcement', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('apprehensions', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('third', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('remittances', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('included', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('structural', 'JJ'), ('estimation', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('given', 'VBN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('short', 'JJ'), ('length', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('series', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('available', 'JJ'), ('only', 'RB'), ('since', 'IN'), ('1995', 'CD'), (':', ':'), ('Q1', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Manufacturing Technology | …each SMT polled a stratified random sample of around 10,000 manufacturing establishments with at least twenty employees in SIC industries 34 through 38 on the use of, plans for use of, reasons for use of (or not for using) seventeen categories of advanced manufacturing technologies. These technologies include processes used both in production and non-production activities, but most of the technologies are for use on the shop floor. Many also appear to replace raw labor, such as automated inspection (alternatively handled by semiskilled "production inspectors"), automated materials handling, and robots. | [('…each', 'NN'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('polled', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('stratified', 'JJ'), ('random', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('around', 'IN'), ('10,000', 'CD'), ('manufacturing', 'NN'), ('establishments', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('least', 'JJS'), ('twenty', 'JJ'), ('employees', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('SIC', 'NNP'), ('industries', 'NNS'), ('34', 'CD'), ('through', 'IN'), ('38', 'CD'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('use', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('plans', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('reasons', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('(', '('), ('or', 'CC'), ('not', 'RB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('using', 'VBG'), (')', ')'), ('seventeen', 'JJ'), ('categories', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('advanced', 'JJ'), ('manufacturing', 'NN'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('These', 'DT'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), ('include', 'VBP'), ('processes', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('both', 'DT'), ('in', 'IN'), ('production', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('non-production', 'NN'), ('activities', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('but', 'CC'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('for', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('shop', 'NN'), ('floor', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Many', 'NNP'), ('also', 'RB'), ('appear', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('replace', 'VB'), ('raw', 'JJ'), ('labor', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('such', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('automated', 'JJ'), ('inspection', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('alternatively', 'RB'), ('handled', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('semiskilled', 'JJ'), ('``', '``'), ('production', 'NN'), ('inspectors', 'NNS'), ("''", "''"), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('automated', 'JJ'), ('materials', 'NNS'), ('handling', 'VBG'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('robots', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Manufacturing Technology | …the industries covered by the SMT represent 43% of the manufacturing sector (value added or employment) in 1987. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('industries', 'NNS'), ('covered', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('represent', 'VBP'), ('43', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('manufacturing', 'NN'), ('sector', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('value', 'NN'), ('added', 'VBD'), ('or', 'CC'), ('employment', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1987', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Manufacturing Technology | …a report prepared for the Census Bureau that compared employment and plant counts in the SMT sample to the Census of Manufactures showed that the data were close to geographically representative, with some minor exceptions, such as there being "too few" California plants in the 1988 SMT data. | [('…a', 'JJ'), ('report', 'NN'), ('prepared', 'VBD'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('that', 'IN'), ('compared', 'VBN'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('plant', 'NN'), ('counts', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Manufactures', 'NNP'), ('showed', 'VBD'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('close', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('geographically', 'RB'), ('representative', 'VB'), (',', ','), ('with', 'IN'), ('some', 'DT'), ('minor', 'JJ'), ('exceptions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('such', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('there', 'EX'), ('being', 'VBG'), ('``', '``'), ('too', 'RB'), ('few', 'JJ'), ("''", "''"), ('California', 'NNP'), ('plants', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1988', 'CD'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the skill mix of each metropolitan area's workforce is estimated using Current Population Survey (CPS) micro data for non-census years.
