Dataset | Survey of Manufacturing Technology | …the 1993 technology added question appears to capture changes in technology use over the 1988-93 period well. Unfortunately, there is no similar question in the 1988 survey. In order to analyze the period before this, the author takes advantage of the fact that the machines covered by the SMT were hardly used before the early 1980s, which means that the level of use is roughly equal to the change in technology since 1980. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('1993', 'CD'), ('technology', 'NN'), ('added', 'VBD'), ('question', 'NN'), ('appears', 'VBZ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('capture', 'VB'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('technology', 'NN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('over', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1988-93', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), ('well', 'RB'), ('.', '.'), ('Unfortunately', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('there', 'EX'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('no', 'DT'), ('similar', 'JJ'), ('question', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1988', 'CD'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('In', 'IN'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('analyze', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('period', 'NN'), ('before', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('author', 'NN'), ('takes', 'VBZ'), ('advantage', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('fact', 'NN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('machines', 'NNS'), ('covered', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('hardly', 'RB'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('before', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('early', 'JJ'), ('1980s', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('means', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('level', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('roughly', 'RB'), ('equal', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('change', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('technology', 'NN'), ('since', 'IN'), ('1980', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in the 1987-1989 data, anyone who reports attending and completing twelve years of education, or who reports attending but not completing thirteen years of education, is counted as a high school completer. In the 1992-1994 data, only those who report highest grade completed as "High school graduate, diploma or GED" are counted as high school completers. Those with less education (including "12th grade, no diploma" down to completed nine years, or attended ten years, in 1987-89, or completed ninth grade, in 1992-94) are high school dropouts. | [('…in', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1987-1989', 'JJ'), ('data', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('anyone', 'NN'), ('who', 'WP'), ('reports', 'VBZ'), ('attending', 'VBG'), ('and', 'CC'), ('completing', 'VBG'), ('twelve', 'CD'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('education', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('or', 'CC'), ('who', 'WP'), ('reports', 'VBP'), ('attending', 'VBG'), ('but', 'CC'), ('not', 'RB'), ('completing', 'VBG'), ('thirteen', 'JJ'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('education', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('counted', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('high', 'JJ'), ('school', 'NN'), ('completer', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('In', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1992-1994', 'JJ'), ('data', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('only', 'RB'), ('those', 'DT'), ('who', 'WP'), ('report', 'VBP'), ('highest', 'JJS'), ('grade', 'NN'), ('completed', 'VBD'), ('as', 'IN'), ('``', '``'), ('High', 'JJ'), ('school', 'NN'), ('graduate', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('diploma', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('GED', 'NNP'), ("''", "''"), ('are', 'VBP'), ('counted', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('high', 'JJ'), ('school', 'NN'), ('completers', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Those', 'DT'), ('with', 'IN'), ('less', 'JJR'), ('education', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('including', 'VBG'), ('``', '``'), ('12th', 'CD'), ('grade', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('no', 'DT'), ('diploma', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('down', 'RB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('completed', 'VBN'), ('nine', 'CD'), ('years', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('or', 'CC'), ('attended', 'VBD'), ('ten', 'CD'), ('years', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('1987-89', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('or', 'CC'), ('completed', 'VBN'), ('ninth', 'JJ'), ('grade', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('1992-94', 'JJ'), (')', ')'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('high', 'JJ'), ('school', 'NN'), ('dropouts', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Censuses of Population | …in the 1980 census, dropouts and high school completers are defined as in the 1987-89 CPS. In the 1990 Census, they are defined the same as in the 1992-94 CPS. Dataset | Survey of Manufacturing Technology | …the primary measures of automation used in this analysis come from restricted access microdata versions of the 1988 and 1993 Surveys of Manufacturing Technology (SMT), supplemented with information from the 1987 and 1992 Census of Manufactures. Each SMT polled a stratified random sample of around 10,000 manufacturing establishments with at least 20 employees in SIC industries 34-38 on the use of, plans for use of, reasons for use of (or for not using) 17 categories of advanced manufacturing technologies. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('primary', 'JJ'), ('measures', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('automation', 'NN'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('analysis', 'NN'), ('come', 'VBP'), ('from', 'IN'), ('restricted', 'JJ'), ('access', 'NN'), ('microdata', 'NN'), ('versions', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1988', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1993', 'CD'), ('Surveys', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Manufacturing', 'NNP'), ('Technology', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('SMT', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('supplemented', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('information', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1987', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1992', 'CD'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Manufactures', 'NNP'), ('.', '.'), ('Each', 'DT'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('polled', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('stratified', 'JJ'), ('random', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('around', 'IN'), ('10,000', 'CD'), ('manufacturing', 'NN'), ('establishments', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('least', 'JJS'), ('20', 'CD'), ('employees', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('SIC', 'NNP'), ('industries', 'NNS'), ('34-38', 'VBP'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('use', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('plans', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('reasons', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('(', '('), ('or', 'CC'), ('for', 'IN'), ('not', 'RB'), ('using', 'VBG'), (')', ')'), ('17', 'CD'), ('categories', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('advanced', 'JJ'), ('manufacturing', 'NN'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Manufacturing Technology | …the analysis uses sample weights constructed to reflect the geographic distribution of employment in the SMT universe. These wieghts were constructed in two-digit SIC industry by employment class size (20,99, 100-499, 500+) by metropolitan area strata. The weights are equal to total employment in the strata - measured with the prior year (1987 or 1992) Census of Manufactures -divided by the number of plants in the SMT in the strata. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('analysis', 'NN'), ('uses', 'VBZ'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('weights', 'NNS'), ('constructed', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('reflect', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('geographic', 'JJ'), ('distribution', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('universe', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('These', 'DT'), ('wieghts', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('constructed', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('two-digit', 'JJ'), ('SIC', 'NNP'), ('industry', 'NN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('class', 'NN'), ('size', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('20,99', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('100-499', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('500+', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('by', 'IN'), ('metropolitan', 'JJ'), ('area', 'NN'), ('strata', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('weights', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('equal', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('strata', 'NN'), ('-', ':'), ('measured', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('prior', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('1987', 'CD'), ('or', 'CC'), ('1992', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Manufactures', 'NNP'), ('-divided', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('plants', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('strata', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Censuses of Population | …in the five percent file, foreign-born are defined as non-citizens or naturalized citizens born outside the U.S. The citizenship question is unavailabe in the fifteen percent file, so foreign-born are defined to be those born outside the U.S. and whose parents are also both born outside the U.S. | [('…in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('five', 'CD'), ('percent', 'NN'), ('file', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('foreign-born', 'JJ'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('defined', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('non-citizens', 'NNS'), ('or', 'CC'), ('naturalized', 'VBN'), ('citizens', 'NNS'), ('born', 'VBN'), ('outside', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('U.S', 'NNP'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('citizenship', 'JJ'), ('question', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('unavailabe', 'JJ'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('fifteen', 'JJ'), ('percent', 'NN'), ('file', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('so', 'IN'), ('foreign-born', 'JJ'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('defined', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('be', 'VB'), ('those', 'DT'), ('born', 'JJ'), ('outside', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('U.S.', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('whose', 'WP$'), ('parents', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('also', 'RB'), ('both', 'DT'), ('born', 'VBN'), ('outside', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('U.S', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Surveys of Manufacturing Technology | …the technology data used in this project come from the 1988 and 1993 Surveys of Manufacturing Technology (SMT). Each polled a statified random sample of around 10,000 manufacturing establishments with at least 20 employees in SIC industries 34-38 on the use of, plans for use of, reasons for use of (or for not using) 17 categories of advanced manufacturing technologies. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('technology', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('project', 'NN'), ('come', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1988', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1993', 'CD'), ('Surveys', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Manufacturing', 'NNP'), ('Technology', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('SMT', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.'), ('Each', 'DT'), ('polled', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('statified', 'JJ'), ('random', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('around', 'IN'), ('10,000', 'CD'), ('manufacturing', 'NN'), ('establishments', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('least', 'JJS'), ('20', 'CD'), ('employees', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('SIC', 'NNP'), ('industries', 'NNS'), ('34-38', 'VBP'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('use', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('plans', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('reasons', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('(', '('), ('or', 'CC'), ('for', 'IN'), ('not', 'RB'), ('using', 'VBG'), (')', ')'), ('17', 'CD'), ('categories', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('advanced', 'JJ'), ('manufacturing', 'NN'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Surveys of Manufacturing Technology | …the industries covered by the SMT - fabricated metal products, industrial machinery and equipement, electronic and other equipment, transportation equipment, instruments and related prodcuts - make up a large part of the manufacturing sector (43% of value added and employment in 1987, according to the U.S. Bureau of the Census (1989)). | [('…the', 'NN'), ('industries', 'NNS'), ('covered', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('-', ':'), ('fabricated', 'VBN'), ('metal', 'NN'), ('products', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('industrial', 'JJ'), ('machinery', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('equipement', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('electronic', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('equipment', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('transportation', 'NN'), ('equipment', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('instruments', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('related', 'VBN'), ('prodcuts', 'NNS'), ('-', ':'), ('make', 'VB'), ('up', 'RP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('large', 'JJ'), ('part', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('manufacturing', 'NN'), ('sector', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('43', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('value', 'NN'), ('added', 'VBN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1987', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('according', 'VBG'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('U.S.', 'NNP'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('1989', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Surveys of Manufacturing Technology | …the SMT technologies include processes used both in production and non-production activities, but most of the technologies are for use on the shop floor. Many also appear to replace raw labor, such as automated inspection (alternatively handled by semiskileed "production inspectors"), automated materials handling, and robots. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), ('include', 'VBP'), ('processes', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('both', 'DT'), ('in', 'IN'), ('production', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('non-production', 'NN'), ('activities', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('but', 'CC'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('for', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('shop', 'NN'), ('floor', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Many', 'NNP'), ('also', 'RB'), ('appear', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('replace', 'VB'), ('raw', 'JJ'), ('labor', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('such', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('automated', 'JJ'), ('inspection', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('alternatively', 'RB'), ('handled', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('semiskileed', 'NN'), ('``', '``'), ('production', 'NN'), ('inspectors', 'NNS'), ("''", "''"), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('automated', 'JJ'), ('materials', 'NNS'), ('handling', 'VBG'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('robots', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Surveys of Manufacturing Technology | …the SMT surveys records establishment characteristics, such as plant size, plant age, ownership, production type, military contractor status. The responses were in categories. Rather than drop observations that did not respond to one of these plant characteristics questions, the author treated non-response as a separate category of "response" to each question. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('surveys', 'NN'), ('records', 'NNS'), ('establishment', 'NN'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('such', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('plant', 'NN'), ('size', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('plant', 'NN'), ('age', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('ownership', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('production', 'NN'), ('type', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('military', 'JJ'), ('contractor', 'NN'), ('status', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('responses', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('categories', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Rather', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('drop', 'NN'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('respond', 'VB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('one', 'CD'), ('of', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('plant', 'NN'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), ('questions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('author', 'NN'), ('treated', 'VBD'), ('non-response', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('separate', 'JJ'), ('category', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('``', '``'), ('response', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('to', 'TO'), ('each', 'DT'), ('question', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Surveys of Manufacturing Technology | …the strata used to create each of the SMT samples consisted of three-digit SIC industry by "class size" cells. There were three class sizes, defined by employment. Within each strata, a simple random sample was taken, and a weight was recorded equal to one over the sampling rate for that strata. Though the SMT was in theory a random sample, it was also a small sample. To ensure that the present analysis would be geographically representative, the author constructed new sample weights to properly reflect the geographic distribution of plants in the SMT-universe. The author merged each plant in the SMT to the prior-year (1987 and 1992) Census of Manufactures. Then, new strata were constructed - two-digit SIC industry by class size by metropolitan area. The equivalent of the original SMT weights would be to construct, in each of the new strata, a weight equal to the number of plants in the Census of Manufactures universe divided by the number of plants in the SMT sample. However, for the purpose of studying the impact ofthe labor force, the author wanted weights that were representative employment, not plants. So instead, a weight equal to the strata employment in the Census of Manufactures divided by the number of plants in the SMT. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('strata', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('create', 'VB'), ('each', 'DT'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('samples', 'NNS'), ('consisted', 'VBD'), ('of', 'IN'), ('three-digit', 'JJ'), ('SIC', 'NNP'), ('industry', 'NN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('``', '``'), ('class', 'NN'), ('size', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('cells', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('There', 'EX'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('three', 'CD'), ('class', 'NN'), ('sizes', 'NNS'), (',', ','), Dataset | Surveys of Manufacturing Technology | …the author assumes, as the Census Bureau did throughout most of the reports they published on the results of the SMT (1989, 1994), that non-response to any technology use question indicates that the plant is not using that technology. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('author', 'NN'), ('assumes', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('as', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('throughout', 'IN'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('reports', 'NNS'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('published', 'VBD'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('results', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('1989', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1994', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('that', 'DT'), ('non-response', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('any', 'DT'), ('technology', 'NN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('question', 'NN'), ('indicates', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('plant', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('not', 'RB'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('that', 'IN'), ('technology', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Surveys of Manufacturing Technology | …the SMT asked about foreign ownership and how much of a plant's production was exported to foreign countries. These controls have little impact on 2SLS estimates.  Also available are controls on the nature and difficulty of worker training, and whether research and development occurs at the plant. These controls have little impact on estimates as well. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('SMT', 'NNP'), ('asked', 'VBD'), ('about', 'IN'), ('foreign', 'JJ'), ('ownership', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('how', 'WRB'), ('much', 'JJ'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('plant', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('production', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('exported', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('foreign', 'JJ'), ('countries', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('These', 'DT'), ('controls', 'NNS'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('little', 'JJ'), ('impact', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('2SLS', 'CD'), ('estimates', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Also', 'RB'), ('available', 'JJ'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('controls', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('nature', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('difficulty', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('worker', 'NN'), ('training', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('whether', 'IN'), ('research', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('development', 'NN'), ('occurs', 'NNS'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('plant', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('These', 'DT'), ('controls', 'NNS'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('little', 'JJ'), ('impact', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('estimates', 'NNS'), ('as', 'IN'), ('well', 'RB'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Surveys of Manufacturing Technology | …a continuous mesaure of the use of these technologies is available in the 1993 survey. For a limited number of technologies, the 1993 survey asked plants to report the "number of dedicated workstations (or items of equipment)." The technologies covered by this question include computer aided desing, engineering, and manufacturing; numerically controlled machines; materials working lasers; pick and place and other robots; programmable controllers; and computers used for control on the factory floor. These make up more than half of the technologies in use at the average worker's plant in 1993.  | [('…a', 'RB'), ('continuous', 'JJ'), ('mesaure', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('use', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('available', 'JJ'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1993', 'CD'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('For', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('limited', 'JJ'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('1993', 'CD'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('asked', 'VBD'), ('plants', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('report', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('dedicated', 'JJ'), ('workstations', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('or', 'CC'), ('items', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('equipment', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.'), ("''", "''"), ('The', 'DT'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), ('covered', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('question', 'NN'), ('include', 'VBP'), ('computer', 'NN'), ('aided', 'VBD'), ('desing', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('engineering', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('manufacturing', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('numerically', 'RB'), ('controlled', 'VBN'), ('machines', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('materials', 'NNS'), ('working', 'VBG'), ('lasers', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('pick', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('place', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('robots', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('programmable', 'JJ'), ('controllers', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('and', 'CC'), ('computers', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('control', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('factory', 'NN'), ('floor', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('These', 'DT'), ('make', 'VBP'), ('up', 'RP'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('half', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('technologies', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('use', 'NN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('average', 'JJ'), ('worker', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('plant', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1993', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …using the Current Population Survey or PUMS to analyze the taxes and benefits received by immigrant individuals or immigrant-headed households in a given year is misleading, because current United States immigrant individuals are disproportionately of working age and pay more in taxes than they cost in benefits, while calculating based on immigrant households is also misleading, because United States born children of immigrants count only while they live with their immigrant parents and once they have matured into the labor force and head their own households, their tax payments are excluded. | [('…using', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('or', 'CC'), ('PUMS', 'NNP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('analyze', Dataset | Census Bureau | …annual population growth in the United States is expected to slow from about 1% in the 1980s and 1990s to a little more than 0.6% from 2011 to 2030. Dataset | State Agencies | …growth rates are projected to vary across states. For example, populations in Arizona and Colorado are projected to grow 1.5% or more annually from 2011 to 2030, continuing a trend over the last three decades of fast growth due to in-migration. Over the same period, population growth in Maine and Pennsylvania is expected to reamin close to zero, continuing the historical trends in these states of grwoth rates below the national average. | [('…growth', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('projected', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('vary', 'VB'), ('across', 'IN'), ('states', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('For', 'IN'), ('example', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('populations', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('Arizona', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Colorado', 'NNP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('projected', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('grow', 'VB'), ('1.5', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('annually', 'RB'), ('from', 'IN'), ('2011', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2030', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('continuing', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('trend', 'NN'), ('over', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('last', 'JJ'), ('three', 'CD'), ('decades', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('fast', 'JJ'), ('growth', 'NN'), ('due', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('in-migration', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Over', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('same', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('population', 'NN'), ('growth', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('Maine', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Pennsylvania', 'NNP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('expected', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('reamin', 'VB'), ('close', 'RB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('zero', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('continuing', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('historical', 'JJ'), ('trends', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('states', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('grwoth', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('below', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('national', 'JJ'), ('average', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Internal Revenue Service | …according to 2008 data from the Internal Revenue Service, average federal taxable net capital gains, taxable interest, and dividends increase dramatically from age cohorts younger than 35 to those in the 35-to-44 age cohort and continue to increase for older cohorts. Although these three income sources make up less than 3% of income for tax filers aged 18 and 34, they make up about 35% of income for those who are 65 and older. | [('…according', 'VBG'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2008', 'CD'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Internal', 'NNP'), ('Revenue', 'NNP'), ('Service', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('average', 'JJ'), ('federal', 'JJ'), ('taxable', 'JJ'), ('net', 'JJ'), ('capital', 'NN'), ('gains', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('taxable', 'JJ'), ('interest', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('dividends', 'NNS'), ('increase', 'VBP'), ('dramatically', 'RB'), ('from', 'IN'), ('age', 'NN'), ('cohorts', 'NNS'), ('younger', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('35', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('those', 'DT'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('35-to-44', 'JJ'), ('age', 'NN'), ('cohort', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('continue', 'VB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('increase', 'VB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('older', 'JJR'), ('cohorts', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Although', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('three', 'CD'), ('income', 'NN'), ('sources', 'NNS'), ('make', 'VBP'), ('up', 'RP'), ('less', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('3', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('income', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('tax', 'NN'), ('filers', 'NNS'), ('aged', 'VBD'), ('18', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('34', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('they', 'PRP'), ('make', 'VBP'), ('up', 'RP'), ('about', 'RB'), ('35', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('income', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('who', 'WP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('65', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('older', 'JJR'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | May Current Population Survey | …in the 1973 to 1979 May Current Population Survey, wages were not allocated for workers who refused to answer the wage questions, so to be consistent, the researcher keeps only workers with nonallocated wages in the 1979 to 2003 ORG supplment and as a consequence, is forced to drop observations for 1994 and the first eight months of 1995 in which the Current Population Survey did not flag workers with missing wages. | [('…in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('May', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('allocated', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('who', 'WP'), ('refused', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('answer', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('questions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('so', 'IN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('be', 'VB'), ('consistent', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('researcher', 'NN'), ('keeps', 'VBZ'), ('only', 'RB'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('nonallocated', 'JJ'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2003', 'CD'), ('ORG', 'NNP'), ('supplment', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('as', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('consequence', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('forced', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('drop', 'VB'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('1994', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('first', 'JJ'), ('eight', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1995', 'CD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('flag', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('missing', 'VBG'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | ORG Current Population Survey | …the researcher follows most of the literature by trimming wages less than $1 and more than $100 in 1979 dollars, by adjusting top-coded earnings by a factor of 1.4, and weight wage observations by hours of work, and limiting the sample to keep workers age 16 to 64 with positive potential experience. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('researcher', 'NN'), ('follows', 'VBZ'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('literature', 'NN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('trimming', 'VBG'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('less', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('$', '$'), ('1', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('$', '$'), ('100', 'CD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('dollars', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('by', 'IN'), ('adjusting', 'VBG'), ('top-coded', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('factor', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1.4', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('weight', 'NN'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('work', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('limiting', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('keep', 'VB'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('age', 'NN'), ('16', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('64', 'CD'), ('with', 'IN'), ('positive', 'JJ'), ('potential', 'JJ'), ('experience', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | ORG Current Population Survey | …in this supplement of the Current Population Survey, a growing faction of workers do not answer questions about wages and earnings, through which the Census Bureau allocates a wage or earnings item for these workers using the "hot deck" procedure while also providing flags and related sources of information that can be used to identify workers with allocated wages in all years except in the January 1994 to August ORG Supplements. | [('…in', 'NN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('a', 'DT'), ('growing', 'VBG'), ('faction', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('answer', 'VB'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('about', 'IN'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('through', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('allocates', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('item', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('hot', 'JJ'), ('deck', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('procedure', 'NN'), ('while', 'IN'), ('also', 'RB'), ('providing', 'VBG'), ('flags', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('related', 'JJ'), ('sources', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('information', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('can', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('identify', 'VB'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('allocated', 'JJ'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('except', 'IN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('January', 'NNP'), ('1994', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('August', 'NNP'), ('ORG', 'NNP'), ('Supplements', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | ORG Current Population Survey | …in the first sample years from 1975 to 1980, the weekly topcode in this supplement was $999, while in the last sample years from 1998 to 2003, the weekly topcode in this supplement is $2,884, which is identical to the implied weekly topcode for full-year workers in the March Current Population Survey. | [('…in', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('first', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1975', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1980', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('topcode', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('999', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('last', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1998', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2003', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('topcode', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('$', '$'), ('2,884', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('identical', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('implied', 'JJ'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('topcode', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('full-year', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | March Current Population Survey | …in the first sample years from 1975 to 1980, the computed weekly topcode for full year workers in the March Current Population Survey was $962 for full-year workers ($50,000 annual topcode divided by 52), while in the last sample years from 1998 to 2003, the weekly topcode is $2,884 ($150,000 annual topcode divided by 52). | [('…in', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('first', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1975', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1980', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('computed', 'JJ'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('topcode', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('full', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('962', 'CD'), ('for', 'IN'), ('full-year', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('$', '$'), ('50,000', 'CD'), ('annual', 'JJ'), ('topcode', 'NN'), ('divided', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('52', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('last', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1998', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2003', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('topcode', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('$', '$'), ('2,884', 'CD'), ('(', '('), ('$', '$'), ('150,000', 'CD'), ('annual', 'JJ'), ('topcode', 'NN'), ('divided', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('52', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | March Current Population Survey | …wages are more noisily measured in the March Current Population Survey than the May/ORG Supplements of the Current Population Survey suggesting that residual wage inequality is biased up in the March Current Population Survey because this wage measure poorly captures the hourly wage rate for workers paid by the hour. | [('…wages', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('noisily', 'RB'), ('measured', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('than', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('May/ORG', 'NNP'), ('Supplements', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('suggesting', 'VBG'), ('that', 'IN'), ('residual', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('inequality', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('biased', 'VBN'), ('up', 'RP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('because', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('measure', 'NN'), ('poorly', 'RB'), ('captures', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('hourly', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('paid', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('hour', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | March Current Population Survey | …measurement problems do not affect between-group wage dispersion but spuriously inflate residual wage dispersion in the March Current Population Survey, suggesting that residual wage inequality is biased up in the March Current Population Survey because this wage measure poorly captures the hourly wage rate for workers paid by the hour. | [('…measurement', 'NN'), ('problems', 'NNS'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('affect', 'VB'), ('between-group', 'NN'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('dispersion', 'NN'), ('but', 'CC'), ('spuriously', 'RB'), ('inflate', 'JJ'), ('residual', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('dispersion', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('suggesting', 'VBG'), ('that', 'IN'), ('residual', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('inequality', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('biased', 'VBN'), ('up', 'RP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('because', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('measure', 'NN'), ('poorly', 'RB'), ('captures', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('hourly', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('paid', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('hour', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …in order to have analogous results for individual income, the author estimated models for monthly and quarterly data that were constructed from the 1984 Survey of Income and Program Participation (SIPP). | [('…in', 'JJ'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('have', 'VB'), ('analogous', 'JJ'), ('results', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('individual', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('author', 'NN'), ('estimated', 'VBD'), ('models', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('monthly', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('quarterly', 'JJ'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('constructed', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1984', 'CD'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Income', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Program', 'NNP'), ('Participation', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …this panel survey was conducted three times a year from late 1983 to the beginning of 1986 in about 20,000 households and collected monthly income information. In each interview, separate information was collected on each of the past four months. The SIPP uses a rotation group design, where one fourth of the sample is interviewed in every calendar month. | [('…this', 'JJ'), ('panel', 'NN'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('conducted', 'VBN'), ('three', 'CD'), ('times', 'NNS'), ('a', 'DT'), ('year', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('late', 'JJ'), ('1983', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('beginning', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1986', 'CD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('about', 'RB'), ('20,000', 'CD'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('collected', 'VBN'), ('monthly', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), ('information', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('In', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('interview', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('separate', 'JJ'), ('information', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('collected', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('past', 'JJ'), ('four', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('uses', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('design', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('where', 'WRB'), ('one', 'CD'), ('fourth', 'JJ'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('interviewed', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('every', 'DT'), ('calendar', 'NN'), ('month', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …two alternative approaches are taken to estimate income processes from the data, using the data in two different ways. The first is to construct a panel of quarterly income from the fourth quarter of 1983 to the first quarter of 1986, the longest span for which information on the entire sample is available. These data are used to estimate parsimonious but otherwise unrestricted income processes. Unfortunately, much of the measured variance and dynamics in these data may be due to measurement error. To account at least for some of the error, the author also estimates a simple structural income process for the monthly data jointly with a model of misreporting behavior. Under certain assumptions, one can identify some of the response error. The implied quarterly income process net of measurement error is then derived by time aggregating the results. | [('…two', 'JJ'), ('alternative', 'JJ'), ('approaches', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('taken', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('estimate', 'VB'), ('income', 'NN'), ('processes', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('using', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …families were selected that can be followed continuously throughout the sample period and did not change head or spouse. The sample selection will tend to understate the variance of income changes. Furthermore, the sample was limited to households whose head did not go to school in any part of the sample period. Nonfamily households were eliminated as well since the author can not judge whether they make joint or individual consumption decisions. finally, the sample was limited to families with heads between the ages of 16 and 70. | [('…families', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('selected', 'VBN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('can', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('followed', 'VBN'), ('continuously', 'RB'), ('throughout', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('change', 'VB'), ('head', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('spouse', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('selection', 'NN'), ('will', 'MD'), ('tend', 'VB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('understate', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('variance', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('income', 'NN'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Furthermore', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('limited', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('whose', 'WP$'), ('head', 'NN'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('go', 'VB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('school', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('any', 'DT'), ('part', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Nonfamily', 'RB'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('eliminated', 'VBN'), ('as', 'RB'), ('well', 'RB'), ('since', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('author', 'NN'), ('can', 'MD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('judge', 'VB'), ('whether', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('make', 'VBP'), ('joint', 'JJ'), ('or', 'CC'), ('individual', 'JJ'), ('consumption', 'NN'), ('decisions', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('finally', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('limited', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('families', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('heads', 'NNS'), ('between', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('ages', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('16', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('70', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …variables on total family income and income from capital are provided on the SIPP user tapes; these are aggregated from an array of detailed questions on various income categories for each family member. | [('…variables', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('family', 'NN'), ('income', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('income', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('capital', 'NN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('provided', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('user', 'NNP'), ('tapes', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('these', 'DT'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('aggregated', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('array', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('detailed', 'JJ'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('various', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), ('categories', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('family', 'NN'), ('member', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …the author uses the aggregate family level variables, although there are some problems associated with them. First, tax information is only collected annually and cannot be apportioned to single months. Therefore, gross income must be used, which will have ahigher variance and (in a progressive tax system) exhibit more transitory fluctuations than net income. Furthermore, the individual variables that make up family income can have imputations. Since the imputations occur at the disaggregated level it would be rather arbitrary to decide which observations to delete because of the imputation. The author decides to use all the data. Imputations raise the variance of income changes, presumably largely at the cost of the transitory income component. Finally, all disaggregated income items are topcoded at $8,333 per month. It is impossible to decide from the aggregated income items which variables have been topcoded. Therefore, all observations subject to topcoding are kept in the sample at the topcoded amounts. The topcoding should only affect a small portion of the sample and will reduce the estimated income variance. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('author', 'NN'), ('uses', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('aggregate', 'JJ'), ('family', 'NN'), ('level', 'NN'), ('variables', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('although', 'IN'), ('there', 'EX'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('some', 'DT'), ('problems', 'NNS'), ('associated', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the author provided some basic characteristics of the sample which also presents results from the March 1985 Current Population Survey (CPS). | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('author', 'NN'), ('provided', 'VBD'), ('some', 'DT'), ('basic', 'JJ'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('also', 'RB'), ('presents', 'VBZ'), ('results', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('1985', 'CD'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('CPS', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …about 2% of the households in each wave report total income of $8,333 or more. This is an upper bound for the incidence of topcoding since it may result by summing various components that may each be below the cutoff.  | [('…about', 'RB'), ('2', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('wave', 'NN'), ('report', 'NN'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('$', '$'), ('8,333', 'CD'), ('or', 'CC'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('an', 'DT'), ('upper', 'JJ'), ('bound', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('incidence', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('topcoding', 'VBG'), ('since', 'IN'), ('it', 'PRP'), ('may', 'MD'), ('result', 'VB'), ('by', 'IN'), ('summing', 'VBG'), ('various', 'JJ'), ('components', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('may', 'MD'), ('each', 'DT'), ('be', 'VB'), ('below', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('cutoff', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …the main measurement problem in the SIPP seems to be related to the timing of changes. As a referee pointed out, the family income in the SIPP has the feature that it is constant over a period of time and only changes at infrequent intervals. This constancy of income in the SIPP is mainly a feature of the interview structure. Recall that information is collected retrospectively by asking respondents separately about each of the past four months. This pattern is typically referred to as "seam bias" and is observed for most variables in the SIPP. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('main', 'JJ'), ('measurement', 'NN'), ('problem', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('seems', 'VBZ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('be', 'VB'), ('related', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('timing', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('As', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('referee', 'NN'), ('pointed', 'VBD'), ('out', 'RP'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('family', 'NN'), ('income', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('feature', 'NN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('it', 'PRP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('constant', 'JJ'), ('over', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('period', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('only', 'RB'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('at', 'IN'), ('infrequent', 'JJ'), ('intervals', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('constancy', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('income', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('mainly', 'RB'), ('a', 'DT'), ('feature', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('interview', 'NN'), ('structure', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Recall', 'VB'), ('that', 'DT'), ('information', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('collected', 'VBN'), ('retrospectively', 'RB'), ('by', 'IN'), ('asking', 'VBG'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('separately', 'RB'), ('about', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('past', 'JJ'), ('four', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('pattern', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('typically', 'RB'), ('referred', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('as', 'IN'), ('``', '``'), ('seam', 'NN'), ('bias', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('and', 'CC'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('observed', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('variables', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …47% of the families in the sample report no change in income from one month to the next if the information was collected in the same interview. Only 9% report constant income in two adjacent months if these reports come from different interviews. A large fraction, 27%, of respondents report constant income within the entire interview. | [('…47', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('families', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('report', 'NN'), ('no', 'DT'), ('change', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('income', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('one', 'CD'), ('month', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('next', 'JJ'), ('if', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('information', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('collected', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('same', 'JJ'), ('interview', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Only', 'RB'), ('9', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('report', 'NN'), ('constant', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('two', 'CD'), ('adjacent', 'JJ'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('if', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('reports', 'NNS'), ('come', 'VBP'), ('from', 'IN'), ('different', 'JJ'), ('interviews', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('A', 'DT'), ('large', 'JJ'), ('fraction', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('27', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('of', 'IN'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('report', 'NN'), ('constant', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), ('within', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('entire', 'JJ'), ('interview', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …there seems to be some consensus that most respondents of the SIPP tend to report roughly correct transitions (into and out of program participation of income recipiency, and of amounts) but fail to identify the exact timing of transitions or changes. Changes durin the four months of an interview seem to be underreported while too many changes are reported at the seams between interviews. | [('…there', 'RB'), ('seems', 'VBZ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('be', 'VB'), ('some', 'DT'), ('consensus', 'NN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('tend', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('report', 'VB'), ('roughly', 'RB'), ('correct', 'JJ'), ('transitions', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('into', 'IN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('out', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('program', 'NN'), ('participation', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('income', 'NN'), ('recipiency', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('of', 'IN'), ('amounts', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), ('but', 'CC'), ('fail', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('identify', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('exact', 'JJ'), ('timing', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('transitions', 'NNS'), ('or', 'CC'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Changes', 'NNS'), ('durin', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('four', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('interview', 'NN'), ('seem', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('be', 'VB'), ('underreported', 'VBN'), ('while', 'IN'), ('too', 'RB'), ('many', 'JJ'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('seams', 'NN'), ('between', 'IN'), ('interviews', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …all four types of behavior together are not identified from the data and the author will therefore only present selected combinations (i.e. set certain values of the proportion of households exhibiting a certain behavior to zero). | [('…all', 'DT'), ('four', 'CD'), ('types', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('behavior', 'NN'), ('together', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('identified', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('author', 'NN'), ('will', 'MD'), ('therefore', 'VB'), ('only', 'RB'), ('present', 'JJ'), ('selected', 'VBN'), ('combinations', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('i.e', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('set', 'VB'), ('certain', 'JJ'), ('values', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('proportion', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('exhibiting', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('certain', 'JJ'), ('behavior', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('zero', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …in estimating models of household behavior, the data have to be arranged according to the timing of SIPP interviews rather than according to calendar time. Recall that the SIPP has a rotation group design with each rotation group being interviewed in a different calendar month. In pooling the data across rotation groups according to the timing of SIPP interviews, the author ignores calendar time effects (like seasonality). The author uses only waves one to eight in the estimation because only two rotation groups were interviewed for nine waves. | [('…in', 'NN'), ('estimating', 'VBG'), ('models', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('household', 'NN'), ('behavior', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('be', 'VB'), ('arranged', 'VBN'), ('according', 'VBG'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('timing', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('interviews', 'NNS'), ('rather', 'RB'), ('than', 'IN'), ('according', 'VBG'), ('to', 'TO'), ('calendar', 'NN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Recall', 'VB'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('design', 'NN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('being', 'VBG'), ('interviewed', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('different', 'JJ'), ('calendar', 'NN'), ('month', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('In', 'IN'), ('pooling', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('across', 'IN'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('groups', 'NNS'), ('according', 'VBG'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('timing', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('SIPP', 'NNP'), ('interviews', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('author', 'NN'), ('ignores', 'VBZ'), ('calendar', 'JJ'), ('time', 'NN'), ('effects', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('like', 'IN'), ('seasonality', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('author', 'NN'), ('uses', 'VBZ'), ('only', 'RB'), ('waves', 'VBZ'), ('one', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('eight', 'CD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('estimation', 'NN'), ('because', 'IN'), ('only', 'RB'), ('two', 'CD'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('groups', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('interviewed', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('nine', 'CD'), ('waves', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | National Income and Product Accounts | …in order to replicate the results often cited in the literature, the author makes the same adjustments to the NIPA data as Blinder and Deaton (1985) did. Dataset | Survey of Income and Program Participation | …the 1984 Survey of Income and Program Participation was conducted in nine interview waves. The sample consisted of four rotation groups. The households in the first rotation groups were interviewed in October, 1983. The ninth interview for the first rotation group was in June, 1986. Similarly, rotation group two was interviewed nine times from November 1983 to July, 1986. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …one important limitation of the March Current Population Survey is that it does not adequately capture income received by those at the very top of the distribution. The Current Population Survey income data are not only top-coded, but the survey itself does not include sufficient numbers of high-income households to make reliable estimates of incomes at the very top of the distribution, the top one percent of the top one-tenth of one percent, for example. | [('…one', 'NN'), ('important', 'JJ'), ('limitation', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('it', 'PRP'), ('does', 'VBZ'), ('not', 'RB'), ('adequately', 'RB'), ('capture', 'JJ'), ('income', 'NN'), ('received', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('very', 'RB'), ('top', 'JJ'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('distribution', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('income', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('only', 'RB'), ('top-coded', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('but', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('itself', 'PRP'), ('does', 'VBZ'), ('not', 'RB'), ('include', 'VB'), ('sufficient', 'JJ'), ('numbers', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('high-income', 'JJ'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('make', 'VB'), ('reliable', 'JJ'), ('estimates', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('incomes', 'NNS'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('very', 'RB'), ('top', 'JJ'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('distribution', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('top', 'JJ'), ('one', 'CD'), ('percent', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('top', 'JJ'), ('one-tenth', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('one', 'CD'), ('percent', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('for', 'IN'), ('example', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Census | …to understand the impact of changes in taxes and transfers on poverty during and after the Great Recession, researchers turn to experimental poverty figures produced directly by the Census Bureau. These experiemtnal figures reflect improvements to the measurement of poverty recommended by the National Academy of Sciences. The NAS recommedations, subsequent Census Bureau refinements of them, alter the resources available to household beyond what is included in "Money Income" by adding other transfers income and subtracting taxes. These measures go further still by adding in the value of subsidized housing and school lunhes, and energy assistance, and subtracting work-related expenses including child care. | [('…to', 'NN'), Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …in order to examine people's information sets and decisions, researchers added a novel set of questions to the August 2013 Survey of Consumer Expectations, a nationally representative survey of United States household heads run by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. | [('…in', 'JJ'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('examine', 'VB'), ('people', 'NNS'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('information', 'NN'), ('sets', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('decisions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('added', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('novel', 'JJ'), ('set', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('August', 'NNP'), ('2013', 'CD'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Consumer', 'NNP'), ('Expectations', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('a', 'DT'), ('nationally', 'RB'), ('representative', 'JJ'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('household', 'VBD'), ('heads', 'NNS'), ('run', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Federal', 'NNP'), ('Reserve', 'NNP'), ('Bank', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('New', 'NNP'), ('York', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …importantly, researchers make a distinction between perceptions of college returns for the United States population on average, and for the individual themselves. In this paper, researchers refer to income differentials by education levels as returns to education; however, this term is not meant to imply causal returns to schooling. | [('…importantly', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('make', 'VBP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('distinction', 'NN'), ('between', 'IN'), ('perceptions', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('college', 'NN'), ('returns', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('population', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('average', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('individual', 'JJ'), ('themselves', 'PRP'), ('.', '.'), ('In', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('paper', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('refer', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('income', 'NN'), ('differentials', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('education', 'NN'), ('levels', 'NNS'), ('as', 'IN'), ('returns', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('education', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('however', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('this', 'DT'), ('term', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('not', 'RB'), ('meant', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('imply', 'VB'), ('causal', 'JJ'), ('returns', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('schooling', 'VBG'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …while there is substantial heterogeneity in perceptions, the distribution of perceptions is skewed to the right of the objective numbers: researchers find that the perceived public university cost of 77%  (86%) of the respondents are above the actual sticker (net) public costs. | [('…while', 'IN'), ('there', 'EX'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('substantial', 'JJ'), ('heterogeneity', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('perceptions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('distribution', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('perceptions', 'NNS'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('skewed', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('right', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('objective', 'JJ'), ('numbers', 'NNS'), (':', ':'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('find', 'VBP'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('perceived', 'JJ'), ('public', 'JJ'), ('university', 'NN'), ('cost', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('77', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('86', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('above', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('actual', 'JJ'), ('sticker', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('net', 'JJ'), (')', ')'), ('public', 'NN'), ('costs', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | ..the main object of interest measured from this data is the respondent's reported likelihood of their (pre-college age, defined as ages 6 to 17) child attending college in the future, and their beliefs regarding their child's future earnings with and without a college degree (which allow researchers to derive the perceived child's relative college earnings). These questions are asked of respondents who have a child in this age range; these individuals comprise about a quarter of the relevant sample. | [('..the', 'NN'), ('main', 'JJ'), ('object', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('interest', 'NN'), ('measured', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('respondent', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('reported', 'VBD'), ('likelihood', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('(', '('), ('pre-college', 'JJ'), ('age', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('defined', 'VBD'), ('as', 'IN'), ('ages', 'NNS'), ('6', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('17', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('child', 'NN'), ('attending', 'VBG'), ('college', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('future', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('beliefs', 'NNS'), ('regarding', 'VBG'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('child', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('future', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('without', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('college', 'NN'), ('degree', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('which', 'WDT'), ('allow', 'VBP'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('derive', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('perceived', 'JJ'), ('child', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('relative', 'JJ'), ('college', 'NN'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.'), ('These', 'DT'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('asked', 'VBN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('who', 'WP'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('child', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('age', 'NN'), ('range', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('these', 'DT'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('comprise', 'VBP'), ('about', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('quarter', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('relevant', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …the sampling frame for the Survey of Consumer Expectations is based on that used for the Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Survey. Respondents to the Consumer Confidence Survey, itself based on a representative national sample drawn from mailing addresses, are invited to join the Survey of Consumer Expenditures internet panel. Each survey typically takes about fifteen minutes to complete. The response rate for first-time invitees hovers around 55%. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('sampling', 'NN'), ('frame', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Consumer', 'NNP'), ('Expectations', 'NNP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('that', 'DT'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Conference', 'NNP'), ('Board', 'NNP'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('Consumer', 'NNP'), ('Confidence', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('.', '.'), ('Respondents', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Consumer', 'NNP'), ('Confidence', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('itself', 'PRP'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('representative', 'JJ'), ('national', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('drawn', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('mailing', 'VBG'), ('addresses', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('are', 'VBP'), ('invited', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('join', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Consumer', 'NNP'), ('Expenditures', 'NNP'), ('internet', 'JJ'), ('panel', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Each', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('typically', 'RB'), ('takes', 'VBZ'), ('about', 'IN'), ('fifteen', 'JJ'), ('minutes', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('complete', 'VB'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('response', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('first-time', 'JJ'), ('invitees', 'NNS'), ('hovers', 'NNS'), ('around', 'IN'), ('55', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …in August 2013, repeat panelists (that is, those who had participated in the survey in the prior eleven months) were invited to participate in the special module. Out of a total sample of 1,289 household heads invited to participate in the survey, 1,029 did so, implying a response rate of 78.8%. The survey was fielded during August 1 through 31, 2013. Respondents received $15 for completing the survey. | [('…in', 'NN'), ('August', 'NNP'), ('2013', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('repeat', 'NN'), ('panelists', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('that', 'DT'), ('is', 'VBZ'), (',', ','), ('those', 'DT'), ('who', 'WP'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('participated', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('prior', 'JJ'), ('eleven', 'JJ'), ('months', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('invited', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('participate', 'VB'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('special', 'JJ'), ('module', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Out', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1,289', 'CD'), ('household', 'NN'), ('heads', 'NNS'), ('invited', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('participate', 'VB'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('1,029', 'CD'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('so', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('implying', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('response', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('78.8', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('fielded', 'VBN'), ('during', 'IN'), ('August', 'NNP'), ('1', 'CD'), ('through', 'IN'), ('31', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('2013', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Respondents', 'NNS'), ('received', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('15', 'CD'), ('for', 'IN'), ('completing', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …survey respondents were asked about the average earnings of current 40 year olds working full-time, with and without a degree (population earnings beliefs), the average annual total cost (including room, board, and tuition) of a 4-year public as well as private univeristy (population cost beliefs), their current earnings and their beliefs about current earnings in the counterfactual state of education (self earnings beliefs), the net cost of college attendance for themselves (or, for those without a college degree, their expected cost had they attended college), also asking college (non-college) respondents for their likelihood of attending college had net costs been higher (lower) than their perceived costs (self cost beliefs), the likelihood of their child attending college, and beliefs about the child's earnings at age 30 in the case of their child earning or nont earning a colleg degree. | [('…survey', 'JJ'), ('respondents', Dataset | Integrated Public Use Microdata Series | …researchers use the Minnesota Population Center's 2012 Integrated Public Use Microdata Series, which in turn is derived from the United States Census and the American Community Survey, to calculate local average earnings of 40-year-olds at the Public Use Microeconomic Area level. | [('…researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Minnesota', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Center', 'NNP'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('2012', 'CD'), ('Integrated', 'NNP'), ('Public', 'NNP'), ('Use', 'NNP'), ('Microdata', 'NNP'), ('Series', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('in', 'IN'), ('turn', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('derived', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('American', 'NNP'), ('Community', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('to', 'TO'), ('calculate', 'VB'), ('local', 'JJ'), ('average', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('40-year-olds', 'NNS'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Public', 'NNP'), ('Use', 'NNP'), ('Microeconomic', 'NNP'), ('Area', 'NNP'), ('level', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …the relevant sample has respondents with higher income and higher educational attainment, and also has more white respondents, than the United States population overall; 69% have annual household income greater than the $50,000 United States median, while 57% have bachelor's degrees and 90% are white. This may partly reflect differential internet access and computer literacy across various demographics. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('relevant', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('higher', 'JJR'), ('income', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('higher', 'JJR'), ('educational', 'JJ'), ('attainment', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('also', 'RB'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('white', 'JJ'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('than', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('population', 'NN'), ('overall', 'RB'), (';', ':'), ('69', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('annual', 'JJ'), ('household', 'NN'), ('income', 'NN'), ('greater', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('$', '$'), ('50,000', 'CD'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('median', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('57', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('bachelor', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('degrees', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('90', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('white', 'JJ'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('may', 'MD'), ('partly', 'RB'), ('reflect', 'VB'), ('differential', 'JJ'), ('internet', 'NN'), ('access', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('computer', 'NN'), ('literacy', 'NN'), ('across', 'IN'), ('various', 'JJ'), ('demographics', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the aggregated sample of the Current Population Survey (over the twelve months in 2012) includes 13,815 respondents, though due to the sampling methodology of the Current Population Survey, some people appear in the dataset twice (in different months). Dataset | Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System  | …Public Use Microeconomic Areas are the smallest geographic data available in the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series census data. Each Public Use Microeconomic Area holds at least 100,000 people. Public Use Microeconomic Areas tend to follow county boundaries (without ever crossing state boundaries) and are larger than counties. There are 630 Public Use Microeconomic Areas in the United States. | [('…Public', 'JJ'), ('Use', 'NNP'), ('Microeconomic', 'NNP'), ('Areas', 'NNP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('smallest', 'JJS'), ('geographic', 'JJ'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('available', 'JJ'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Integrated', 'NNP'), ('Public', 'NNP'), ('Use', 'NNP'), ('Microdata', 'NNP'), ('Series', 'NNP'), ('census', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Each', 'DT'), ('Public', 'NNP'), ('Use', 'NNP'), ('Microeconomic', 'NNP'), ('Area', 'NNP'), ('holds', 'VBZ'), ('at', 'IN'), ('least', 'JJS'), ('100,000', 'CD'), ('people', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Public', 'NNP'), ('Use', 'NNP'), ('Microeconomic', 'NNP'), ('Areas', 'NNP'), ('tend', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('follow', 'VB'), ('county', 'NN'), ('boundaries', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('without', 'IN'), ('ever', 'RB'), ('crossing', 'VBG'), ('state', 'NN'), ('boundaries', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), ('and', 'CC'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('larger', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('counties', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('There', 'EX'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('630', 'CD'), ('Public', 'NNP'), ('Use', 'NNP'), ('Microeconomic', 'NNP'), ('Areas', 'NNP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …after weighting the sample, 50% of respondents have lower-income, 33% are college graduates, and 53% are male. The average age of the respondents is 51 years, and 32% have high numeracy. Even after weighting the sample, 90% of respondents are white, suggesting that there has been an over-sample of that population. | [('…after', 'NN'), ('weighting', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('50', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('lower-income', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('33', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('college', 'NN'), ('graduates', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('53', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('male', 'JJ'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('average', 'JJ'), ('age', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('51', 'CD'), ('years', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('32', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('high', 'JJ'), ('numeracy', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Even', 'RB'), ('after', 'IN'), ('weighting', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('90', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('white', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('suggesting', 'VBG'), ('that', 'IN'), ('there', 'EX'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('been', 'VBN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('over-sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('that', 'DT'), ('population', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …53% of respondents report someone in the household (including themselves ever having a student loan. Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …population beliefs of non-college worker earnings were elicited as follows: "Consider all non-college graduate individuals (that is, individuals without a Bachelor's degree) currently aged 40 who are working full time right now. What do you believe is the average amount that these workers currently earn per year, before taxes and other deductions?" Population beliefs for college workers were elicited similarly. | [('…population', 'NN'), ('beliefs', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('non-college', 'JJ'), ('worker', 'NN'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('elicited', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('follows', 'VBZ'), (':', ':'), ('``', '``'), ('Consider', 'VB'), ('all', 'DT'), ('non-college', 'JJ'), ('graduate', 'NN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('that', 'DT'), ('is', 'VBZ'), (',', ','), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('without', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('Bachelor', 'NNP'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('degree', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('currently', 'RB'), ('aged', 'VBN'), ('40', 'CD'), ('who', 'WP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('working', 'VBG'), ('full', 'JJ'), ('time', 'NN'), ('right', 'RB'), ('now', 'RB'), ('.', '.'), ('What', 'WP'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('you', 'PRP'), ('believe', 'VB'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('average', 'JJ'), ('amount', 'NN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('currently', 'RB'), ('earn', 'VBP'), ('per', 'IN'), ('year', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('before', 'IN'), ('taxes', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('deductions', 'NNS'), ('?', '.'), ("''", "''"), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('beliefs', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('college', 'NN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('elicited', 'VBN'), ('similarly', 'RB'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …to gauge the accuracy of population earnings beliefs against true values, researchers use earnings information of 38 to 42 year old full-time workers from the 2012 Current Population Survey, pooling across the months. The data reveal that, in 2012, average earnings of full-time college-graduate workers were $75,353, while those of non-college workers were $41,210. | [('…to', 'JJ'), ('gauge', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('accuracy', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('population', 'NN'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('beliefs', 'NNS'), ('against', 'IN'), ('true', 'JJ'), ('values', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('information', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('38', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('42', 'CD'), ('year', 'NN'), ('old', 'JJ'), ('full-time', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2012', 'CD'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('pooling', 'VBG'), ('across', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('reveal', 'NN'), ('that', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('2012', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('average', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('full-time', 'JJ'), ('college-graduate', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('75,353', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('of', 'IN'), ('non-college', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('$', '$'), ('41,210', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the actual population relative college earnings, based on the 2012 Current Popultion Survey data, is 1.83; in fact, the relative college earnings has been between 1.76 and 1.83 since 2000, suggesting little change in relative earnings of colleg workers over the last decade or so. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('actual', 'JJ'), ('population', 'NN'), ('relative', 'JJ'), ('college', 'NN'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2012', 'CD'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Popultion', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('1.83', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('in', 'IN'), ('fact', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('relative', 'JJ'), ('college', 'NN'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('been', 'VBN'), ('between', 'IN'), ('1.76', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1.83', 'CD'), ('since', 'IN'), ('2000', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('suggesting', 'VBG'), ('little', 'JJ'), ('change', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('relative', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('colleg', 'NN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('over', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('last', 'JJ'), ('decade', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('so', 'RB'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Annual Survey of Colleges | …according to analysis by the College Board, the average annual net cost (including tuition, fees, room, and board) at a 4-year public university was $12,400 for the 2012-2013 school year, while the average annual sticker price was $18,170.
