Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …respondents were also asked about their beliefs for their oldest child in the age range 18 to 24 as well. A total of 142 respondents reported a child in this age range, and provided belief data for the child. However, the eventual goal is to see how respondents' current stock of knowledge affects their intended future actions for their pre-college age child. Since the decision of enrolling in college has already been made for these older childre, researchers exclude them from the analysis. As in the case of self own beliefs, self beliefs for these older children could be biased if respondents wanted to rationalize the course of action taken for their child- for example, an individual whose child (in the 18-24 age range) chooses not to enroll in college may report lower relative college returns for their child in order to rationalize the decision of not attending college. Therefore, excluding them seems the appropriate course of action. | [('…respondents', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('also', 'RB'), ('asked', 'VBN'), ('about', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('beliefs', 'NNS'), Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …researchers asked non-college respondents for the likelihood that they would not have attended college had the cost been 80% or 50% as high as they expected it to be, and asked college-educated respondents for the likelihood that they would have attended college had it cost 120% or 140% of the cost they actuall incurred. Dataset | Survey of Consumer Expectations | …this data proxies individual's overestimation of their own college cost with their current overestimation of the population average public. | [('…this', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('proxies', 'NNS'), ('individual', 'VBP'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('overestimation', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('own', 'JJ'), ('college', 'NN'), ('cost', 'NN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('overestimation', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('population', 'NN'), ('average', 'JJ'), ('public', 'JJ'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Census | …although the Current Population Survey and ACS are based on similar sample designs and the same survey equestion, certain methodological differences between the CPS and ACS could potentially contribute to the disparity. For example, while both sampling frames are drawn from the 2000 Census, the ACS uses postal addresses to update the sampling frame whereas the CPS uses building permits. Another methodological difference is that the ACS revisits vacant housing units for up to three months in order to collect data, whereas the CPS records a housing unit as vacant after the first visit. | [('…although', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('ACS', 'NNP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('similar', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('designs', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('same', 'JJ'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('equestion', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('certain', 'JJ'), ('methodological', 'JJ'), ('differences', 'NNS'), ('between', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('ACS', 'NNP'), ('could', 'MD'), ('potentially', 'RB'), ('contribute', 'VB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('disparity', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('For', 'IN'), ('example', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('both', 'DT'), ('sampling', 'VBG'), ('frames', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('drawn', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2000', 'CD'), ('Census', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('ACS', 'NNP'), ('uses', 'VBZ'), ('postal', 'JJ'), ('addresses', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('update', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sampling', 'NN'), ('frame', 'NN'), ('whereas', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('uses', 'VBZ'), ('building', 'NN'), ('permits', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Another', 'DT'), ('methodological', 'JJ'), ('difference', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('ACS', 'NNP'), ('revisits', 'VBZ'), ('vacant', 'JJ'), ('housing', 'NN'), ('units', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('up', 'IN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('three', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('collect', 'VB'), ('data', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('whereas', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('records', 'NNS'), ('a', 'DT'), ('housing', 'NN'), ('unit', 'NN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('vacant', 'NN'), ('after', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('first', 'JJ'), ('visit', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Census | …because researchers are unable to explain the divergence in migration rates between the Current Population Survey and other data sources, it is difficult to determine which source presents a more accurate picture of migration in the past five years. Researchers lean towards the IRS and ACS estimates, partly because they are based on larger samples, and partly because other datasets that have been examined, such as the Panel Study of Income Dynamics and the Survey of Income and Program Participation. | [('…because', 'NN'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('unable', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('explain', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('divergence', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('between', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('sources', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('it', 'PRP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('difficult', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('determine', 'VB'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('source', 'NN'), ('presents', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('accurate', 'JJ'), ('picture', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('past', 'JJ'), ('five', 'CD'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchers', 'NNS'), ('lean', 'JJ'), ('towards', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('IRS', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('ACS', 'NNP'), ('estimates', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('partly', 'RB'), ('because', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('larger', 'JJR'), ('samples', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('partly', 'RB'), ('because', 'IN'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('datasets', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('been', 'VBN'), ('examined', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('such', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Panel', 'NNP'), ('Study', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Income', 'NNP'), ('Dynamics', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Income', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Program', 'NNP'), ('Participation', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Census | …the American Community Survey data in all figures and analyses are based on microdata rather than published tables, in order to exclude individuals in group quarters or with imputed migration data. The group quarters exclusion matters for the ACS because prior to 2006 the ACS did not cover individuals in group quarters, who have a higher propensity to migrate than other individuals. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('American', 'NNP'), ('Community', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('figures', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('analyses', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('microdata', 'NNS'), ('rather', 'RB'), ('than', 'IN'), ('published', 'VBN'), ('tables', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('exclude', 'VB'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('quarters', 'NNS'), ('or', 'CC'), ('with', 'IN'), ('imputed', 'JJ'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('group', 'NN'), ('quarters', 'NNS'), ('exclusion', 'VBP'), ('matters', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('ACS', 'NNP'), ('because', 'IN'), ('prior', 'RB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2006', 'CD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('ACS', 'NNP'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('cover', 'VB'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('quarters', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('who', 'WP'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('higher', 'JJR'), ('propensity', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('migrate', 'VB'), ('than', 'IN'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Census | …this data source provides the greatest flexibility in defining migrants. For most years and samples since 1940, researchers can observe whether an individual is currently residing in a different state or county than five years ago, as well as the exact state of residence in those two periods. Beginning in 1980, researchers can also observe the current metropolitan area and the metropolitan area of residence 5 years ago for individuals living in cities in both periods. | [('…this', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('source', 'NN'), ('provides', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('greatest', 'JJS'), ('flexibility', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('defining', 'VBG'), ('migrants', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('For', 'IN'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('samples', 'NNS'), ('since', 'IN'), ('1940', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('can', 'MD'), ('observe', 'VB'), ('whether', 'IN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('individual', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('currently', 'RB'), ('residing', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('different', 'JJ'), ('state', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('county', 'NN'), ('than', 'IN'), ('five', 'CD'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('ago', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('as', 'RB'), ('well', 'RB'), ('as', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('exact', 'JJ'), ('state', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('residence', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('two', 'CD'), ('periods', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Beginning', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1980', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('can', 'MD'), ('also', 'RB'), ('observe', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('metropolitan', 'JJ'), ('area', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('metropolitan', 'JJ'), ('area', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('residence', 'NN'), ('5', 'CD'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('ago', 'RB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('living', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('cities', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('both', 'DT'), ('periods', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the Current Population Survey data in all figures and analyses are based on microdata rather than published tables, in order to exclude individuals in group quarters or with imputed migration data. The imputation exclusion matters for the Current Population Survey because their imputation methodology biased migration estimates upward from 1999 to 2005. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('figures', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('analyses', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('microdata', 'NNS'), ('rather', 'RB'), ('than', 'IN'), ('published', 'VBN'), ('tables', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('exclude', 'VB'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('quarters', 'NNS'), ('or', 'CC'), ('with', 'IN'), ('imputed', 'JJ'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('imputation', 'NN'), ('exclusion', 'NN'), ('matters', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('because', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('imputation', 'NN'), ('methodology', 'NN'), ('biased', 'VBD'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('estimates', 'NNS'), ('upward', 'RB'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1999', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2005', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the Current Population Survey sample excludes 1985 and 1995 because the one-year migration variable is unavailable for those years, and 1981 is excluded from the out-migration regressions because data on previous state is unavailable; due to missing information regarding negative equity shares, 49 states are represented in the Current Population Survey sample. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('sample', 'VBD'), ('excludes', 'NNS'), ('1985', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1995', 'CD'), ('because', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('one-year', 'JJ'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('variable', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('unavailable', 'JJ'), ('for', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('years', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('1981', 'CD'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('excluded', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('out-migration', 'NN'), ('regressions', 'NNS'), ('because', 'IN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('state', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('unavailable', 'JJ'), (';', ':'), ('due', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('missing', 'VBG'), ('information', 'NN'), ('regarding', 'VBG'), ('negative', 'JJ'), ('equity', 'NN'), ('shares', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('49', 'CD'), ('states', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('represented', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …this data reports a sharp decline since 2005 in annual migration rates. Indeed, the precipitous drop in the Current Population Survey migration estimates brought mobility by that measure to its lowest recorded level since the survey began in the late 1940s. Dataset | Eurobarometer | …the most recent Eurobarameter wave that asked questions on change of residence was 64.1, which was collected in September and October 2005. Tabulation of this data is derived fro question A4 in the survey, which asks the respondent "And could you tell me what year you moved in [to your current residence]?" Hence, these mobility rates should be interpreted as a move of any sort (across country, within country, and so on). | [('…the', 'NN'), ('most', 'RBS'), ('recent', 'JJ'), ('Eurobarameter', 'NN'), ('wave', 'VBP'), ('that', 'IN'), ('asked', 'VBD'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('change', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('residence', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('64.1', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('collected', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('September', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('October', 'NNP'), ('2005', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Tabulation', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('derived', 'VBN'), ('fro', 'JJ'), ('question', 'NN'), ('A4', 'NNP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('asks', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('respondent', 'NN'), ('``', '``'), ('And', 'CC'), ('could', 'MD'), ('you', 'PRP'), ('tell', 'VB'), ('me', 'PRP'), ('what', 'WP'), ('year', 'NN'), ('you', 'PRP'), ('moved', 'VBD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('[', 'NNP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('your', 'PRP$'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('residence', 'NN'), (']', 'NN'), ('?', '.'), ("''", "''"), ('Hence', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('these', 'DT'), ('mobility', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('should', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('interpreted', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('move', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('any', 'DT'), ('sort', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('across', 'IN'), ('country', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('within', 'IN'), ('country', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('so', 'RB'), ('on', 'IN'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Bureau of Economic Analysis | …combining Current Population Survey data on wages and Bureau of Economic Analysis data on capital and output without adjustment would lead to potential biases in the estimates of factor shares in GDP for three reasons. First, national income and GDP differ by the level of business taxes. SEcond, total wage compensation derived from the CPS is les than that derived from the BEA. Third, wages do not reflect total labor compensation. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the 33 years of Current Population Survey data span cohorts born as early as 1903 and as late as 1984 during some period of their lifetimes between the ages of 16 and 65. Dataset | Panel Study of Income Dynamics | …changes in the questionnaire skip pattern and question wording in the 1984 to 1987 surveys make the responses to the "reason for job change" question inconsistent over time. From 1984 through 1987, the "reason for job change" question was asked of all respondents who reported that their current job started after January of the previous year, rather than within the past 12 months as in prior years. This artificially inflates the job-changing rates based on this question for these 4 years. | [('…changes', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('questionnaire', 'NN'), ('skip', 'NN'), ('pattern', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('question', 'NN'), ('wording', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1984', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1987', 'CD'), ('surveys', 'NNS'), ('make', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('responses', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('reason', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('job', 'NN'), ('change', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('question', 'NN'), ('inconsistent', 'NN'), ('over', 'IN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('From', 'IN'), ('1984', 'CD'), ('through', 'IN'), ('1987', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('reason', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('job', 'NN'), ('change', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('question', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('asked', 'VBN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('who', 'WP'), ('reported', 'VBD'), ('that', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('started', 'VBD'), ('after', 'IN'), ('January', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('rather', 'RB'), ('than', 'IN'), ('within', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('past', 'JJ'), ('12', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('as', 'IN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('prior', 'JJ'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('artificially', 'RB'), ('inflates', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('job-changing', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('question', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('4', 'CD'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Researchers use the entire Panel Study of Income Dynamics sample, including the low-income sample, and use Panel Study of Income Dynamics sample weights throughout. Dataset | Panel Study of Income Dynamics | …for the survey years 1976 to 1977 and 1981 to 1992, tenure information is taken directly from questions about how long the worker has been with his or her current employer. An important disadvantage of using the employer tenure question is that it was not asked in the 1979 and 1980 surveys and was asked only of those under the age of 45 in 1978. While some previous work has used alternative measures to get around this gap in coverage of the employer tenure questions, researchers prefer to use this, the most straightfoward measure of employer tenure, in those years for which it is available. | [('…for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('1976', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1977', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1981', 'CD'), Dataset | Panel Study of Income Dynamics | …prior to 1984, the survey asked respondents how long they had worked for their present employer, without distinguishing between total time with the employer and a worker's most recent spell of employement. Beginning in 1984, respondents were explicity asked to provide the total time they had been with their employer. For workers who have multiple spells with a given employer, separated either tby nonemployment or employment with other firms, this change in question wording will prompt different answers. | [('…prior', 'RB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1984', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('asked', 'VBD'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('how', 'WRB'), ('long', 'RB'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('worked', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('present', 'JJ'), ('employer', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('without', 'IN'), ('distinguishing', 'VBG'), ('between', 'IN'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('time', 'NN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('employer', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('a', 'DT'), ('worker', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('most', 'RBS'), ('recent', 'JJ'), ('spell', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('employement', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Beginning', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1984', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('explicity', 'NN'), ('asked', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('provide', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('time', 'NN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('been', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('employer', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('For', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('who', 'WP'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('multiple', 'NNS'), ('spells', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('given', 'VBN'), ('employer', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('separated', 'VBD'), ('either', 'CC'), ('tby', 'JJ'), ('nonemployment', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('firms', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('this', 'DT'), ('change', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('question', 'NN'), ('wording', 'NN'), ('will', 'MD'), ('prompt', 'VB'), ('different', 'JJ'), ('answers', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Panel Study of Income Dynamics | ...the primary source for identifying promotions is the "reason for job change" question that distinguishes promotions from other types of job changes. Dataset | Panel Study of Income Dynamics | …the position-specific tenure variable is asked in all relevant survey years of the Panel Study of Income Dynamics; one issue with this variable, however, is that, between 1983 and 1984, the question wording was changed from asking about how long a worker has been in his or her present position to asking when the current position started (calendar month and year); the result of this change from a response in terms of a number of months to a response of a starting calendar month is that heaping of responses around multiples of 6 months is much more common prior to 1984. In contrast, the employer tenure question has always been asked in terms of the length of employment rather than the calendar month when the employment began. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('position-specific', Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the data employed from this data set comes from the tenure supplements included in the Current Population Survey in January of 1973, 1978, 1981, 1983, 1987, and 1991. Subsequent data is drawn from the employee benefits supplements from May 1979 and April 1993 and the displaced workers supplement from February 1996, which asked about employer tenure. Information on tenure is also available in the 1983 and 1988 employee benefits supplements. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('employed', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('set', 'NN'), ('comes', 'VBZ'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('included', 'VBD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('January', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1973', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1978', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1981', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1983', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1987', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('1991', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Subsequent', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('drawn', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('employee', 'NN'), ('benefits', 'NNS'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('May', 'NNP'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('April', 'NNP'), ('1993', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('displaced', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('supplement', 'VBP'), ('from', 'IN'), ('February', 'NNP'), ('1996', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('asked', 'VBD'), ('about', 'IN'), ('employer', 'NN'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('also', 'RB'), ('available', 'JJ'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1983', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1988', 'CD'), ('employee', 'NN'), ('benefits', 'NNS'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the measure of low tenure in the Current Population Survey is based on the tenure question asked in the various supplements. In 1973, 1978, and 1981, this question asks what years individuals started working in their current job; because the question was asked in January, it measures the incidence of low tenure within a 13-month window. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('measure', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('low', 'JJ'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('question', 'NN'), ('asked', 'VBD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('various', 'JJ'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('In', 'IN'), ('1973', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1978', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('1981', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('this', 'DT'), ('question', 'NN'), ('asks', 'VBZ'), ('what', 'WP'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('started', 'VBD'), ('working', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('because', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('question', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('asked', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('January', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('it', 'PRP'), ('measures', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('incidence', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('low', 'JJ'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('within', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('13-month', 'JJ'), ('window', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in 1979 and from 1983 forward, the Current Population Survey question on tenure asks about the length of time individuals worked for their current employer. The shift from calendar to elapsed time may cause the share of workers with low tenure to increases, however. For tenure longer than 1 year, the Current Population Survey measures tenure in integer year. If individuals follow a simple rounding rule, the 1 year or less tenure variable in the Current Population Survey will include all individuals who started working for their current employer in an 18-month window. | [('…in', 'NN'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1983', 'CD'), ('forward', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('question', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('asks', 'VBZ'), ('about', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('length', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('worked', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('employer', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('shift', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('calendar', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('elapsed', 'JJ'), ('time', 'NN'), ('may', 'MD'), ('cause', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('share', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('low', 'JJ'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('increases', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('however', 'RB'), ('.', '.'), ('For', 'IN'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('longer', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('1', 'CD'), ('year', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('measures', 'VBZ'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('integer', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('If', 'IN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('follow', 'VBP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('simple', 'JJ'), ('rounding', 'NN'), ('rule', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('1', 'CD'), ('year', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('less', 'JJR'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('variable', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('will', 'MD'), ('include', 'VB'), ('all', 'DT'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('who', 'WP'), ('started', 'VBD'), ('working', 'VBG'), ('for', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('employer', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('18-month', 'JJ'), ('window', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …because it is thought that the simultaneous shifts from job to employer tenure and from calendar to elapsed time were roughly offsetting in their impact on our measure of low employer tenure. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the break in the Current Population Survey series between the "old" and "new" questions coincides with a change in the relevant question reference from job to employer. Thus, the expectation is that the Current Population Survey observations using the old question may be elevated as individuals reported changes in jobs that could have occured without a change in employer. Of course, the change in the time period over which tenure is reported (from 13 to 18 months) would counter this tendency.  | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('break', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('series', 'NN'), ('between', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('old', 'JJ'), ("''", "''"), ('and', 'CC'), ('``', '``'), ('new', 'JJ'), ("''", "''"), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('coincides', 'VBZ'), ('with', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('change', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('relevant', 'JJ'), ('question', 'NN'), ('reference', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('job', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('employer', 'VB'), ('.', '.'), ('Thus', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('expectation', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('old', 'JJ'), ('question', 'NN'), ('may', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('elevated', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('jobs', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('could', 'MD'), ('have', 'VB'), ('occured', 'VBN'), ('without', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('change', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('employer', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Of', 'IN'), ('course', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('change', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('time', 'NN'), ('period', 'NN'), ('over', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('(', '('), ('from', 'IN'), ('13', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('18', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), ('would', 'MD'), ('counter', 'VB'), ('this', 'DT'), ('tendency', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Panel Study of Income Dynamics | …the general tendency for Panel Study of Income Dynamics studies to find an upward trend in employment instability where none is found using Current Dataset | Current Population Survey | …this data source is used to match husbands and wives for each year from 1968 to 2005. The authors then match couples' first interviews to their records in the following year, using gender, race, and age to exclude potentially invalid matches, following the algorithm suggested in Madrian and Lefgien (1999). Researchers match husbands and wives using marital status, household identifier, household type and relation of individuals to the household head. The current sample does not attempt to match across potential cohabitants. Using this method, over 97% of the individuals who report to be married and living with a spouse are matched. | [('…this', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('source', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('used', 'VBN'), Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the Current Population Survey is constructed such that a housing unit is interviewed for four months (Months in Sample = 1-4), rotates out of the sample for eight months, then returns for another four (Months in Sample = 5-8). For example, a unit that is first interviewed in March (Month in Sample = 1) will be re-interviewed starting in March of the next year (Month in Sample = 5). this allows potentially half of the units interviewed in a given year - those for whom Month in Sample = 1-4 - to be matched to their observations in the following year (Month in Sample = 5-8). | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('constructed', 'VBN'), ('such', 'JJ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('housing', 'NN'), ('unit', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('interviewed', 'VBN'), Dataset | Current Population Survey | …using unique record numbers available on the CPS data files constructed by the Unicon Research Corporation and the "Month in Sample" variable one can construct a naïve match across years. In actuality, this method leads to many false matches because the record number is unique to housing unit, not household; if, for example, a family moves out of thier house after interviews 1 to 4 and another family moves in, this method would naively match the two different families. Following recommendations in the literature by Madrian and Lefgien (1999), researchers use gender, race and age to exclude potentially invalid matches. Researchers then use marital status, household identifier, household type and relation of individuals to the ousehold head to match across couples. | [('…using', 'VBG'), ('unique', 'JJ'), ('record', 'DT'), ('ousehold', 'JJ'), ('head', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('match', 'VB'), ('across', 'IN'), ('couples', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in 1968, the CPS had 27,784 male records in the relevant age range. Of these, 81.1% were married with spouse present and matched to valid spouse observations. A well-known regarding this data is that the fraction of men who were married with spouse present fell dramatically over the span of the data, so that only 62.4% of male records were matched to spouses in 2005. For 1968, 77.7% of the potential couples were matched to observations in 1969. this match rate varies substantially across years and is particularly low during the last four years of the sample. Non-matches are due to migration, mortality, and reporting error. | [('…in', 'NN'), ('1968', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('27,784', 'CD'), ('male', 'NN'), Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the measure of search effort using this data is advantageous over the American Time Use Survey data in that this data has a larger sample size of 150,000 individuals per month and a longer sample period, even using the sample period after the 1994 redesign; however, the main shortcoming of this proxy is that it assumes that all methods are equally important and utilized with equal intensity across individuals and over time. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('measure', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('search', 'NN'), ('effort', 'NN'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('this', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('advantageous', 'JJ'), ('over', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('American', 'JJ'), ('Time', 'NNP'), ('Use', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('that', 'DT'), ('this', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('larger', 'JJR'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('size', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('150,000', 'CD'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('per', 'IN'), ('month', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('a', 'DT'), ('longer', 'RBR'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('even', 'RB'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('period', 'NN'), ('after', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1994', 'CD'), ('redesign', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('however', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('main', 'JJ'), ('shortcoming', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('proxy', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('it', 'PRP'), ('assumes', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('methods', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('equally', 'RB'), ('important', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('utilized', 'JJ'), ('with', 'IN'), ('equal', 'JJ'), ('intensity', 'NN'), ('across', 'IN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('over', 'IN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | American Time Use Survey | …researchers restrict respondents to those between the age of 25 and 70, while also dropping individual who report more than 8 hours of search in each day, ultimately excluding only 33 respondents or around 2.5% of the active searchers (annual this leaves the researchers with around 2,500 nonemployed respondents, around 400 classified unemployed active searchers and 130 respondents who report positive search time. | [('…researchers', 'NNS'), ('restrict', 'VBP'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('those', 'DT'), ('between', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('age', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('25', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('70', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('also', 'RB'), ('dropping', 'VBG'), ('individual', 'JJ'), ('who', 'WP'), ('report', 'VBP'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('8', 'CD'), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('search', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('day', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('ultimately', 'RB'), ('excluding', 'VBG'), ('only', 'RB'), ('33', 'CD'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('or', 'CC'), ('around', 'RB'), ('2.5', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('active', 'JJ'), ('searchers', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('annual', 'JJ'), ('this', 'DT'), ('leaves', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('around', 'IN'), ('2,500', 'CD'), ('nonemployed', 'JJ'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('around', 'IN'), ('400', 'CD'), ('classified', 'VBD'), ('unemployed', 'JJ'), ('active', 'JJ'), ('searchers', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('130', 'CD'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('who', 'WP'), ('report', 'VBP'), ('positive', 'JJ'), ('search', 'NN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in 1973, 1978 and 1981, the questions on the tenure supplements referred to time working at the present job or business as current tenure, while in 1983, 1987, and 1991, the question referred to time working continuously for the present employer, thus, to be safe, the researchers are careful to focus on changes in retention rates that are not influenced by changes in the wording of the tenure question. | [('…in', 'NN'), ('1973', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1978', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1981', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('referred', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('time', 'NN'), ('working', 'VBG'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('present', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('business', 'NN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('tenure', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1983', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('1987', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('1991', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('question', 'NN'), ('referred', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('time', 'NN'), ('working', 'VBG'), ('continuously', 'RB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('present', 'JJ'), ('employer', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('thus', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('to', 'TO'), ('be', 'VB'), ('safe', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('careful', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('focus', 'VB'), ('on', 'IN'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('retention', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('influenced', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('wording', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('question', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …limited to nonagricultural workers, currently working or with a job but not currently at work, aged 16 or older. | [('…limited', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('nonagricultural', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('currently', 'RB'), ('working', 'VBG'), ('or', 'CC'), ('with', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('job', 'NN'), ('but', 'CC'), ('not', 'RB'), ('currently', 'RB'), ('at', 'IN'), ('work', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('aged', 'VBD'), ('16', 'CD'), ('or', 'CC'), ('older', 'JJR'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …is ideal for drawing true representative samples because it is a random sample representative of the United States population, with weights already provided for each sample individual. | [('…is', 'JJ'), ('ideal', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('drawing', 'VBG'), ('true', 'JJ'), ('representative', 'NN'), ('samples', 'NNS'), ('because', 'IN'), ('it', 'PRP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('random', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('representative', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('population', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('with', 'IN'), ('weights', 'NNS'), ('already', 'RB'), ('provided', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('individual', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …nonresponse to the tenure supplement can vary across years and can vary differently based on demographics or other characteristics, therefore the researchers adjust the standard Current Population Survey sample weight by multiplying by the reciprocal of the response rate to the tenure question for each race-age-sex subgroup, with age grouped into 5-year intervals. | [('…nonresponse', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('can', 'MD'), ('vary', 'VB'), ('across', 'IN'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('can', 'MD'), ('vary', 'VB'), ('differently', 'RB'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('demographics', 'NNS'), ('or', 'CC'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('therefore', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('adjust', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('standard', 'JJ'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('sample', 'VBD'), ('weight', 'NN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('multiplying', 'VBG'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('reciprocal', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('response', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('question', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('race-age-sex', 'NN'), ('subgroup', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('with', 'IN'), ('age', 'NN'), ('grouped', 'VBN'), ('into', 'IN'), ('5-year', 'JJ'), ('intervals', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the Current Population Survey sample weight is the reciprocal of the probability of being sampled, adjusted for noninterview and variation in the sampling of race, age, sex, and residence subgroups. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('weight', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('reciprocal', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('probability', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('being', 'VBG'), ('sampled', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('adjusted', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('noninterview', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('variation', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sampling', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('race', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('age', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('sex', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('residence', 'NN'), ('subgroups', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in the 1983 and subsequent surveys, the tenure question asks how long a person has worked for his present employer and if the answer is less than 1 year, the respondent is queried as to length of tenure in months, otherwise the answer is recorded in years leading individuals to round up in the 12 to 24 month range. | [('…in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1983', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('subsequent', 'JJ'), ('surveys', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('question', 'NN'), ('asks', 'VBZ'), ('how', 'WRB'), ('long', 'JJ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('person', 'NN'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('worked', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('his', 'PRP$'), ('present', 'JJ'), ('employer', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('if', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('answer', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('less', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('1', 'CD'), ('year', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('respondent', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('queried', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('length', 'VB'), ('of', 'IN'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('months', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('otherwise', 'RB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('answer', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('recorded', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('leading', 'VBG'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('round', 'VB'), ('up', 'RP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('12', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('24', 'CD'), ('month', 'NN'), ('range', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …for the tenure supplement in 1983 and beyond, the tenure question leads to an issue of heaping because of rounding with regard to the number of years for which a respondent has worked for the present employer, while in the pre-1983 supplements in which respondents reported the year they began the tenure spell, any such heaping is much less evident. | [('…for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1983', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('beyond', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('question', 'NN'), ('leads', 'VBZ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('an', 'DT'), ('issue', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('heaping', 'VBG'), ('because', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('rounding', 'VBG'), ('with', 'IN'), ('regard', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('a', 'DT'), ('respondent', 'NN'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('worked', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('present', 'JJ'), ('employer', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('pre-1983', 'JJ'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('reported', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('year', 'NN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('began', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('spell', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('any', 'DT'), ('such', 'JJ'), ('heaping', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('much', 'RB'), ('less', 'RBR'), ('evident', 'JJ'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in 1991, 2.8% of respondents to the tenure supplement did not respond to the tenure question, whereas in 1983 and 1987 there was negligible nonresponse to the tenure questions among those who participated in the supplement. | [('…in', 'NN'), ('1991', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('2.8', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('respond', 'VB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('question', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('whereas', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1983', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1987', 'CD'), ('there', 'EX'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('negligible', 'JJ'), ('nonresponse', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('tenure', 'NN'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('among', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('who', 'WP'), ('participated', 'VBD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Panel Study of Income Dynamics | …includes two important questions of interest: one regarding current employment status and the other detecting employer changes among those who are continuously employed. | [('…includes', 'NNS'), ('two', 'CD'), ('important', 'JJ'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('interest', 'NN'), (':', ':'), ('one', 'CD'), ('regarding', 'VBG'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('status', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('detecting', 'VBG'), ('employer', 'JJ'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('among', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('who', 'WP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('continuously', 'RB'), ('employed', 'VBN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Panel Study of Income Dynamics | …from 1970 through 1983, respondents are coded as having no job change if their current job began 12 or more months ago, whereas from 1984 throught 1987, respondents are coded as having no job change if their current job began before the previous calendar year, and lastly from 1988 to 1990, respondents are coded as having no job change if they indicate having another main-job employer only during the previous calendar year. | [('…from', 'NN'), ('1970', 'CD'), ('through', 'IN'), ('1983', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('coded', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('having', 'VBG'), ('no', 'DT'), ('job', 'NN'), ('change', 'NN'), ('if', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('began', 'VBD'), ('12', 'CD'), ('or', 'CC'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('ago', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('whereas', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1984', 'CD'), ('throught', 'NN'), ('1987', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('coded', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('having', 'VBG'), ('no', 'DT'), ('job', 'NN'), ('change', 'NN'), ('if', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('began', 'VBD'), ('before', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('calendar', 'NN'), ('year', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('lastly', 'RB'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1988', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1990', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('coded', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('having', 'VBG'), ('no', 'DT'), ('job', 'NN'), ('change', 'NN'), ('if', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('indicate', 'VBP'), ('having', 'VBG'), ('another', 'DT'), ('main-job', 'NN'), ('employer', 'NN'), ('only', 'RB'), ('during', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('calendar', 'NN'), ('year', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Bureau of Economic Analysis | …for output, capital, investment, and depreciation, researchers use a new dataset on the nonfinancial corporate business (NFCB) sector recently published by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) of the US Department of Commerce, and quarterly investment series from the Federal Reserve Board. | [('…for', 'JJ'), ('output', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('capital', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('investment', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('depreciation', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('new', 'JJ'), ('dataset', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('nonfinancial', 'JJ'), ('corporate', 'JJ'), ('business', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('NFCB', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('sector', 'NN'), ('recently', 'RB'), ('published', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Economic', 'NNP'), ('Analysis', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('BEA', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('US', 'NNP'), ('Department', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Commerce', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('quarterly', 'JJ'), ('investment', 'NN'), ('series', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Federal', 'NNP'), ('Reserve', 'NNP'), ('Board', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Bureau of Economic Analysis | …this dataset leaves out variables thar are often used in the literature but that are not consistent with the current model, such as residential or government investment. | [('…this', 'JJ'), ('dataset', 'NN'), ('leaves', 'VBZ'), ('out', 'RP'), ('variables', 'NNS'), ('thar', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('often', 'RB'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('literature', 'NN'), ('but', 'CC'), ('that', 'DT'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('consistent', 'JJ'), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('model', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('such', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('residential', 'JJ'), ('or', 'CC'), ('government', 'NN'), ('investment', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …for gross hiring flows and for the separation rate, researchers use series based on Current Population Survey (CPS) data as computed by Hoyt Bleakely, Ann E. Ferris, and Jeffrey C. Fuhrer (1999), adjusted to represent the NFCP. | [('…for', 'JJ'), ('gross', 'JJ'), ('hiring', 'NN'), ('flows', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('separation', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('series', 'NN'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('CPS', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('data', 'NN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('computed', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('Hoyt', 'NNP'), ('Bleakely', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('Ann', 'NNP'), ('E.', 'NNP'), ('Ferris', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('Jeffrey', 'NNP'), ('C.', 'NNP'), ('Fuhrer', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('1999', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('adjusted', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('represent', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('NFCP', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …two aspects of the data merit attention. (a) Researchers use gross flows between employment and unemployment, and between employment and out o the labor force; the latter flows (out of the labor force to employment) are sizeable, and in terms of the model are not different from unemployment-to-employment flows. (b) The gross worker flows are adjusted to cater for misclassification and measurement error. | [('…two', 'JJ'), ('aspects', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('merit', 'NN'), ('attention', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('(', '('), ('a', 'DT'), (')', ')'), ('Researchers', 'NNP'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('gross', 'JJ'), ('flows', 'NNS'), ('between', 'IN'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('unemployment', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('between', 'IN'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('out', 'IN'), ('o', 'RB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('labor', 'NN'), ('force', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('the', 'DT'), ('latter', 'NN'), ('flows', 'VBZ'), ('(', '('), ('out', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('labor', 'NN'), ('force', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('employment', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('sizeable', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('in', 'IN'), ('terms', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('model', 'NN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('different', 'JJ'), ('from', 'IN'), ('unemployment-to-employment', 'JJ'), ('flows', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('(', '('), ('b', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('The', 'DT'), ('gross', 'JJ'), ('worker', 'NN'), ('flows', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('adjusted', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('cater', 'VB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('misclassification', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('measurement', 'NN'), ('error', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | National Income and Product Accounts | …for the labor share of income, researchers take the compensation of employees, i.e., the sum of wage and salary accruals and supplements to wages and salaries as a fration of the gross product of the nonfinancial corporate sector, from the National Income and Product Accounts. | [('…for', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('labor', 'NN'), ('share', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('income', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('take', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('compensation', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('employees', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('i.e.', 'FW'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('sum', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('salary', 'JJ'), ('accruals', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('salaries', 'NNS'), ('as', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('fration', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('gross', 'JJ'), ('product', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('nonfinancial', 'JJ'), ('corporate', 'JJ'), ('sector', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('National', 'NNP'), ('Income', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Product', 'NNP'), ('Accounts', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Federal Reserve's Flow of Fund Accounts | …the data on market values are taken from Robert E. Hall (2001) based on the Federal Reserve's Flow of Funds accounts. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('market', 'NN'), ('values', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('taken', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('Robert', 'NNP'), ('E.', 'NNP'), ('Hall', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('2001', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Federal', 'NNP'), ('Reserve', 'NNP'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('Flow', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Funds', 'NNP'), ('accounts', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Federal Reserve's Flow of Fund Accounts | …this series in a detrended version is highly correlated with stock market measures, such as the total market value reported by the Center for Research in Security Prices (CRSP) at the University of Chicago, and the S&P 500 index. | [('…this', 'JJ'), ('series', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('detrended', 'JJ'), ('version', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('highly', 'RB'), ('correlated', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('stock', 'NN'), ('market', 'NN'), ('measures', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('such', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('market', 'NN'), ('value', 'NN'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Center', 'NNP'), ('for', 'IN'), ('Research', 'NNP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('Security', 'NNP'), ('Prices', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('CRSP', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('University', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Chicago', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('S', 'NNP'), ('&', 'CC'), ('P', 'NNP'), ('500', 'CD'), ('index', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Center for Research in Security Prices | …this data source collects data on total market value, used to gauge the accuracy of the estimated market values computed in this research, and returns, used to compute the discount rate. | [('…this', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('source', 'NN'), ('collects', 'NNS'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('market', 'NN'), ('value', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('used', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('gauge', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('accuracy', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('estimated', 'JJ'), ('market', 'NN'), ('values', 'NNS'), ('computed', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('research', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('returns', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('used', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('compute', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('discount', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | S&P 500 | …this data source collects data on total market value, used to gauge the accuracy of the estimated market values computed in this research, and an alternative measure of the discount rate used in alternate model specifications. | [('…this', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('source', 'NN'), ('collects', 'NNS'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('total', 'JJ'), ('market', 'NN'), ('value', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('used', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('gauge', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('accuracy', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('estimated', 'JJ'), ('market', 'NN'), ('values', 'NNS'), ('computed', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('research', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('an', 'DT'), ('alternative', 'JJ'), ('measure', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('discount', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('alternate', 'JJ'), ('model', 'NN'), ('specifications', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …data from the May dual job holding supplement of the Current Population Survey from 1973 to 1978, and from the outgoing rotation group files of the Current Population Survey from 1979 to 1992 used in order to calculate hours-weighted kernel estimates of the density of hourly wages for men and for women over the period 1973 to 1992. | [('…data', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('May', 'NNP'), ('dual', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('holding', 'VBG'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1978', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('outgoing', 'VBG'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1992', 'CD'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('calculate', 'VB'), ('hours-weighted', 'JJ'), ('kernel', 'NN'), ('estimates', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('density', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('hourly', 'JJ'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('men', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('for', 'IN'), ('women', 'NNS'), ('over', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('period', 'NN'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1992', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in contrast with most previous work which has used earnings data from the March Current Population Survey, researchers use hourly wage data from the May Current Population Survey and from the outgoing rotation group supplements of the Current Population Survey. | [('…in', 'JJ'), ('contrast', 'NN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('work', 'NN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('hourly', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('May', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('outgoing', 'VBG'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …data used in order to analyze changes in the distribution of wages in the United States from 1973 to 1992. | [('…data', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('analyze', 'VB'), ('changes', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('distribution', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('United', 'NNP'), ('States', 'NNPS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1992', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …starting in May 1973, the Current Population Survey has regularly collected hourly or weekly earnings for each respondent's main job; from 1973 to 1978, these wage questions were asked only in May, as part of the dual job holding supplement, however, beginning in 1979, the wage questions were asked each month to people in the outgoing rotation grous (which represent one-quarter of all individuals in the survey). | [('…starting', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('May', 'NNP'), ('1973', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('regularly', 'RB'), ('collected', 'VBN'), ('hourly', 'RB'), ('or', 'CC'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('respondent', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('main', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1978', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('these', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('asked', 'VBN'), ('only', 'RB'), ('in', 'IN'), ('May', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('as', 'IN'), ('part', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('dual', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('holding', 'VBG'), ('supplement', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('however', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('beginning', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1979', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('asked', 'VBN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('month', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('people', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('outgoing', 'JJ'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('grous', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('which', 'WDT'), ('represent', 'VBP'), ('one-quarter', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the sample sizes are approximately 40,000 workers per year from 1973 to 1978, and 150,000 workers per year from 1979 to 1992. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('sizes', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('approximately', 'RB'), ('40,000', 'CD'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('per', 'IN'), ('year', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1978', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('150,000', 'CD'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('per', 'IN'), ('year', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1992', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …one advantage of using these samples is that the wage measure collected is a good mesaure of a point-of-time price of labor. | [('…one', 'JJ'), ('advantage', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('these', 'DT'), ('samples', 'NNS'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('measure', 'NN'), ('collected', 'VBN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('good', 'JJ'), ('mesaure', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('point-of-time', 'JJ'), ('price', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('labor', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …a key advantage of the 1973-1973 dual job supplements and of the 1983-1992 outgoing rotation group supplements is that they contain information on the union status of workers. | [('…a', 'NN'), ('key', 'JJ'), ('advantage', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1973-1973', 'JJ'), ('dual', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1983-1992', 'JJ'), ('outgoing', 'JJ'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('contain', 'VBP'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('union', 'NN'), ('status', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …information on the union status of workers was not collected in the outgoing rotation group supplement from 1979 to 1982, however it is is possible to obtain the union status in 1979 for a subset of workers by matching answers about unionization from the 1979 Pension Supplement of the May 1979 Current Population Survey to the corresponding wage data collected in the outgoing rotation group supplements of May, June, July, or August, 1979; this matched 1979 of about 35,000 observations is used whenever the estimation requires using union status for 1979. It is also possible to obtain the union status of workers for the subsample of workers who were in an outgoing rotation group in May 1980, or 1981 since they were asked about their union status in the job holding supplement. | [('…information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('union', 'NN'), ('status', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('collected', ('holding', 'VBG'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …one issue is that usual weekly earnings are topcoded at $999 from 1973 to 1985, and at $1923 thereafter, and that relatively low value of the top code in real terms is likely to understate wage dispersion in the upper tail of the distribution; to avoid this type of bias, researchers use the upper tail of the 1986 distribution of wages to impute a wage distribution to the observations censored at the top code in other years. This procedure is used only for years in which more than 0.5% of the workforce is topcoded (1981 to 1985 and 1990 to 1992). | [('…one', 'JJ'), ('issue', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('usual', 'JJ'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('topcoded', 'VBN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('$', '$'), ('999', 'CD'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1985', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('at', 'IN'), ('$', '$'), ('1923', 'CD'), ('thereafter', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('that', 'IN'), ('relatively', 'RB'), ('low', 'JJ'), ('value', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('top', 'JJ'), ('code', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('real', 'JJ'), ('terms', 'NNS'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('likely', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('understate', 'VB'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('dispersion', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('upper', 'JJ'), ('tail', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('distribution', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('to', 'TO'), ('avoid', 'VB'), ('this', 'DT'), ('type', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('bias', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('upper', 'JJ'), ('tail', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1986', 'CD'), ('distribution', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('impute', 'VB'), ('a', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('distribution', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('censored', 'VBN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('top', 'JJ'), ('code', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('procedure', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('only', 'RB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('0.5', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('workforce', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('topcoded', 'VBN'), ('(', '('), ('1981', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1985', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1990', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1992', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …all observations with allocated wages were eliminated from the 1979 to 1988 outgoing rotation group files to keep these samples comparable to the 1979 to 1978 samples. | [('…all', 'JJ'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('allocated', 'JJ'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('eliminated', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1988', 'CD'), ('outgoing', 'VBG'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('files', 'VBZ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('keep', 'VB'), ('these', 'DT'), ('samples', 'NNS'), ('comparable', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1978', 'CD'), ('samples', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …only individuals of age 16 to 65 and reporting an hourly wage from $1 to $100 (in 1979 dollars) were kept in the sample.  | [('…only', 'JJ'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('age', 'NN'), ('16', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('65', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('reporting', 'VBG'), ('an', 'DT'), ('hourly', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('$', '$'), ('1', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('$', '$'), ('100', 'CD'), ('(', '('), ('in', 'IN'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('dollars', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('kept', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …all the estimates reported in this paper are weighted by the product of the Current Population survey sample weights with usual hours of work; these hours-weighted estimates put more weight on the wages of workers who supply many hours to the labor market, which gives a better representation of the dispersion of wages for each and every hour worked in the labor market, regardless of who is supplying this hour. | [('…all', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('estimates', 'NNS'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('paper', 'NN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('weighted', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('product', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('sample', 'VBD'), ('weights', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('usual', 'JJ'), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('work', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('these', 'DT'), ('hours-weighted', 'JJ'), ('estimates', 'NNS'), ('put', 'VBD'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('weight', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('who', 'WP'), ('supply', 'VBP'), ('many', 'JJ'), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('labor', 'NN'), ('market', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('gives', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('better', 'JJR'), ('representation', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('dispersion', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('and', 'CC'), ('every', 'DT'), ('hour', 'NN'), ('worked', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('labor', 'NN'), ('market', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('regardless', 'RB'), ('of', 'IN'), ('who', 'WP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('supplying', 'VBG'), ('this', 'DT'), ('hour', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …a significant fraction of interviewees in the Current Population Survey fail to answer questions about wages; while the Census Bureau used a hot deck procedure to replace missing wages by an allocated value in the 1979-1992 outgoing rotation group files, it simply coded the wage as missing in the 1973 to 1978 dual job holding supplements. | [('…a', 'NN'), ('significant', 'JJ'), ('fraction', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('interviewees', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('fail', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('answer', 'VB'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('about', 'IN'), ('wages', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('while', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('used', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('hot', 'JJ'), ('deck', 'NN'), ('procedure', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('replace', 'VB'), ('missing', 'VBG'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('allocated', 'JJ'), ('value', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1979-1992', 'JJ'), ('outgoing', 'JJ'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('files', 'VBZ'), (',', ','), ('it', 'PRP'), ('simply', 'RB'), ('coded', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('missing', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1978', 'CD'), ('dual', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('holding', 'VBG'), ('supplements', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …note that, because of a coding error in this data source, it is impossible to identify most workers with allocated wages from 1989 to 1992; however, this error is of little consequence for most of the analysis as researchers focus on the 1979 to 1988 period. | [('…note', 'NN'), ('that', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('because', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('coding', 'VBG'), ('error', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('source', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('it', 'PRP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('impossible', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('identify', 'VB'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('allocated', 'JJ'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1989', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1992', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('however', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('this', 'DT'), ('error', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('of', 'IN'), ('little', 'JJ'), ('consequence', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('analysis', 'NN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('focus', 'VBP'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1988', 'CD'), ('period', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …one important feature of the May/outgoing rotation group Current Population Survey data is that the within-group standard deviation of log wages decreased between 1973 and 1979; this is at odds with analyses based on March Current Population Survey data which concluded that wage dispersion within skill groups increased during the 1970's. | [('…one', 'NN'), ('important', 'JJ'), ('feature', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('May/outgoing', 'NNP'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('within-group', 'JJ'), ('standard', 'JJ'), ('deviation', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('log', 'NN'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('decreased', 'VBN'), ('between', 'IN'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1979', 'CD'), (';', ':'), ('this', 'DT'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('at', 'IN'), ('odds', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('analyses', 'NNS'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('data', 'VBD'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('concluded', 'VBD'), ('that', 'IN'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('dispersion', 'NN'), ('within', 'IN'), ('skill', 'JJ'), ('groups', 'NNS'), ('increased', 'VBD'), ('during', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1970', 'CD'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …from 1948 to 1976, the data are taken from historical Current Population Survey reports published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics. For 1980 onwards, researchers tabulate the fraction of migrations from Current Population Survey microdata. The years 1972-75, 1977-79, 1990 and 1995 are missing because in those years the Current Population Survey did not ask respondents where they were living in the previous year. | [('…from', 'NN'), ('1948', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1976', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('taken', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('historical', 'JJ'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('reports', 'NNS'), ('published', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Labor', 'NNP'), ('Statistics', 'NNPS'), ('.', '.'), ('For', 'IN'), ('1980', 'CD'), ('onwards', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('tabulate', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('fraction', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('migrations', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('microdata', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('1972-75', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('1977-79', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('1990', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1995', 'CD'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('missing', 'VBG'), ('because', 'IN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('ask', 'VB'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('where', 'WRB'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('living', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …because the Current Population Survey microdata are a subsample fo the entire survey, the count of the nubmer of migrants does not match the published totals exactly. However, for the years that can be compared, the difference between the published totals and the calculated tabulations are relatively minor. Dataset | Internal Revenue Service | …this data represent a narrower population than the Current Population Survey in that it only reflects inividuals in households who filed tax returns in two consecutive years. Dataset | Internal Revenue Service | …similar to the Current Population Survey, the Internal Revenue Service reports the number of migrants from the first quarter of one year to the first quarter of the following year. Therefore, researchers maintain the same timing of the business cycle that was described earlier: the employment gap and unemployment rates are averages from April in the previous year to March in the current year, and the UI claims rate is the rate in the previous calendar year. | [('…similar', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('Internal', 'NNP'), ('Revenue', 'NNP'), ('Service', 'NNP'), ('reports', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('migrants', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('first', 'JJ'), ('quarter', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('one', 'CD'), ('year', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('first', 'JJ'), ('quarter', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('following', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Therefore', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('maintain', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('same', 'JJ'), ('timing', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('business', 'NN'), ('cycle', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('described', 'VBN'), ('earlier', 'RBR'), (':', ':'), ('the', 'DT'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('gap', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('unemployment', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('averages', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('April', 'NNP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('UI', 'NNP'), ('claims', 'NNS'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('calendar', 'NN'), ('year', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Internal Revenue Service | …this data reports both the number of migrants moving from state J to state K as well as the number of migrants moving from state K to state J, so these data reflect gross migration patterns across states. | [('…this', 'JJ'), ('data', 'NN'), ('reports', 'NNS'), ('both', 'DT'), ('the', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('migrants', 'NNS'), ('moving', 'VBG'), ('from', 'IN'), ('state', 'NN'), ('J', 'NNP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('state', 'NN'), ('K', 'NNP'), ('as', 'RB'), ('well', 'RB'), ('as', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('migrants', 'NNS'), ('moving', 'VBG'), ('from', 'IN'), ('state', 'NN'), ('K', 'NNP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('state', 'NN'), ('J', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('so', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('reflect', 'VBP'), ('gross', 'JJ'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('patterns', 'NNS'), ('across', 'IN'), ('states', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Internal Revenue Service | …researchers use data from the Internal Revenue Service's county-to-county migration files to calculate total migration into and out of each metropolitan area in the United States. Because these files only report migration between pairs of counties with at least a moderate population flow between the two locations, researchers cannot calculate migration between pairs of metropolitan areas to estimate a regression analogous to the state-pair regressions. However, the files do report total migration into and out of each countru, so researchers are able to aggregate the data into total inflows and total outflows for each metropolitan area. | Dataset | Current Population Survey | …this data source provides the largest nationally representative sample that covers a considerable number of business cycles.
