Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the relevant Current Population Survey microdata come from the March surveys from 1964 to 2003, again excluding the years in which CPS respondents were not asked whether they resided in their current country one year ago. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('relevant', 'JJ'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('microdata', 'VBD'), ('come', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('surveys', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('1964', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2003', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('again', 'RB'), ('excluding', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('asked', 'VBN'), ('whether', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('resided', 'VBD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('current', 'JJ'), ('country', 'NN'), ('one', 'CD'), ('year', 'NN'), ('ago', 'RB'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the sample is restricted to household heads, ages 18 to 65, since household heads are most likely to make migration decisions for a family. Reserachers control for family structure characteristics that may influence migration costs, like the presence of children. Minors are excluded since they are unlikely to make migration decisions independently, as well those over the age of 65 since migration during retirement years is likely to be qualitatively different from migration during the prime years of employment. Because the sample is restricted to household heads, women are significantly underrepresented in the data. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('restricted', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('household', 'VB'), ('heads', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('ages', 'VBZ'), ('18', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('65', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('since', 'IN'), ('household', 'NN'), ('heads', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('most', 'RBS'), ('likely', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('make', 'VB'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('decisions', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('family', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Reserachers', 'NNS'), ('control', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('family', 'NN'), ('structure', 'NN'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('may', 'MD'), ('influence', 'VB'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('costs', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('like', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('presence', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('children', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Minors', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('excluded', 'VBN'), ('since', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('unlikely', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('make', 'VB'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('decisions', 'NNS'), ('independently', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('as', 'IN'), ('well', 'RB'), ('those', 'DT'), ('over', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('age', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('65', 'CD'), ('since', 'IN'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('during', 'IN'), ('retirement', 'NN'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('likely', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('be', 'VB'), ('qualitatively', 'RB'), ('different', 'JJ'), ('from', 'IN'), ('migration', 'NN'), ('during', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('prime', 'JJ'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Because', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('restricted', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('household', 'VB'), ('heads', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('women', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('significantly', 'RB'), ('underrepresented', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …this data source does not identify a migrant's state of origin, nor does it provide information on an individual's personal characteristics in the previous year. Therefore, reserachers cannot control for local economic conditions in the origin state or for any more sophisticated measures of the ex ante array of state conditions facing a potential migrant. | [('…this', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('source', 'NN'), ('does', 'VBZ'), ('not', 'RB'), ('identify', 'VB'), ('a', 'DT'), ('migrant', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('state', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('origin', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('nor', 'CC'), ('does', 'VBZ'), ('it', 'PRP'), ('provide', 'VB'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('individual', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('personal', 'JJ'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Therefore', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('reserachers', 'NNS'), ('can', 'MD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('control', 'VB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('local', 'JJ'), ('economic', 'JJ'), ('conditions', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('origin', 'NN'), ('state', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('for', 'IN'), ('any', 'DT'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('sophisticated', 'JJ'), ('measures', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('ex', 'NN'), ('ante', 'JJ'), ('array', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('state', 'NN'), ('conditions', 'NNS'), ('facing', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('potential', 'JJ'), ('migrant', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …this data source has the advantage of producing a fairly consistent yearly time-series from 1964 onward; however, it does not sample members of the armed forces and contains no information on the incarcerated population, the former of which causes the researcher to overstate the racial wage gap because it ignores the significant role of employment in the armed forces in compressing the racial wage gap and the latter of which ignores the role of increasing criminal activity as a response to a changing wage structure. | [('…this', 'NN'), ('data', Dataset | Bureau of Labor Statistics | …the classification system that the Bureau of Labor Statistics uses to code occupations has changed near the start of each decade; fortunately, Meyer and Osborne (2005) create a classification system that generates consistent occupational categories over time. Yet, while the Meyer-Osborne system has the advantage of consistency, it also has hundreds of entries. Researchesr borrow from Autor and Don (2009) and Autor (2010) that aggregated the Meyer-Osborne occupations into the 10 coarser occupations. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('classification', 'NN'), ('system', 'NN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Labor', 'NNP'), ('Statistics', 'NNPS'), ('uses', 'VBZ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('code', 'VB'), ('occupations', 'NNS'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('changed', 'VBN'), ('near', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('start', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('decade', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('fortunately', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('Meyer', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Osborne', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('2005', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('create', 'VB'), ('a', 'DT'), ('classification', 'NN'), ('system', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('generates', 'VBZ'), ('consistent', 'JJ'), ('occupational', 'JJ'), ('categories', 'NNS'), ('over', 'IN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Yet', 'CC'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Meyer-Osborne', 'JJ'), ('system', 'NN'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('advantage', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('consistency', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('it', 'PRP'), ('also', 'RB'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('hundreds', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('entries', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchesr', 'NNP'), ('borrow', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('Autor', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Don', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('2009', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Autor', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('2010', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('aggregated', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Meyer-Osborne', 'JJ'), ('occupations', 'NNS'), ('into', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('10', 'CD'), ('coarser', 'NN'), ('occupations', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in this paper, researchers match workers only across consecutive months in the Current Population Survey, and nonparticipating Current Population Survey respondents are not asked questions about their most recent occupations. Consequently, researchers are unable to determine whether "middle-skill nonparticipators" are more likely to emerge from nonparticipation with higher-skill jobs, as would be expected if these workers chose to use their time out of the labor market to agument their skills. They did, however, investigate outflows from nonparticipation over the sample period disaggregated by gender. | [('…in', 'NN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('paper', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('match', 'VBP'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('only', 'RB'), ('across', 'IN'), ('consecutive', 'JJ'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('nonparticipating', 'VBG'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('asked', 'VBN'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('about', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('most', 'JJS'), ('recent', 'JJ'), ('occupations', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Consequently', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('unable', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('determine', 'VB'), ('whether', 'IN'), ('``', '``'), ('middle-skill', 'JJ'), ('nonparticipators', 'NNS'), ("''", "''"), ('are', 'VBP'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('likely', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('emerge', 'VB'), ('from', 'IN'), ('nonparticipation', 'NN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('higher-skill', 'JJ'), ('jobs', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('as', 'IN'), ('would', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('expected', 'VBN'), ('if', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('chose', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('use', 'VB'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('time', 'NN'), ('out', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('labor', 'NN'), ('market', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('agument', 'VB'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('skills', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('They', 'PRP'), ('did', 'VBD'), (',', ','), ('however', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('investigate', 'JJ'), ('outflows', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('nonparticipation', 'NN'), ('over', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), ('disaggregated', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('gender', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | National Longitudinal Study of the High School Class of 1972 | …a longitudinal survey that originally sampled 22,652 seniors from the high-school class of 1972 containing extensive family-background ability measures as well as a supplement, the Post-secondary Education Transcript Survey, which contains transcript information on all post-secondary schools reported by the students through 1979 and includes course credits by field, grades, and any degrees obtained. | [('…a', 'JJ'), ('longitudinal', 'JJ'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('originally', 'RB'), ('sampled', 'VBD'), ('22,652', 'CD'), ('seniors', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('high-school', 'JJ'), ('class', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1972', 'CD'), ('containing', 'VBG'), ('extensive', 'JJ'), ('family-background', 'JJ'), ('ability', 'NN'), ('measures', 'NNS'), ('as', 'RB'), ('well', 'RB'), ('as', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('supplement', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('Post-secondary', 'JJ'), ('Education', 'NNP'), ('Transcript', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('contains', 'VBZ'), ('transcript', 'JJ'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('post-secondary', 'JJ'), ('schools', 'NNS'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('students', 'NNS'), ('through', 'IN'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('includes', 'VBZ'), ('course', 'NN'), ('credits', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('field', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('grades', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('any', 'DT'), ('degrees', 'NNS'), ('obtained', 'VBN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | National Longitudinal Study of the High School Class of 1972 | …in 1984, transcripts were requested from all of the schools that survey participants had reported attending in the first four follow-ups which compiled into the Post-secondary Education Transcript Survey containing roughly 19,000 transcripts on about 14,000 sample members; these transcripts contain information on all postsecondary schools reported by students through 1979 and include course credits by field, grades, and any degrees obtained. | [('…in', 'NN'), ('1984', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('transcripts', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('requested', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('schools', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('participants', 'NNS'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('attending', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('first', 'JJ'), ('four', 'CD'), ('follow-ups', 'NN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('compiled', 'VBD'), ('into', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Post-secondary', 'JJ'), ('Education', 'NNP'), ('Transcript', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('containing', 'VBG'), ('roughly', 'RB'), ('19,000', 'CD'), ('transcripts', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('about', 'IN'), ('14,000', 'CD'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('members', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('these', 'DT'), ('transcripts', 'NNS'), ('contain', 'VBP'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('postsecondary', 'JJ'), ('schools', 'NNS'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('students', 'NNS'), ('through', 'IN'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('include', 'VBP'), ('course', 'NN'), ('credits', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('field', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('grades', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('any', 'DT'), ('degrees', 'NNS'), ('obtained', 'VBN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | National Longitudinal Study of the High School Class of 1972 | …the Post-secondary Education Transcript Survey supplement of the National Longitudinal Study of the High School Class of 1972 enjoyed a 94% response rate from four-year schools and a 91% response rate from two-year schools; however, because the response rate for proprietary vocational school was only 43%, researchers are more cautious in interpreting those results. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('Post-secondary', 'JJ'), ('Education', 'NNP'), ('Transcript', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('National', 'NNP'), ('Longitudinal', 'NNP'), ('Study', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('High', 'NNP'), ('School', 'NNP'), ('Class', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1972', 'CD'), ('enjoyed', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('94', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('response', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('four-year', 'JJ'), ('schools', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('a', 'DT'), ('91', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('response', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('two-year', 'JJ'), ('schools', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('however', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('because', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('response', 'NN'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('proprietary', 'JJ'), ('vocational', 'JJ'), ('school', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('only', 'RB'), ('43', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('cautious', 'JJ'), ('in', 'IN'), ('interpreting', 'VBG'), ('those', 'DT'), ('results', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | National Longitudinal Study of the High School Class of 1972 | …researchers excluded an additional 1,046 individuals for whom any transcript data was missing because their schools did not return the information or because the schools could not be found, and 316 others who reported periods of enrollment for which the schools had no record, however this last group was summarized in a dummy variable to test whether these liars had average wages different from those other high school graduates. | [('…researchers', 'NNS'), ('excluded', 'VBD'), ('an', 'DT'), ('additional', 'JJ'), ('1,046', 'CD'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('whom', 'WP'), ('any', 'DT'), ('transcript', 'NN'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('missing', 'VBG'), ('because', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('schools', 'NNS'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('return', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('information', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('because', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('schools', 'NNS'), ('could', 'MD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('be', 'VB'), ('found', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('316', 'CD'), ('others', 'NNS'), ('who', 'WP'), ('reported', 'VBD'), ('periods', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('enrollment', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('the', 'DT'), ('schools', 'NNS'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('no', 'DT'), ('record', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('however', 'RB'), ('this', 'DT'), ('last', 'JJ'), ('group', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('summarized', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('dummy', 'NN'), ('variable', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('test', 'VB'), ('whether', 'IN'), ('these', 'DT'), ('liars', 'NNS'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('average', 'JJ'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('different', 'JJ'), ('from', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('high', 'JJ'), ('school', 'NN'), ('graduates', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | National Longitudinal Study of the High School Class of 1972 | …a credit at a school on the quarter system was considered at two-thirds the weight of a semester credit using a rule of thumb suggested by the Association of Independent Colleges and Universities, where students were given 2 credits for courses for which no number of credit hours was recorded but for which they had passing grades, and 2 credits for courses with neither credits nor grades recorded. | [('…a', 'JJ'), ('credit', 'NN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('school', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('quarter', 'NN'), ('system', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('considered', 'VBN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('two-thirds', 'NNS'), ('the', 'DT'), ('weight', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('semester', 'NN'), ('credit', 'NN'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('rule', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('thumb', 'NN'), ('suggested', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Association', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Independent', 'NNP'), ('Colleges', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Universities', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('where', 'WRB'), ('students', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('given', 'VBN'), ('2', 'CD'), ('credits', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('courses', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('no', 'DT'), ('number', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('credit', 'NN'), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('recorded', 'VBN'), ('but', 'CC'), ('for', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('passing', 'VBG'), ('grades', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('2', 'CD'), ('credits', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('courses', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('neither', 'DT'), ('credits', 'NNS'), ('nor', 'CC'), ('grades', 'NNS'), ('recorded', 'VBN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in the empirical work, researchers use data from the Displaced Workers Supplement in the January 1984 and 1986 Current Population Surveys. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …researchers focus on males dispalced from full-time jobs in an attempt to identify a sample of workers with strong attachments to the labor market. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …workers in the January 1984 DWS permanently lost a job between January 1979 and January 1984. Workers in the January 1986 DWS permanently lost a job between January 1981 and January 1986. Individuals enter the DWS if they lost a job in the 5 years prior to the survey because of a plant closing, an employer going out of business, or a layoff from which he or she was not recalled. Interviewers for the DWS were instructed that, if an individual was fired from a job for cause, then the individual should not be included in the DWS. If a worker lost more than one job in the 5 years prior to the survey, the survey questions refer to the lost job he or she held the longest. See U.S. Deparment of Commerce (1986) for further details on the desing and implementation of the DWS surveys. | [('…workers', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('January', 'NNP'), ('1984', 'CD'), Dataset | Current Population Survey | …researchers examine a pooled sample of male workers between the ages of 20 and 61 who were permanently displaced from a private-sector, full-time, nonagricultural job because of a plant closing, slack work, or a position or shift that was eliminated; researchers classify as layoffs those displaced because of slack work or a position or shift that was eliminated. Workers displaced from construction jobs were eliminated from the sample since it is difficult to formulate an appropriate definition of permanent displacement from a construction job. | [('…researchers', 'NNS'), ('examine', 'VBP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('pooled', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('male', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('between', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('ages', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('20', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('61', 'CD'), ('who', 'WP'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('permanently', 'RB'), ('displaced', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('private-sector', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('full-time', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('nonagricultural', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('because', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('plant', 'NN'), ('closing', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('slack', 'NN'), ('work', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('or', 'CC'), ('a', 'DT'), ('position', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('shift', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('eliminated', 'VBN'), (';', ':'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('classify', 'VBP'), ('as', 'IN'), ('layoffs', 'NNS'), ('those', 'DT'), ('displaced', 'VBN'), ('because', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('slack', 'NN'), ('work', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('a', 'DT'), ('position', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('shift', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('eliminated', 'VBN'), ('.', '.'), ('Workers', 'NNS'), ('displaced', 'VBD'), ('from', 'IN'), ('construction', 'NN'), ('jobs', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('eliminated', 'VBN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('since', 'IN'), ('it', 'PRP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('difficult', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('formulate', 'VB'), ('an', 'DT'), ('appropriate', 'JJ'), ('definition', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('permanent', 'JJ'), ('displacement', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('construction', 'NN'), ('job', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …for most of the analysis, the sample is restricted to those individuals who were reemployed in wage and salary employment at the survey date and who had reemployment earnings of at least $40 a week. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …unfortunately, the Displaced Workers Supplements do not provide information on whether a worker's predisplacement job was covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. | [('…unfortunately', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('Displaced', 'NNP'), ('Workers', 'NNPS'), ('Supplements', 'NNS'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('provide', 'VB'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('whether', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('worker', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('predisplacement', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('covered', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('collective-bargaining', 'JJ'), ('agreement', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …researchers used all 12 outgoing rotation groups from the 1983 Current Population Survey to tabulate unionization rates by occupation for a sample of workers comparable to the relevant DWS sample. Included in the sample are 20- to 61-year-old, male, full-time, private-sector employees not working in agriculture or construction. Workers were classified as unionized if they were union members and/or working in employment covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Researchers find that 10.4% of white-collar workers were unionized, compared to 38.5% of blue-collar workers. | [('…researchers', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBD'), ('all', 'DT'), ('12', 'CD'), ('outgoing', 'VBG'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('groups', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1983', 'CD'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('tabulate', 'VB'), ('unionization', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('occupation', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('comparable', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('relevant', 'JJ'), ('DWS', 'NNP'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Included', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('20-', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('61-year-old', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('male', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('full-time', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('private-sector', 'JJ'), ('employees', 'NNS'), ('not', 'RB'), ('working', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('agriculture', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('construction', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Workers', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('classified', 'VBN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('unionized', 'JJ'), ('if', 'IN'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('union', 'NN'), ('members', 'NNS'), ('and/or', 'VBP'), ('working', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('covered', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('collective-bargaining', 'JJ'), ('agreement', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchers', 'NNS'), ('find', 'VBP'), ('that', 'IN'), ('10.4', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('white-collar', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('unionized', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('compared', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('38.5', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('blue-collar', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the DWS does not provide information on whether a worker's predisplacement job was unionized. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('DWS', 'NNP'), ('does', 'VBZ'), ('not', 'RB'), ('provide', 'VB'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('whether', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('worker', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('predisplacement', 'JJ'), ('job', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('unionized', 'VBN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …researchers used all 12 outgoing rotation groups from the 1983 Current Population Survye (the full-year sample) to generate a sample of workers comparable to the relevant DWS sample and then to compute unionization rates for white- and blue-collar workers in each three digit industry. Researchers then classified workers into high- and low-union subsample depending on whether their predisplacement industry-occupation cell had a unionization rate above or below the sample median rate of 25.5% | [('…researchers', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBD'), ('all', 'DT'), ('12', 'CD'), ('outgoing', 'VBG'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('groups', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1983', 'CD'), ('Current', 'NNP'), ('Population', 'NNP'), ('Survye', 'NNP'), ('(', '('), ('the', 'DT'), ('full-year', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('to', 'TO'), ('generate', 'VB'), ('a', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('comparable', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('relevant', 'JJ'), ('DWS', 'NNP'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('then', 'RB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('compute', 'VB'), ('unionization', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('white-', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('blue-collar', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('three', 'CD'), ('digit', 'NNS'), ('industry', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Researchers', 'NNS'), ('then', 'RB'), ('classified', 'VBD'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('into', 'IN'), ('high-', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('low-union', 'JJ'), ('subsample', 'NN'), ('depending', 'VBG'), ('on', 'IN'), ('whether', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('predisplacement', 'JJ'), ('industry-occupation', 'NN'), ('cell', 'NN'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('unionization', 'JJ'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('above', 'IN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('below', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('median', 'JJ'), ('rate', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('25.5', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in the current sample (including those not reemployed at the survey date), the layoffs reported in the 1984 DWS are 314, 504, and 484 for 1981 to 1983, respectively, while those reported in the 1986 DWS are 142, 258, and 188 for the same years. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in an attempt to assess the extent to which a lemons effect contributes to the current finding that workers permanently displaced by layoffs experience longer unemployment spells than do those displaced by plant closings, researchers used the January 1986 DWS to construct a sample of first spells of joblessness for 20-61 year-old males permanently displaced from full-time private-sector jobs not in agriculture or construction. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the january 1984 DWS only provides information on total weeks of joblessness since displacement and so does not allow one to determine the length of the initial spell of joblessness. The January 1986 DWS, in contrast, provides information on the number of jobs held by a worker since displacement. This variable and information on total weeks of joblessness since displacement allow one to determine both the length of the initial spell of joblessness for those employed in their first job since Dataset | ACNielsen's Homescan | …within the Homescan data set, there are 2,100 separate households and over 950,000 transactions; for the relevant analysis, researchers focus on households in which the average age of the primary shopper is between the ages of 24 and 75, and, unless otherwise noted, the age of the household head is restricted to be at least 25. Dataset | American Time Use Survey | …unforunately, the Bureau of Labor Statistics did not have each spouse within the same household fill out a time diary; researchers construct synthetic married-couple households by summing over married men and women, based on the husband's age. Given that each age group contains a fairly large cross-section and that the Bureau of Labor Statistics randomly selects which spouse is recorded within a household, resaerchers feel that the bias from this approach is minimized. | [('…unforunately', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Labor', 'NNP'), ('Statistics', 'NNPS'), ('did', 'VBD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('have', 'VB'), ('each', 'DT'), ('spouse', 'NN'), ('within', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('same', 'JJ'), ('household', 'NN'), ('fill', 'NN'), ('out', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('time', 'NN'), ('diary', 'JJ'), (';', ':'), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('construct', 'VBP'), ('synthetic', 'JJ'), ('married-couple', 'JJ'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('by', 'IN'), ('summing', 'VBG'), ('over', 'RP'), ('married', 'JJ'), ('men', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('women', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('husband', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('age', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Given', 'VBN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('age', 'NN'), ('group', 'NN'), ('contains', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('fairly', 'RB'), ('large', 'JJ'), ('cross-section', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Labor', 'NNP'), ('Statistics', 'NNPS'), ('randomly', 'NN'), ('selects', 'NNS'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('spouse', 'VBP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('recorded', 'VBN'), ('within', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('household', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('resaerchers', 'NNS'), ('feel', 'VBP'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('bias', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('approach', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('minimized', 'VBN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | ACNielsen's Homescan | …it may be the case that households fail to scan all grocery items in the Homescan database; on average, a household reported 1% lower expenditure in the first quarter of 1994 than it did during the first quarter of 1993, and 5% lower expenditure in the first quarter of 1995 compared with the same quarter in 1994. The failure to record all transactions is not crucial to many of the facts regarding price dispersion documented in this paper, as long as the transactions a household does record are representative of that household's purchases; however, the failure to record all transactions may influence such items as total expenditures and frequency of shopping. When results are estimated for each of the analyses with only the first quarter of the Homescan survey sample with those obtained using the sample from the last quarter, researchers did not uncover substantial differences. | [('…it', 'NN'), ('may', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('case', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('households', 'VBZ'), ('fail', 'VBP'), ('to', 'TO'), ('scan', 'VB'), ('all', Dataset | Continuous Work History Sample | …since 1978, employers have no longer been required to make quarterly reports; instead they file IRS form W-2 with the Social Security Administration on an annual basis. | [('…since', 'NN'), ('1978', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('employers', 'NNS'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('no', 'DT'), ('longer', 'JJR'), ('been', 'VBN'), ('required', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('make', 'VB'), ('quarterly', 'JJ'), ('reports', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('instead', 'RB'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('file', 'VBP'), ('IRS', 'NNP'), ('form', 'NN'), ('W-2', 'NNP'), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Social', 'NNP'), ('Security', 'NNP'), ('Administration', 'NNP'), ('on', 'IN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('annual', 'JJ'), ('basis', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Continuous Work History Sample | …two shortcomings of this dataset include the facts that many employers do not report the earnings of those engaged in non-FICA taxable employmen and that the W-2 series is the poor quality of the data during the first years of annual reporting. | [('…two', 'JJ'), ('shortcomings', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('dataset', 'NN'), ('include', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('facts', 'NNS'), ('that', 'IN'), ('many', 'JJ'), ('employers', 'NNS'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('report', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('engaged', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('non-FICA', 'JJ'), ('taxable', 'JJ'), ('employmen', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('W-2', 'NNP'), ('series', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('poor', 'JJ'), ('quality', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('during', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('first', 'JJ'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('annual', 'JJ'), ('reporting', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Continuous Work History Sample | …FICA coverage includes most wage and salary and self-employment earnings, but for the sample period used in this research period, the most important coverage exceptions are the majority of federal civilian employees, some state and local government employees, some agricultural and domestic workers, and the employees of some nonprofit organizations; an external figure by Robert Meyer for state, local, and civilian federal government employees imply that by 1981, roughly 58% of all civilian government workers were covered. | [('…FICA', 'JJ'), ('coverage', 'NN'), ('includes', 'VBZ'), ('most', 'RBS'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('salary', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('self-employment', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('but', 'CC'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('research', 'NN'), ('period', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('most', 'RBS'), ('important', 'JJ'), ('coverage', 'NN'), ('exceptions', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('the', 'DT'), ('majority', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('federal', 'JJ'), ('civilian', 'JJ'), ('employees', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('some', 'DT'), ('state', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('local', 'JJ'), ('government', 'NN'), ('employees', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('some', 'DT'), ('agricultural', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('domestic', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('employees', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('some', 'DT'), ('nonprofit', 'JJ'), ('organizations', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('an', 'DT'), ('external', 'JJ'), ('figure', 'NN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('Robert', 'NNP'), ('Meyer', 'NNP'), ('for', 'IN'), ('state', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('local', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('civilian', 'JJ'), ('federal', 'JJ'), ('government', 'NN'), ('employees', 'NNS'), ('imply', 'VBP'), ('that', 'IN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('1981', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('roughly', 'RB'), ('58', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('civilian', 'JJ'), ('government', 'NN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('covered', 'VBN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Continuous Work History Sample | …the combined effects of limited coverage and censoring at the taxable maximum are conveniently summarized by the perentage of all earnings that are reported to the Social Security Administration; these statistics show that after 1981 over 90% of wage and salary earnings and over 75% of self-employment earnings were reported to the Social Security Administration. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('combined', 'JJ'), ('effects', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('limited', 'JJ'), ('coverage', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('censoring', 'NN'), ('at', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('taxable', 'JJ'), ('maximum', 'NN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('conveniently', 'RB'), ('summarized', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('perentage', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Social', 'NNP'), ('Security', 'NNP'), ('Administration', 'NNP'), (';', ':'), ('these', 'DT'), ('statistics', 'NNS'), ('show', 'VBP'), ('that', 'IN'), ('after', 'IN'), ('1981', 'CD'), ('over', 'IN'), ('90', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('salary', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('over', 'RB'), ('75', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('self-employment', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Social', 'NNP'), ('Security', 'NNP'), ('Administration', 'NNP'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Gartner Inc. | …treating a model/quarter as an observation, the sample size is 2,112 after eliminating observations with negligible quarterly market shares, representing 723 distinct model, where the majority of the personal computers offered to home consumers were desk personal computers at 70% and over 83% of the processors were Pentium based and the number of models offered by each firm varied whereas Compaq had the larges selection with 138 different choices, while Texas Instruments offered only five; Dataset | Competitive Media Reporting | …these data are not broken down by sector, but intead these data categorize advertising across product types, which, in some instances, allows the researcher to isolate non-home expenditures; for example, some expenditures are reported with detail, while others are reported generally, and as a result, the ad measure includes some expenditures on non-personal computer systems intended for non-home sectors. | [('…these', 'JJ'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('broken', 'VBN'), ('down', 'RP'), ('by', 'IN'), ('sector', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('but', 'CC'), ('intead', 'VBP'), ('these', 'DT'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('categorize', 'VBP'), ('advertising', 'NN'), ('across', 'IN'), ('product', 'NN'), ('types', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('some', 'DT'), ('instances', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('allows', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('researcher', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('isolate', 'VB'), ('non-home', 'JJ'), ('expenditures', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('for', 'IN'), ('example', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('some', 'DT'), ('expenditures', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('detail', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('while', 'IN'), ('others', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('generally', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('as', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('result', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('ad', 'NN'), ('measure', 'NN'), ('includes', 'VBZ'), ('some', 'DT'), ('expenditures', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('non-personal', 'JJ'), ('computer', 'NN'), ('systems', 'NNS'), ('intended', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('non-home', 'JJ'), ('sectors', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Survey of Media and Markets | …consumer-level data come from the Survey of Media and markets conducted by simmons Market research Bureau which collects data on consumers' media habits, product usage, and demographics from about 20,000 households annually.i | [('…consumer-level', 'JJ'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('come', 'VBP'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('Media', 'NNP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('markets', 'NNS'), ('conducted', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('simmons', 'NNS'), ('Market', 'NNP'), ('research', 'NN'), ('Bureau', 'NNP'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('collects', 'VBZ'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('consumers', 'NNS'), ("'", 'POS'), ('media', 'NNS'), ('habits', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('product', 'NN'), ('usage', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('demographics', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('about', 'IN'), ('20,000', 'CD'), ('households', 'NNS'), ('annually.i', 'RB')]
Dataset | Survey of Media and Markets | …ideally, one would have individual-level purchase, ad exposure, and demographic data, but unfortunately, these data are not available for the personal computer industry; however, the researcher is able to use this Simmons data to link demographics with purchases and to control for household variation in advertising media exposure for the years 1996 and 1997. | [('…ideally', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('one', 'CD'), ('would', 'MD'), ('have', 'VB'), ('individual-level', 'JJ'), ('purchase', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('ad', 'NN'), ('exposure', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('demographic', 'JJ'), ('data', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('but', 'CC'), ('unfortunately', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('these', 'DT'), ('data', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('available', 'JJ'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('personal', 'JJ'), ('computer', 'NN'), ('industry', 'NN'), (';', ':'), ('however', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('researcher', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('able', 'JJ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('use', 'VB'), ('this', 'DT'), ('Simmons', 'NNP'), ('data', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('link', 'VB'), ('demographics', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('purchases', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('to', 'TO'), ('control', 'VB'), ('for', 'IN'), ('household', 'NN'), ('variation', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('advertising', 'NN'), ('media', 'NNS'), ('exposure', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('1996', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1997', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Media and Markets | …to reduce the Simmons sample to a manageable size, the researcher selects 6,700 respondents randomly from each year resulting in a final sample size of 13,400. | [('…to', 'NN'), ('reduce', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Simmons', 'NNP'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('a', 'DT'), ('manageable', 'JJ'), ('size', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('researcher', 'NN'), ('selects', 'VBZ'), ('6,700', 'CD'), ('respondents', 'NNS'), ('randomly', 'RB'), ('from', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('year', 'NN'), ('resulting', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('final', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('size', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('13,400', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Survey of Media and Markets | …there is a potential endogeneity problem in the microdata in that if a consumer with an a priori higher tendency to purchase a particular product chooses which media to consult in the decision process, then media exposure will be correlated with the unobservables; to the extent that exposure is driven by the intention to buy, exposure and purchase decisions will be correlated even if ad exposure has no impact on the purchase decision. | [('…there', 'EX'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('potential', 'JJ'), ('endogeneity', 'NN'), ('problem', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('microdata', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('that', 'DT'), ('if', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('consumer', 'NN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('a', 'DT'), ('priori', 'FW'), ('higher', 'JJR'), ('tendency', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('purchase', 'VB'), ('a', 'DT'), ('particular', 'JJ'), ('product', 'NN'), ('chooses', 'VBZ'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('media', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('consult', 'VB'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('decision', 'NN'), ('process', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('then', 'RB'), ('media', 'NNS'), ('exposure', 'NN'), ('will', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('correlated', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('unobservables', 'NNS'), (';', ':'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('extent', 'NN'), ('that', 'IN'), ('exposure', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('driven', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('intention', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('buy', 'VB'), (',', ','), ('exposure', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('purchase', 'NN'), ('decisions', 'NNS'), ('will', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('correlated', 'VBN'), ('even', 'RB'), ('if', 'IN'), ('ad', 'NN'), ('exposure', 'NN'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('no', 'DT'), ('impact', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('purchase', 'NN'), ('decision', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Equal Employment Opportunity Commission | …of all gender- and race-based complaints filed with the EEOC between 1992 and 1996, 58% claimed wrongful termination, 5.6% were for discriminatory hiring, with the rest based on on-the-job practices such as unequal pay, denial of promotion, or harassment, figures that actually overstate the importance of hiring cases as approximately 10% of hiring-based complaints also charge wrongful termination and may not have been registered had it not been for termination. | [('…of', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('gender-', 'JJ'), ('and', 'CC'), ('race-based', 'JJ'), ('complaints', 'NNS'), ('filed', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('EEOC', 'NNP'), ('between', 'IN'), ('1992', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1996', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('58', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('claimed', 'VBD'), ('wrongful', 'JJ'), ('termination', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('5.6', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('for', 'IN'), ('discriminatory', 'JJ'), ('hiring', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('with', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('rest', 'NN'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('on-the-job', 'JJ'), ('practices', 'NNS'), ('such', 'JJ'), ('as', 'IN'), ('unequal', 'JJ'), ('pay', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('denial', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('promotion', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('or', 'CC'), ('harassment', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('figures', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('actually', 'RB'), ('overstate', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('importance', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('hiring', 'VBG'), ('cases', 'NNS'), ('as', 'IN'), ('approximately', 'RB'), ('10', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('hiring-based', 'JJ'), ('complaints', 'NNS'), ('also', 'RB'), ('charge', 'VBP'), ('wrongful', 'JJ'), ('termination', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('may', 'MD'), ('not', 'RB'), ('have', 'VB'), ('been', 'VBN'), ('registered', 'VBN'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('it', 'PRP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('been', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('termination', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | National Longitudinal Survey of Youth | …because this data is administered to the same people each year, it samples ages each year and, in turn, researchers are forced to drop the youngest pre-Civil Rights Act of 1991 observations and the oldest post-Civil Rights Act of 1991 observations in order to measure the returns to experience over comparable ranges of experience. | [('…because', 'IN'), ('this', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('administered', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('same', 'JJ'), ('people', 'NNS'), ('each', 'DT'), ('year', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('it', 'PRP'), ('samples', 'VBZ'), ('ages', 'NNS'), ('each', 'DT'), ('year', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('turn', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('researchers', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('forced', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('drop', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('youngest', 'JJS'), ('pre-Civil', 'JJ'), ('Rights', 'NNP'), ('Act', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1991', 'CD'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('oldest', 'JJS'), ('post-Civil', 'JJ'), ('Rights', 'NNP'), ('Act', 'NNP'), ('of', 'IN'), ('1991', 'CD'), ('observations', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('measure', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('returns', 'NNS'), ('to', 'TO'), ('experience', 'VB'), ('over', 'RP'), ('comparable', 'JJ'), ('ranges', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('experience', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …while the sample consists of less than 100,000 people substantially fewer than the American Community Survey or the decennial censuses, the CPS does ask the relevant questions about within-household relationships that the author needs to construct various headship measures. This data also has the advantage of being available annually over a relatively long time span. | [('…while', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('consists', 'VBZ'), ('of', 'IN'), ('less', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('100,000', 'CD'), ('people', 'NNS'), ('substantially', 'RB'), ('fewer', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('American', 'NNP'), ('Community', 'NNP'), ('Survey', 'NNP'), ('or', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('decennial', 'JJ'), ('censuses', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('does', 'VBZ'), ('ask', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('relevant', 'JJ'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('about', 'IN'), ('within-household', 'JJ'), ('relationships', 'NNS'), ('that', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('author', 'NN'), ('needs', 'VBZ'), ('to', 'TO'), ('construct', 'VB'), ('various', 'JJ'), ('headship', 'NN'), ('measures', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('data', 'NN'), ('also', 'RB'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('the', 'DT'), ('advantage', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('being', 'VBG'), ('available', 'JJ'), ('annually', 'RB'), ('over', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('relatively', 'RB'), ('long', 'JJ'), ('time', 'NN'), ('span', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | American Community Survey | …the 2005 ACS, while a full 1% sample, did not contain information on the population in group quarters, such as prisons or college dormitories. While the researcher drops the group quarters population from his data anyway, since by definition they do not live in households, the 2005 sample is not comparable to later samples because of differences in the available population weights. In the 2005 data, individuals in households with similar demographic characteristics as those in group quarters receive larger weights in order to match the overall population estimates. The difference in weights throws off even non-group quarters comparisons with later years in ways that may not be obvious to researchers. | [('…the', 'NN'), ('2005', 'CD'), ('ACS', 'NNP'), (',', ','), Dataset | FRBNY/Equifax | …in order to examine the effect of credit-related constraints on headship decisions, this research uses information from the FRBNY/Equifax consumer credit panel, which is a 5% random sample of credit-related information from all individuals with credit records and Social Security numbers. This research focuses in particular on individuals' credit scores and the presence of a foreclosure on their credit report. | [('…in', 'JJ'), ('order', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('examine', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('effect', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('credit-related', 'JJ'), ('constraints', 'NNS'), ('on', 'IN'), ('headship', 'NN'), ('decisions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('this', 'DT'), ('research', 'NN'), ('uses', 'VBZ'), ('information', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('FRBNY/Equifax', 'NNP'), ('consumer', 'NN'), ('credit', 'NN'), ('panel', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('a', 'DT'), ('5', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('random', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('credit-related', 'JJ'), ('information', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('all', 'DT'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('credit', 'NN'), ('records', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('Social', 'NNP'), ('Security', 'NNP'), ('numbers', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('This', 'DT'), ('research', 'NN'), ('focuses', 'VBZ'), ('in', 'IN'), ('particular', 'JJ'), ('on', 'IN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ("'", 'POS'), ('credit', 'NN'), ('scores', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('presence', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('foreclosure', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('credit', 'NN'), ('report', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | OECD | …the organization for Economic Cooperation and Development Reports the United States high school graduation rate in 2004 at 75%, compared with 83% among EU nations. The United States high school graduation rate was in the bottom third of twenty-six OECD nations in 2004. The United States ranked only seventh out of the twenty richest OECD nations in 2004. The United States ranked only seventh out of the twenty richest OECD nations in secondary school completion among 25- to 34-year-olds in 2004, even when the General Educational Development diploma recipients are included as secondary school completers. This data also indicates taht the United States is at about the OECD average for four-year college completion rates among young cohort, trailing twelve other nations. | [('…the', 'JJ'), Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the CPS monthly earnings files have earnings and wages imputed by the Census using a "cell hot deck" procedure, in which the Census "allocates" (assigns) to nonrespondents the reported earnings of a matched donor who has an identical mix of  measured attributes. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('monthly', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('wages', 'NNS'), ('imputed', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('cell', 'NN'), ('hot', 'JJ'), ('deck', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('procedure', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('which', 'WDT'), ('the', 'DT'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('``', '``'), ('allocates', 'NNS'), ("''", "''"), ('(', '('), ('assigns', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), ('to', 'TO'), ('nonrespondents', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('reported', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('matched', 'VBN'), ('donor', 'NN'), ('who', 'WP'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('an', 'DT'), ('identical', 'JJ'), ('mix', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('measured', 'VBN'), ('attributes', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …analysis in this article uses the CPS Outgoing Rotation Group (ORG) monthly earnings files, prepared by the Census for use by the BLS, which then makes these files publicly available. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the sample design of the CPS is that individuals are included in the survey for 8 months - 4 consecutive months in the survey followed by 8 months out, followed by 4 months in (the same month as in the previous year). | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('design', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('that', 'IN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('included', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('8', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('-', ':'), ('4', 'CD'), ('consecutive', 'JJ'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('followed', 'VBD'), ('by', 'IN'), ('8', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('out', 'IN'), (',', ','), ('followed', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('4', 'CD'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('(', '('), ('the', 'DT'), ('same', 'JJ'), ('month', 'NN'), ('as', 'IN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('year', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …during the period 1979 to 1993, approximately 15% of employed wage and salary workers had imputed values included for usual weekly earnings. The CPS earnings questions were revised in 1994. The increased complexity and sequencing of earnings questions led to a substantial increase in imputation rates. Publicly available earnings files for January 1994 through August 1995 do not identify those with imputed earnings. Beginning in September 1995, valid earnings allocation flags are included. Imputations rose from about 22% in 1996 to about 30% in the period from 2000 to 2004. | [('…during', 'VBG'), ('the', 'DT'), ('period', 'NN'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1993', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('approximately', 'RB'), ('15', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('employed', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('salary', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('had', 'VBD'), ('imputed', 'VBN'), ('values', 'NNS'), ('included', 'VBD'), ('for', 'IN'), ('usual', 'JJ'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('revised', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1994', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('increased', 'JJ'), ('complexity', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('sequencing', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('questions', 'NNS'), ('led', 'VBD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('a', 'DT'), ('substantial', 'JJ'), ('increase', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('imputation', 'NN'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Publicly', 'NNP'), ('available', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('for', 'IN'), ('January', 'NNP'), ('1994', 'CD'), ('through', 'IN'), ('August', 'NNP'), ('1995', 'CD'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('identify', 'VB'), ('those', 'DT'), ('with', 'IN'), ('imputed', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Beginning', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('September', 'NNP'), ('1995', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('valid', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('allocation', 'NN'), ('flags', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('included', 'VBN'), ('.', '.'), ('Imputations', 'NNS'), ('rose', 'VBD'), ('from', 'IN'), ('about', 'IN'), ('22', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1996', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('about', 'IN'), ('30', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('period', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('2000', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2004', 'CD'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …prior to 1979, the earnings supplement was administered to all rotation groups in May 1973 through May 1979. Nonrespondents are included in the May 1973 to 1978 earnings files, but they do not have their earnings imputed. Approximately 20% of employed wage and salary workers in the May 1973 to 1978 files have no value (or the "missing" value) included in the usual weekly earnings field. | [('…prior', 'RB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1979', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('supplement', 'NN'), ('was', 'VBD'), ('administered', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('all', 'DT'), ('rotation', 'NN'), ('groups', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('May', 'NNP'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('through', 'IN'), ('May', 'NNP'), ('1979', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Nonrespondents', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('included', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('May', 'NNP'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1978', 'CD'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('files', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('but', 'CC'), ('they', 'PRP'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('have', 'VB'), ('their', 'PRP$'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('imputed', 'VBN'), ('.', '.'), ('Approximately', 'RB'), ('20', 'CD'), ('%', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('employed', 'JJ'), ('wage', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('salary', 'JJ'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('May', 'NNP'), ('1973', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1978', 'CD'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('have', 'VBP'), ('no', 'DT'), ('value', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('or', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('missing', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('value', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('included', 'VBD'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('usual', 'JJ'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('field', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …earnings allocation flags are not reliable during the period 1989 to 1993. Imputed earners can be identified based on those who do and do not have an entry in the unedited usual weekly earnings field. | [('…earnings', 'NNS'), ('allocation', 'NN'), ('flags', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('not', 'RB'), ('reliable', 'JJ'), ('during', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('period', 'NN'), ('1989', 'CD'), ('to', 'TO'), ('1993', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Imputed', 'VBN'), ('earners', 'NNS'), ('can', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('identified', 'VBN'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('who', 'WP'), ('do', 'VBP'), ('and', 'CC'), ('do', 'VB'), ('not', 'RB'), ('have', 'VB'), ('an', 'DT'), ('entry', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('unedited', 'JJ'), ('usual', 'JJ'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('field', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …earnings in the CPS-ORG are imputed using a "cell hot deck" method. There has been minor variation in the hot deck match criteria over time. For the ORG files during the 1979-93 period, the Census created a hot deck, or cells containing 11,232 possible combinations based on the following seven categories: gender (2 cells), age (6), race (2), education (3), occupation (13), hours worked (6), and receipt of tips, commissions, or overtime (2). | [('…earnings', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS-ORG', 'NNP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('imputed', 'VBN'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('cell', 'NN'), ('hot', 'JJ'), ('deck', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('method', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('There', 'EX'), ('has', 'VBZ'), ('been', 'VBN'), ('minor', 'JJ'), ('variation', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('hot', 'JJ'), ('deck', 'NN'), ('match', 'NN'), ('criteria', 'NNS'), ('over', 'IN'), ('time', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('For', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('ORG', 'NNP'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('during', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1979-93', 'JJ'), ('period', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('created', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('hot', 'JJ'), ('deck', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('or', 'CC'), ('cells', 'NNS'), ('containing', 'VBG'), ('11,232', 'CD'), ('possible', 'JJ'), ('combinations', 'NNS'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('following', 'VBG'), ('seven', 'CD'), ('categories', 'NNS'), (':', ':'), ('gender', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('2', 'CD'), ('cells', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('age', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('6', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('race', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('2', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('education', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('3', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('occupation', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('13', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('worked', 'VBD'), ('(', '('), ('6', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('receipt', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('tips', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('commissions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('or', 'CC'), ('overtime', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('2', 'CD'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the selection categories changed slightly in 1994 and 2003. Beginning in 1994, two additional hour cells were added for workers reporting variable hours, one for those who usually work full time and one for those who usually work part time, resulting in eight "hours worked" cells and 14,976 possible combinations. Beginning in January 2003, the CPS adopted the 2000 Census occupation codes (COC), which involved a substantial revision from the 1980 and 1990 COC. Detailed occupation codes are grouped into 10 major categories, in contrast to 13 prior to 2003, resulting in 11,520 match cells. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('selection', 'NN'), ('categories', 'NNS'), ('changed', 'VBD'), ('slightly', 'RB'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1994', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('2003', 'CD'), ('.', '.'), ('Beginning', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('1994', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('two', 'CD'), ('additional', 'JJ'), ('hour', 'NN'), ('cells', 'NNS'), ('were', 'VBD'), ('added', 'VBN'), ('for', 'IN'), ('workers', 'NNS'), ('reporting', 'VBG'), ('variable', 'JJ'), ('hours', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('one', 'CD'), ('for', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('who', 'WP'), ('usually', 'RB'), ('work', 'VBP'), ('full', 'JJ'), ('time', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('one', 'CD'), ('for', 'IN'), ('those', 'DT'), ('who', 'WP'), ('usually', 'RB'), ('work', 'VBP'), ('part', 'NN'), ('time', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('resulting', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('eight', 'CD'), ('``', '``'), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('worked', 'VBN'), ("''", "''"), ('cells', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('14,976', 'CD'), ('possible', 'JJ'), ('combinations', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Beginning', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('January', 'NNP'), ('2003', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('adopted', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('2000', 'CD'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('occupation', 'NN'), ('codes', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('COC', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('involved', 'VBD'), ('a', 'DT'), ('substantial', 'JJ'), ('revision', 'NN'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('1980', 'CD'), ('and', 'CC'), ('1990', 'CD'), ('COC', 'NNP'), ('.', '.'), ('Detailed', 'VBN'), ('occupation', 'NN'), ('codes', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('grouped', 'VBN'), ('into', 'IN'), ('10', 'CD'), ('major', 'JJ'), ('categories', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('in', 'IN'), ('contrast', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('13', 'CD'), ('prior', 'RB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('2003', 'CD'), (',', ','), ('resulting', 'VBG'), ('in', 'IN'), ('11,520', 'CD'), ('match', 'NN'), ('cells', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …at the start of each month's survey, cells are stocked with ending donors from the prior month. The Census retains donors until replaced, reaching back for donors as far as necessary, first within a given survey month and then to previous months and years. If needed, a donor value is used more than once. | [('…at', 'VB'), ('the', 'DT'), ('start', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('each', 'DT'), ('month', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('survey', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('cells', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('stocked', 'VBN'), ('with', 'IN'), ('ending', 'VBG'), ('donors', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('prior', 'JJ'), ('month', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('retains', 'VBZ'), ('donors', 'NNS'), ('until', 'IN'), ('replaced', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('reaching', 'VBG'), ('back', 'RP'), ('for', 'IN'), ('donors', 'NNS'), ('as', 'RB'), ('far', 'RB'), ('as', 'IN'), ('necessary', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('first', 'RB'), ('within', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('given', 'VBN'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('month', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('then', 'RB'), ('to', 'TO'), ('previous', 'JJ'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('and', 'CC'), ('years', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('If', 'IN'), ('needed', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('a', 'DT'), ('donor', 'NN'), ('value', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('than', 'IN'), ('once', 'RB'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the Census does not retain information on cell refresh rates or the average "freshness" of donors. A trade-off exists. Less detailed match characteristics would produce more frequent refreshing of cells but would results in lower quality matches. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('does', 'VBZ'), ('not', 'RB'), ('retain', 'VB'), ('information', 'NN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('cell', 'NN'), ('refresh', 'JJ'), ('rates', 'NNS'), ('or', 'CC'), ('the', 'DT'), ('average', 'JJ'), ('``', '``'), ('freshness', 'JJ'), ("''", "''"), ('of', 'IN'), ('donors', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('A', 'DT'), ('trade-off', 'JJ'), ('exists', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Less', 'NNP'), ('detailed', 'JJ'), ('match', 'NN'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), ('would', 'MD'), ('produce', 'VB'), ('more', 'JJR'), ('frequent', 'JJ'), ('refreshing', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('cells', 'NNS'), ('but', 'CC'), ('would', 'MD'), ('results', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('lower', 'JJR'), ('quality', 'NN'), ('matches', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …unlike the ORGs, the March CPS annual demographic files (ADF) use a "sequential rather than "cell" hot deck imputation procedure to impute earnings (and income). Nonrespondents are matched to donors from within the same March survey in sequential steps, each step involving a less detailed match requirement. | [('…unlike', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('ORGs', 'NNP'), (',', ','), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('annual', 'JJ'), ('demographic', 'JJ'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('ADF', 'NNP'), (')', ')'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('a', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('sequential', 'JJ'), ('rather', 'RB'), ('than', 'IN'), ('``', '``'), ('cell', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('hot', 'JJ'), ('deck', 'NN'), ('imputation', 'NN'), ('procedure', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('impute', 'VB'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('(', '('), ('and', 'CC'), ('income', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('.', '.'), ('Nonrespondents', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('matched', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('donors', 'NNS'), ('from', 'IN'), ('within', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('same', 'JJ'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('sequential', 'JJ'), ('steps', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('each', 'DT'), ('step', 'NN'), ('involving', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('less', 'RBR'), ('detailed', 'JJ'), ('match', 'NN'), ('requirement', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | ...files are sorted by location and nonrespondents are matched to the most recent matching donor. Thus, a donor is (roughly) the geographically closest person moving backward in the file. Nonrespondents with an unusually common mix of characteristcs may be matched to someone in a similar neighborhood. More likely, donors are found in different neighborhoods, cities, states, regions, or months. | [('...', ':'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('sorted', 'VBN'), ('by', 'IN'), ('location', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('nonrespondents', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('matched', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('most', 'RBS'), ('recent', 'JJ'), ('matching', 'NN'), ('donor', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Thus', 'RB'), (',', ','), ('a', 'DT'), ('donor', 'NN'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('(', '('), ('roughly', 'RB'), (')', ')'), ('the', 'DT'), ('geographically', 'RB'), ('closest', 'JJS'), ('person', 'NN'), ('moving', 'VBG'), ('backward', 'RB'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('file', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Nonrespondents', 'NNS'), ('with', 'IN'), ('an', 'DT'), ('unusually', 'RB'), ('common', 'JJ'), ('mix', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('characteristcs', 'NN'), ('may', 'MD'), ('be', 'VB'), ('matched', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('someone', 'NN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('a', 'DT'), ('similar', 'JJ'), ('neighborhood', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('More', 'RBR'), ('likely', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('donors', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('found', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('different', 'JJ'), ('neighborhoods', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('cities', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('states', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('regions', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('or', 'CC'), ('months', 'NNS'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in the CPS hot deck procedure, many imputations derive from observations from previous months, some of which may not be included in the estimation sample. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the sample in estimating the wage gap with respect to selected attributes that are not match criteria is drawn from the CPS-ORG for the period 1998 to 2002. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …in the March CPS bias correction assumes that the draw for the imputation is from the same distribution as the rest of the sample. The imputation draws from the conditonal distribution including the specific match charactersitics. With dated donors from prior months, this is not literally true in the ORGs. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …to assess the seriousness of dated donor problems, one must approximate Census hot deck methods and measure the datedness of donor earnings. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …to approximate the Census match rate in the initial month, the donor pool is constructed by taking a 50% random sample of December 2002 respondents. The Census searches for donors amonth those who are listed in the file layout prior to the nonrespondent. Thus nonrespondents at the beginning of the December 2002 file are assigned donors from November 2002 or earlier, whereas nonrespondents at the end of the file can be matched to the full month donor sample. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …as widely recognized, many individuals surveyed in the CPS (and other household surveys) either refuse to report their earnings or "proxy" respondents in their household are unable to report earnings. Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the U.S. Census allocates earnings using a "hot deck" imputation method that matches each nonrespondent to an individual or "donor" whose characteristics are identical. The donor's reported earnings are then assigned to the nonrespondent. Among the more important characteristics used in matching a donor to a nonrespondent are gender, age, education and hours worked, four strong correlates of earnings. Two characteristics not used are union status and sector (e.g., industry) of employment. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('U.S.', 'NNP'), ('Census', 'NNP'), ('allocates', 'VBZ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('hot', 'JJ'), ('deck', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('imputation', 'NN'), ('method', 'NN'), ('that', 'WDT'), ('matches', 'VBZ'), ('each', 'DT'), ('nonrespondent', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('an', 'DT'), ('individual', 'NN'), ('or', 'CC'), ('``', '``'), ('donor', 'JJ'), ("''", "''"), ('whose', 'WP$'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('identical', 'JJ'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('donor', 'NN'), ("'s", 'POS'), ('reported', 'VBN'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('then', 'RB'), ('assigned', 'VBN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('the', 'DT'), ('nonrespondent', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('Among', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('more', 'RBR'), ('important', 'JJ'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('matching', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('donor', 'NN'), ('to', 'TO'), ('a', 'DT'), ('nonrespondent', 'NN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('gender', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('age', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('education', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('worked', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('four', 'CD'), ('strong', 'JJ'), ('correlates', 'NNS'), ('of', 'IN'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('.', '.'), ('Two', 'CD'), ('characteristics', 'NNS'), ('not', 'RB'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('union', 'NN'), ('status', 'NN'), ('and', 'CC'), ('sector', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('e.g.', 'JJ'), (',', ','), ('industry', 'NN'), (')', ')'), ('of', 'IN'), ('employment', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]

Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the March CPS Annual Demographic Files allocates missing earnings using a unique "hot deck" imputation method. Using this method, matching of a nonrespondent with a donor is done in steps, with each step involving a less detailed match requirement. For example, suppose that there were just four matching variables - sex, age, education, and occupation. The matching program would first attempt to find an exact match on the combination of variables where each is segmented at a relatively detailed level. When there is not a successful match at a given level, matching proceeds to the next step, where a less detailed breakdown is used, say, broader occupations and age categories. The probability of a close match declines the less comon are an individual's characteristics. | [('…the', 'IN'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('Annual', 'NNP'), ('Demographic', 'NNP'), ('Files', 'NNP'), ('allocates', 'VBZ'), ('missing', 'VBG'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), ('using', 'VBG'), ('a', 'DT'), ('unique', 'JJ'), ('``', '``'), ('hot', 'JJ'), ('deck', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('imputation', 'NN'), ('relatively', 'RB'), ('detailed', 'JJ'), ('level', 'NN'), ('.', '.'), ('When', 'WRB'), ('there', 'EX'), ('is', 'VBZ'), ('not', 'RB'), ('a', 'DT'), ('successful', 'JJ'), ('match', 'NN'), ('at', 'IN'), Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the CPS-ORG files are made up of the quarter sample of individuals in the monthly survey who are asked, among other things, usual weekly earnings, hours worked, and union status. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('CPS-ORG', 'NNP'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('made', 'VBN'), ('up', 'IN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('quarter', 'NN'), ('sample', 'NN'), ('of', 'IN'), ('individuals', 'NNS'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('monthly', 'JJ'), ('survey', 'NN'), ('who', 'WP'), ('are', 'VBP'), ('asked', 'VBN'), (',', ','), ('among', 'IN'), ('other', 'JJ'), ('things', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('usual', 'JJ'), ('weekly', 'JJ'), ('earnings', 'NNS'), (',', ','), ('hours', 'NNS'), ('worked', 'VBD'), (',', ','), ('and', 'CC'), ('union', 'NN'), ('status', 'NN'), ('.', '.')]
Dataset | Current Population Survey | …the CPS-ORG files use an imputation procedure called the "cell hot deck" method, which differs from the method used in the March CPS. The census creates cells based on the following seven categories: gender (2 cells), age (6), race (2), education (3), occupation (13), hours worked (8), and receipt of tips, commisions, or overtime (2), a matrix of 14,976 possible combinations. The census keeps all cells "stocked" with a donor insuring that an exact match is always found. The donor in each cell is the most recent person surveyed by the census with reported earnings and all the characteristics. When a new person with those characteristics is surveyd and reports earnings, the census replaces the previous occupation of the cell. To insure an occupant of each cell, the census reaches back as far as necessary within a given survey month and then to previous months and years. When surveyed individuals do not report earnings, their earnings are imputed by assigning the value of (nominal) earnings reported by the current donor occupying the cell with an exact match of characteristics. | [('…the', 'JJ'), ('CPS-ORG', 'NNP'), ('files', 'NNS'), ('use', 'VBP'), ('an', 'DT'), ('imputation', 'NN'), ('procedure', 'NN'), ('called', 'VBD'), ('the', 'DT'), ('``', '``'), ('cell', 'NN'), ('hot', 'JJ'), ('deck', 'NN'), ("''", "''"), ('method', 'NN'), (',', ','), ('which', 'WDT'), ('differs', 'VBZ'), ('from', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('method', 'NN'), ('used', 'VBN'), ('in', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('March', 'NNP'), ('CPS', 'NNP'), ('.', '.'), ('The', 'DT'), ('census', 'NN'), ('creates', 'VBZ'), ('cells', 'NNS'), ('based', 'VBN'), ('on', 'IN'), ('the', 'DT'), ('following', 'VBG'), ('seven', 'CD'), ('categories', 'NNS'), (':', ':'), ('gender', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('2', 'CD'), ('cells', 'NNS'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('age', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('6', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('race', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('2', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('education', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('3', 'CD'), (')', ')'), (',', ','), ('occupation', 'NN'), ('(', '('), ('13',
